reviews.text: My backround so as to judge this entry fairly is that I am a medical professional, have been to 8 all inclusive resorts, and in my early forties and act in my early thirties. This was kind a bummer trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned to WI. a week ago from paradise. This place was the most wonderful,relaxing and well kept resort I have ever seen. The staff were the most friendly people I've run into in a long time. It was like they knew you for years. And also very helpful.
reviews.title: This Resort is the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from Excellence on Aug 3. My husband and I were celebrating our first anniversary. We both agreed that we had an even better time than we did on our honeymoon. I honestly think that the people who wrote negative reviews would not be happy anywhere.
reviews.title: Excellence es muy excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room: We stayed in a jr garden suite. We were given the option to upgrade to the excellence club at check-in and were very glad we did not. Our room was clean, the AC worked well and the bath was very nice. They kept our mini-bar well stocked and even gave us a bottle of rum.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise
paradise
reviews.text: The Beach: This was the nicest beach we had ever stayed at. There were always chairs in sun or shade so plenty of room to fall asleep on the beach. Yes, there were waves but they were small by Jersey Shore standards and if the water was too rough there was always the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food: The food was excellent we have been to other all-inclusives (Sandals, Iberostar) and Excellence was superior. The service was always great. We went to all the restaurants except Agave and all were 5-star quality. We never waited more than 15 min for a table and our glasses were never empty.
reviews.title: Excellence couldn't have been better!
Excellente.....indeed it was!
reviews.text: The Staff: The staff was what made Excellence so wonderful. Everyone made us feel very welcome and were more than happy to help us work on our spanish. Fransisco taught us some wonderful spanish lessons, and Fransisco the bell-boy was very helpful taking our bags when leaving. Kenny at the Kaffe bar was great he helped us learn more spanish and was fun to talk to. Super Luis is great on the beach allowing people to get together for beach volleyball and encouragaing people to learn Dominican dances. All of the hostesses at the resturants were awesome, they escort the ladies to the tables and are very nice and welcoming. The omlet chef es un professionale- and is very polite and good to talk to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at EPC for two weeks in June/July 08 and had a fantastic holiday. Arrived at the airport after a trouble free flight on First Choice Airline and the VIP Tours bus took us and 3 other people straight to the resort. As others have mentioned the roads are particularly bad and the journey took 1hr so we were pleased not to stop off at other hotels on the way.
reviews.title: 4.5 out of 5 for Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was great. We didn't receive a glass of champagne but after emailing in advance a room request (overlooking the cascade pool) we were delighted to see that they had my request on the computer when checking in. We were in block 2 on the middle floor and thought it was great. There were two large double beds and the room had a great view. The rooms were clean and were always cleaned by 2pm latest (just in time for an afternoon sleep :) Mini bar always stocked and we always had everything we wanted. We had room service twice and it was much better the second time. On the first night we had to wait 1 ½ and then our order wasn’t right and the rest of it was cold. The second time the food was hot but it still took just over 1hr. We had factored this in so just took a few drinks up to our room before hand.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is good with lots of palapas for shade (as long as you get there by 10.30am) and the water was rough but fun. The red flag was up everyday but the lifeguard was always present. As others have said, up on the right the water is much calmer but snorkeling was rubbish. We spent most of our time by the main pool (which was beautiful) and were always pretty much first out in the morning. Even at 7.30am some people had reserved the shady areas and never turned up until 11am or later! There were towels laid out on the sun beds and you could also walk to the clubhouse to get fresh ones. Everyday at around 10am someone would come round with a tray of ‘drink of the day’ which was always nice. There were also a lot of pool floats available although there were a few selfish people who kept one by their sun beds. We took a lilo with us but never used it.
reviews.title: Overall a Wonderful Experience!

likes.liked: — The beauty of the resort and the view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment team were great especially Ronaldo who is a real sweetie. I was really pleased to see that both men and women participated in all the ‘games’ and we had loads of fun (especially water volleyball – SPENCER!!!) They all worked really hard without being pushy and were really friendly. We met some lovely people from the USA and UK and were sorry to see them go as things were much quieter after their departure.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT PLACE FOR A LAID BACK VACATION
Excellente!!!!
reviews.text: The drinks were limitless and fantastic. All the bar staff I came across were polite and friendly and the waiters around the pool were fantastic (especially Pedro). We didn’t always tip but still received fantastic service. The restaurants were good and I think you would be hard pushed not to find something you liked. Breakfast was lovely – huge choice and fresh. Lunch was nice too. Lots to choose from, stone baked pizza, pasta, salad, desserts, soups, meats, cheeses, bread etc. We didn’t eat at the beach but lunch usually smelt fantastic (especially the BBQ).

reviews.title: Very disappointing
reviews.text: RIGHT HERE GOES-Just returned from 14 nights at Secrets and all I can say is its good to be home. Like others I spent a long time reading these reviews and thought I knew what to expect. On reading some of the negative ones I honestly thought t cant be that bad if its a 5* hotel. Im sorry to say I was wrong. The ride from the airport is really not a problem and the driver done well to make it comfortable. 1st impressions of the hotel, again very good, rooms and grounds are very clean, very nice and to a high standard, worthy of the 5 stars given. Food on the most part was very good and we could always get something we liked, A few problems like no English tea in the morning (they ran out apparently) & no cold milk most mornings for your cereal, may seem petty but after 2 wks gets a bit much, Not the kind of thing that should happen in a 5* hotel. The overall service throughout was very very poor indeed, everything just seemed to be very unorganised. Several times we were given the wrong order or other peoples orders, 1 time we were actually given the next tables food and my husband had eaten a piece not realising, then the waiter came up and took the plate from our table and put it on the next one!!!! Incase your wondering Yes we did tip, often and well but it made no difference. The beds are so uncomfortable, I was in agony every day with it. If your planning on peace and quiet then beware, theres work being carried out and the noise most days was pretty unbearable. The pools are lovely, but getting a bed proves a little difficult, we were up at 7am every morning and still missed out at times, this was partly due to some Americans having 2 beds in the sun, 2 in the shade & 2 floats under their beds even though they were asked repeatedly to leave them in the water. We even seen a couple reserve all these beds & then go inside, they never re-appeared until after 3 pm, so selfish!!! We also seen them in the pool with up to as many as 4 floats piled high, god forbid anyone else have a go for 10 mins!!! I know that your thinking, your on holiday chill out & enjoy, the pace is slower in DR, we do know this we have been to the caribbean several times now but have never experienced anything like it, by the end of the vacation we were like "CAN WE PLEASE HAVE A DIET COKE AND A BEER" not asking much!!!! Also the hotel is bad for getting pestered during the day at the pool, even if your asleep, there is people round constantly asking you to do things & a polite "NO GRACIOUS" doesnt do the trick, then theres the night time stalls who also dont take no for an answer, we ended up going detours all the time to avoid them. Also dont bother putting your do not disturb signs up, they are just ignored anyway. The people are very nice and do work long & hard hours, its just the organisation that let the place down. Not the relaxing experience it should have been. In a nutshell would we go back? - "NO GRACIOUS" TAKE OUR ADVICE PAY THE EXTRA AND GO TO ONE OF THE PALACE RESORTS IN MEXICO!! Please feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions.

reviews.title: Not Bad
reviews.text: I stayed down there for my honeymoon the week of 11/8-11/15. We got a free upgrade to this hotel because of damage to our original hotel by all the hurricanes. The hotel itself was awesome. They were always cleaning it and all the staff was very nice. All the food was good except for the seafood. There is plenty to do on the resort itself (trust me, I should know since we only had one full day of sunshine). There is nothing for you outside of the resort except for poverty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004
reviews.text: The only real disappointment of the entire trip was the beach. It is not the pure white sand and crystal clear calm waters of Cancun. It is still the atlantic and the water was very rough. So rough in fact that we were only able to go into the water 1 day our entire week down there, and our snorkling trip got canceled 3 days in a row. We found ways to make our money go to use by getting massages intead.
reviews.title: Just Back From Secrets-Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004
reviews.text: Watch out for a drink called Mamma Wanna. It should be called a mind eraser because after 5 of those, I didn't remember the evening!
reviews.title: I guess it depends
honest review
reviews.text: Overall, the resort was very, very nice. The weather was not very good, but that can't be controlled. The beach was a disappointment. I enjoyed my trip but would not go back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Driving from the airport was a litle hassle and once we arrived I thought "Oh my God this can't be. The Dominican resorts don't have the curb appeal like Cancun, but that was quickly dispelled once we got in the hotel property. A courteous driver from VIP Service, a cool towel, cold champagne and warm greetings got us started on the right note.
reviews.title: Excellence is an appropiate name for this resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relax and enjoy, we neeeded a short stay to unwind and were sceptical about booking for more than four days since we had heard some negative comments about the DR. "Forget Agout It"
reviews.title: Another Excellence Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in a state of depression when Sunday came and it was time to go home. My wife and I have been to over a dozen all inclusives in five different countries and this was the best by far.
reviews.title: The name sums it all up... EXCELLENT!!!

likes.liked: — The food, beach, pool, and staff.
likes.disliked: — Supposed daily activites that didn't happen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only way to get better is to be a millionaire and reserve a villa with cooks, butler and private beach.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon at the Excellence

likes.disliked: — Skimp on the drinks quite a bit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: The suite was roomy , super view of the ocean and extremely clean. The food was 9.5 out of 10. The French and Japanese were our favorite but the Grill had a nice filet, the choices were many and the days few only four so I am sure we would have repeated a few of the restaurants.
reviews.title: "Excellence"...not really

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful. The staff did a wonderful job of keeping everything clean and tending to every need. Food was delicious and plentiful. Drinks were definitely plentiful but inconsistent in flavor. Of course after a few, I didn't notice as much! All the staff were very friendly and seemed to enjoy their jobs. This was our second stay at Excellence with a group of 5 couples. I highly recommend getting a swimout room.
reviews.title: Lots of fun in the sun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Excellence was one of three hotels referred to me by my travel agent. (who is awesome). After researching all three, I went with Excellence and ever after some reviews I am glad I did!
reviews.title: Loved it, read it all for great info.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off there were 20 females in my group. (We have a travel group, great fun, annual trip each year, email for info going to Panama City July 2013) and we were treated like queens! I had read some reviews that said that this resort treats Europeans much better than Americans and that is far from the truth.
reviews.title: Best Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I will try to sum things up fairly:
reviews.title: Excellent Done It Again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Distance: 50-60 minutes from the airport. The drives can be scary.
reviews.title: Excellence is the perfect name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited the Excellence Punta Cana resort May 4-May 10, and loved every minute of my trip. Everything was so organized from the minute we stepped foot into the Punta Cana airport. There was the transport to the hotel, which was easy to locate and very comfortable!
reviews.title: Loved It...Loved It!!!

likes.liked: — Staff (especially the entertainment staff), food, beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at our resort, it looked amazing and even more amazing was we were presented with wet towels and champagne after getting off of the bus. The check in was easy and quick!
reviews.title: Okay time at the Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was absolute paradise, with lounge chairs and waiters at your finger tips. The beach even had hammocks and beds on it! It was truly unbelievable! The pool was the same, just perfect! There were more then enough lounge chairs and beds, and the pool was large enough that you can have a whole private area just to yourself.
reviews.title: Vey nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment staff was the best! They kept you going if you chose from morning until night. Thank you so much FRANKLIN, JOEL, and JULIO; You guys were the best! The staff had many different activities for all people and all interests, but was not pushy in making you do anything. Thats what I loved best! However, they made everything a lot of fun! WE MISS YOU FRANKLIN! Thank you for not being too busy to talk with us and teach us about your culture, as well as learn about ours! We are definitely coming back to see you three and we also told our parents about the entertainment staff and encouraged them to go! Hope to see you soon!
reviews.title: Excellence is Bueno
The Excellance Resort.. a week in Paradise
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful; A large jacuzzi in the center. Our room had the swim out pool, which was a nice added feature to get because that pool is very private with no more than ten guests at one time. We loved it. The rooms and the property was always kept clean: spotless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and I just returned from a 7 night stay at Excellence, and it was Excellent! (Feb.10-17) There are a few minor set backs, but nothing that can not be dealt with.
reviews.title: All Inclusive Honeymoon Dream!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beach/Pools: The beach was wonderful, with palm trees, tiki huts, lay out matresses, and canopied beds. The pools were equally as nice with plenty of places to lay out and enjoy the nice clean water. Guests can find nice quiet pockets to relax in, or mingle with other guests and enjoy a social experience.****A helpful note for all newcomers: You must wake up early to reserve the premiere spots at the beach or pool. Guests will mark their spots as early at 7am. If not, you will still find a spot, but not the top locations.
reviews.title: As good as Excellence can be

likes.liked: — The amazing staff, options for laying out at the beach and serenity.
likes.disliked: — The only bad part of the trip and accomodations was that I had to go home. I'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: We enjoyed the nice variety of food offered, and didn't have many meals we did not like. Our favorite restaraunt was 'Spice' & 'Barcelona', and the least favorite was 'The Grill'. We never ate at Lobster House or Chez Isabelle. The buffet lunch at Toscana is always a delicious bet, and room service food is good as well. Oh, and the pizza's that are delivered poolside are wonderful!!!
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Everyone had a very cheery disposition and were always quick to say 'Hola' or 'Excellente'. There were some communication barriers at times though. For instance missed wake up calls, us not getting everything in our honeymoon package until persistent calling and following up. (That was annoying). However, room service and the 'Excellence Club' was great! At the end of the day, patience is required, but they are friendly and quick staff.
reviews.title: Paradise, Indeed!

likes.disliked: — Evening entertainment doesn't begin until 10:00 P.M.!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bars: Great drinks and excellent service! Ask for a Sammie Sosa. :) Also, be sure to ask for some 'Mama Wanna', as well. (I believe the stuff is illegal in the states). **Also, don't forget to request your liquor of choice. They have all of the premium liquors available....go for it!! (oh...and they have very 'generous portions)
reviews.title: Excellence Punta Cana is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I rang in the New Year at Excellence Punta Cana! since New York was FREEZING at the time, I was just happy to be in the sun. My husband and I had a great time overall. However, I was a little surprised to see this hotel rating itself as a 5-star facility (more like a 4). All of the basics were covered, but some of the details that I would expect from a 5-star place were missing. The bed, although comfortable creaked loudly and I couldn’t tell whether or not the headboard was attached properly. The staff were friendly and helpful overall, but in keeping up with the island mentality, their sense of urgency was lacking (We had to ask two different people for hand towels and our one small room service order took close to an hour to arrive). Actually, as mentioned by another reviewer, the food was the worst part. The presentation was excellent (clean buffet areas, nicely decorated theme restaurants), but the dinner food quality wasn’t the best. One night I didn’t even finish my meal (at the “Mexican” restaurant on-site). Lunch (indoor buffet or beach BBQ) was usually the best bet. Actually, everything on the beach –including the wait staff—was great!
reviews.title: Relaxing and fun, BUT...

likes.liked: — The room size, the beach seats/beds
likes.disliked: — The food, distance fromt he airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Considering all of this, the Excellence was a great setting for relaxation. The grounds were beautiful, the weather was pleasant and there were many options for activities (and spa treatments) if you wanted them. I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Somewhat Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One note- coordinate travel to and from the hotel beforehand if you can. The hotel is over an hour away from the airport, so you'll want to skip the "can I help you, sir?" bidding wars between different transportation companies.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort but be careful of a few things.....

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff were totally unhelpful and discourteous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One more note- the resort is on the Atlantic side of the ocean. That means rough seas and cold(er) water. If you intend to spend your entire vacation in the ocean, you may want to skip this place. I went in a few times, but I quickly became content just relaxing by the water when I couldn’t go in it.
reviews.title: Best place to spend my 25th Birthday!!!

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping could be a little less stingy with towels/soap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a one week stay at Excellence Punta Cana from Dec27th to Jan4th.
reviews.title: A varied but good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took this trip for our 20th anniversary in October, 2007, without our boys. We had a gardenview junior room (requested oceanview) and ended up in a room that looked out at the back window of Chez Isabel. Not much water to be seen from here. The "garden" was not what we expected. Management tried to accommodate our request but the only room that would have done this was a honeymoon suite--for an additional $2,100.00. This included a hot tub on the balcony, which you would not have been able to use after 6:00 p.m. because of the mosquitos.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first two days here, we had no face cloths--makes it kind of hard to wash off the suntan lotion. We had to hide the wash cloth we finally got on the balcony so it didn't disappear with maid service. We did get clean towels again in the late afternoon/early evening on Tuesday.
reviews.title: Had a great time but somethings could of been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our anniversary dinner through the concierge and had our reservation confirmation ticket. We arrived at the restaurant (Spice) and we were not on their list.
reviews.title: An Excellent Resort!!

likes.disliked: — Having to wait for our room to be ready

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After two days of warmish soda and water in the fridge in our room, we asked management for a replacement because things were not cold and were told that they aren't fridges, they are coolers. Warm beverages in 90 degree weather wasn't what we were looking for.
reviews.title: Absolutely The Best !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: As far as the alcoholic drinks we had, there was little to no alcohol in our drinks. We even saw the bartender at the Martini Bar adding water to some of the bottles.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort!

likes.disliked: — A little far from the airport

reviews.title: Awesome Resort
reviews.text: We just returned from this reosrt and loved it. The staff was the most outstanding of any resort we've visited. The food was great and the fun endless. Beware of Prieto Tours! We booked a catamaran ride and it involved a 5 hour bus ride, filthy bathrooms, overcrowded boats and they ran out of food all for only $83 pp.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: I don't know where to begin except by saying don't listen to the whiney people on this site. If they are not happy at Secrets they won't be happy anywhere. My best friend and I went to Secrets for a quiet, relaxing vacation and we couldn't have been happier. We were there from 1/20 to 1/24. The only consistent comment on this site that was true is that the ocean is rough but we don't like swimming in the ocean so we didn't care. The beach was immaculate and beautiful and worth going to at least for a day, if you can tear yourself away from the pool.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Fabulous, Fabulous
Great! Some people are never happy?
reviews.text: We reserved a Garden View Swim-out Suite and let me say this is the only way to go. Don't go for the higher ocean-view swim outs because they are much less private, there is no separation between the patios like the ones in the garden view. Plus the cascading pool is much less crowded than the main pool and we had no issues getting floats, we even took our own and never used them.

reviews.title: A great sun-filled vacation!
reviews.text: The staff is WONDERFUL and they made us feel special. Our maid was "Excellente" and Amado makes the BEST omelettes in the morning. We saw hardly any bugs and the hotel was always perfectly spotless. We will definitely go back, it was the best vacation I have ever been on and we didn't even do any of the free extra-curricular activities. I cannot comment on the shows because we were "early to bed, early to rise". The shops are very affordable with high quality gifts, but make sure you pack all the necessities because those are outrageous - $15 for benadryl cream. Take a spanish dictionary and bone up on the common phrases. These are genuinely friendly people who appreciate reciprocation, so at least make an effort. We really got into it and even kept it up after we got back. Learn "un pequeno espanol" they get excited when they think you speak spanish and you have to say "a little spanish" and they will laugh out loud and even help you sometimes.

reviews.title: Mixed feelings
reviews.text: My advice is to ignore the whiners on this site, I read all of the reviews before we went and we couldn't fathom how anyone could complain about paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one glorius week at Excellence Punta Cana ,Oct 11 - 18th, and had the most wonderful vacation! From the moment we arrived we were made to feel most welcome by all staff members. The cool towels and glass of champagne was a very nice touch after a long day of travel. Yes, the roads are bad, but "it is what it is" and once you arrive at the resort you kind of forget about it once you see the lush, beautiful grounds. It was instant relaxation! We chose a garden view junior suite and the room was very clean and beautiful. We were very happy with the quality and presentation of meals in all of the restaurants. The service was top-notch. We felt like royalty all week with how nicely all of the staff treated us. I was very impressed with how many staff members were proficient in English. We stayed at a different resort in Punta Cana last summer and had more difficulty there in trying to communicate with the staff than here at Excellence. For the evening entertainment, we especially enjoyed the Michael Jackson show, circus show and the magic show, even though we are not fans of magicians, we found it very entertaining. I loved walking through the ecological park and feeding the fish, birds and turtles. There are wooden boxes containing day-old bread that you can feed the animals with. There are flamingos, parrots, peacocks and geese roaming the property. The pool is marvelous! There are activity areas where you can play water volleyball and water polo and get a little crazy, but if that's not for you the pool is so enormous that you can find a nice quiet area to hang out in. The beach is beautiful also. The surf is a little rough, even for this jersey girl, but I like to hear the crashing waves of the ocean. The lifeguards fly flags everyday to let you know the swimming status. Most days it was red flagged which means extreme caution. You should only go in up to your thigh/torso area. Obey the lifeguards and stay safe!
reviews.title: Trip of a Lifetime!

likes.liked: — The feeling of luxury! Jacuzzi tub,plush robes, soft bedding.

reviews.title: Best Place in Dominican Republic
reviews.text: I highly recommend the free 1/2 hour horseback ride the resort offers. Make an appointment with the concierge to schedule your ride. The horses are calm and it is ideal for a first time rider. You are taken along the beach and into shallow water! Don't forget your camera! The scenery is breathtaking - a very memorable experience! The animation team at Excellence is wonderful. They do their best to get you involved and are very friendly. They work so hard and they do their jobs well. We really found no negatives at all, not even the bug problem. At home here in N.J. I am usually eaten alive by mosquitos so I brought all kinds of sprays with me but never had to use them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We went on one excursion, bought through the tour desk. We did the ATV ride which was located about 20 minutes from the hotel. We were taken to a beautiful hacienda/ranch and were given automatic 4-wheel ATV's to drive. There are also dune buggies for two which looked like a lot of fun but be forewarned - you WILL get muddy on those!! The ride started on the dirt roads around the ranch. Then we drove on actual paved roads passing through small villages on the way to a beautiful beach in Macao. We were allowed to swim for 20 minutes and there were also some local vendors there. Next stop was back past the ranch to another small village. We were given 5 minutes to shop here and then proceeded down a steep hill to an underground cave for more swimming. The water was so clear you could see to the bottom but we were told not to be fooled by this - some parts were 20 feet deep so only good swimmers were encouraged to try it. We were joined by some of the local boys who would jump off of the high rocks into the water. It was really interesting and exciting. We left there to head back to the ranch where a 30 minute horse ride was also included as part of the package. It really was a fun side trip!
reviews.title: It's the people & place that make it excellent.

likes.liked: — the friendly staff and beatiful resort

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!
reviews.text: All in all it was just an amazing vacation. We met so many nice people from all over, mostly from the U.S. and England. (Shout out to our new Kentucky friends Sally and Tony!!) It is such a beautiful resort, the photos that you see here on Trip Advisor just do NOT do it justice. We spent our 25th wedding anniversary here. It was the most romantic day of my life. Can't think of anyplace else I would have rather spent this occasion at than right here at Excellence Punta Cana. I highly recommend this resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want an excellent vacation, one in which you would not want to end. Try Excellence Punta Cana in the DR. Adult only resort from start to finish this is the spot. Great sun for a tan, lovely entertainment, numerous activities. This is an all enclusive,so once you enter the room the wallett and purses are left behind. The entertainment staff Cesar,Wainel,Maikel,Inez, Delisa, and all the rest are great. Try it, you will fall in love with this resort.
reviews.title: Excellent Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: From the plethora of gushing reviews this hotel has clearly become complacent. It has adopted a policy of overbooking. We arrived on a Thur after a 10.5 hour flight from UK to be told we (and 3 other couples) would not be staying at Secrets for the first of our 7 night holiday. We were bounced to the Riu Palace Macao (separate review) an inadequate replacement. When we finally arrived at Secrets on Friday at a time requested by the hotel our room wasn't ready. 3 hours later we were given a twin room. We returned straightway to reception and rejected that requesting the double we had booked. More delay while that was sorted out. It is clear that over booking is systemic. Whilst we were in resort we were lettered to our rooms inviting us to check out for a couple of nights to ease matters. As we left the hotel the next tranche from the UK were not even going to be spending one night in Secrets and were booked to another hotel for the whole of their stay. We did not feel that management had any desire to find out whether we were satisfied following the screw up.
reviews.title: Over hyped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: As regards the 6 night stay we had. Use the spa-v good. We were unable to get into the Dominican Restaurant as the night we went we were swept into the Mexican without being given the choice. The Boardeaux was memorable although it took us 3 attempts to get in. Waits of 1-1.5 hours meant we had to queue at opening time to be able to eat when we wanted to. It opens at 6.00pm although in some places it is listed as 6.30. The Asian restaurant offers Thai,Japanese and Chinese and does none well. The housekeeping is hit and miss. In room beach towels stopped arriving halfway through our stay. The room preparation was basic despite tipping. The turn down service sometimes arrived so late we were already in bed. We stopped tipping after 4 days because it made no difference. The room is starting to tire - flaking paint, cracks etc. The staff work hard despite conspicously absent management. We have travelled widely and this is not a 5 star hotel - its good 4 star. You'll be disappointed if like us, you had anticipation fuelled by the rating of No 1 in DR.
reviews.title: Excellente'
beautiful honeymoon
reviews.text: After 7 years and 2 children my husband decided that we needed a get away for ourselves. He suprised me with a trip to Punta Cana in the Dominican Republic for my birthday.

reviews.title: Best resort ever!
reviews.text: From BWI to Punta Cana we flew on USA 3000..the flight was absolutely wonderful. The food,drinks and comfortable atmosphere was out of this world. The same when we flew home. We highly recommend using USA 3000.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: We landed in Punta Cana and shuttled to Secrets. The drive is at least an hour away. We arrived and were promptly greated by Pauline. She was very helpful and curtious. We then checked into our room. It was a spacious room and overlooked the garden.
reviews.title: Nice, relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellence at Punta Cana was fantastic. The staff was trained perfectly and always greeted you with a warm smile. The rooms were perfect. Great sized and the minibar being full everyday was a great help. The pool was always clean and chairs were always available. The bar staff at the beach and pool were fantastic and always made sure you had what you wanted. The food at all the restaurants was top quality. I have stayed in plenty of all-inclusives that valued quantity over quality. Not Excellence, This hotel made sure that each dish was prepared to the best they could. All ingredients were great. The beach was also beautiful. Although the water in front was slightly wavy, if you walked to the edge of the beach there is a slight curve that provides for clearer, warmer and clamer water that is great for floating, and snorkeling. I would definitly recommend this hotel for a romantic weekend for two, a honeymoon, an older couple, couple. When I do return to Punta Cana this is where I will make my stay.
reviews.title: Excellente

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After watching Punta Cana Trip Advisor reviews for quite some time, my wife and I chose the Excellence Punta Cana for a short anniversary trip. We booked our holiday for the end of May 2008 using AAA travel, which has always been a wise choice for us. The Excellence Club seemed to provide a few extras that sounded nice and our original reservations were for a garden view in the Excellence Club. As we read more reviews and forum entries, we slowly upgraded accommodations, first to EC ocean view, then to EC Excellence Suite. I emailed the Excellence Club manager describing our desire for a suite with a good view of the ocean, which was replied to promptly and professionally.
reviews.title: Our vacation was too short....

likes.liked: — Our time at the beach and pool were very relaxing and enjoyable!
likes.disliked: — The drive to the airport on the way home seemed to take hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped off the plane, we fell in love with Punta Cana. The airport was quaint with a thatched roof and a local band playing local music for arriving passengers and airport personnel directed us through the formalities quickly and efficiently. The transfer company found us as soon as we were through the gate and suddenly we were in a van headed to EPC. As has been reported too many times before, the trip from the airport to the hotel was about an hour over paved and dirt roads with large pot holes but our driver was experienced in the Dominican ways of driving so we arrived in one piece. We were met by a bellboy who found on names on a list and quickly whisked us off to the Excellence Club for check in. There we met Roberto the Excellence Club manager who explained the club amenities, gave us a tour of the club, and then personally took us to our room.
reviews.title: perfect honeymoon in every way

likes.liked: — the beaches, the food, the service, everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: He brought us to an unmarked room on the third floor of building 10 and took us inside. Our jaws literally dropped to the floor. We had been upgraded to the Imperial Suite and the room far exceeded all of our expectations for beauty, comfort and luxury. This room is about the size of 4 junior suites with a double size ocean view balcony that included a two person Jacuzzi and an amazing view of the ocean and pool. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed with a two person Jacuzzi and a 46” flat screen television. The living room contained comfortable leather furniture with a 40” flat screen, writing desk and a nice selection of liquors. The dining room had a beautiful table that sat 8, the kitchen had standard amenities like a refrigerator and sink, and the suite contained 2 water closets. You could have a party in the shower area and the double sink in the master bath area was ample. All of the furnishings were tasteful and comfortable.
reviews.title: Relaxing!!

likes.disliked: — Beach wasn't what I yearn for while dreaming of carribean getaways!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to all inclusive resorts previously, we were already aware that the resort offered us all we needed to relax and enjoy ourselves so we settled in for several days of serious relaxation. The service throughout our stay was impeccable. Every one working for the resort actually seemed happy to be at work. It was very common to find just an average employee singing as they worked or walked through the resort. We never met or saw any employee that was not entirely gracious and kind to their guest. The service we received from all hotel staff on the resort was first class, no exceptions. We left the resort only one time during our stay to ride horse back in the evening. Even this was a wonderful experience as they allowed us to ride at full speed along the beach.
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation

likes.disliked: — Having to go home back to reality

The food was great, drinks just right, rooms very nice, pool perfect, beach well kept ( sand very soft, hard to walk on the beach without sinking very deep) just a great time if you want to sit and do nothing. Not the place for an type A personality.

reviews.title: Excellence was Excellent
reviews.text: We stayed at the Excellence Nov. 22-29th. We took are two young adult children as our last family vacation together. The resort was very good! Required to pay $10.00 a piece at the airport. We rode on the tour bus to and from the airport - it took about 1 hour 10min. each way- with no stops in between. The roads arent that bad - but my daughter did get car sick. Everyone was friendly at the resort. Our kids were upgraded to the Excellence Club - they enjoyed the extras. We felt that it wasnt worth the money. We could go to their room, use the same beach and pool as they did. Our room was on the 2nd floor Excellence ocean view room. It was big with two sliding doors. Great view. We always tipped - and they are very grateful for $1-$5. I think that they would be nice and friendly either way. Make sure to bring plenty of money (dollars) there the ATM machine only gives pesos and they dont give out dollars at the front desk. We didnt have any trouble with finding chairs at the beach. It seems like everybody wants to be at the pool instead. The water is rough - but if you walked to the left of the resort on the beach and go to the bend t(big piece of wood in the sand) the water is smooth and great for swimming! The horseback riding was fun. The spa was the best! The foot heaven and excellence massages are the best! The food was good. Toscannas and Oregano we liked the best! Michael Jackson concert was good. We didnt see any mosquitos or bugs - probably the time of year we went. Best prices on buying stuff - see Paco at the resort store in the back. He gave us some great prices and better quality stuff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK so my trip was supposed to be a romantic getaway with my boyfriend. Did not happen that way he decided not to go NOT MY BOYFRIEND ANYMORE. In any case I went on my vacation. The plane ride was the plane ride from h**l a family with 3 children on the flight let thier children cry and carry on for the entire 4hr flight. So now I'm thinking this trip is doomed. The bus ride to the hotel is a little long about an hour, however the driver from Pierto Tours was great, one of the other passenger was joking about how he could go for a beer the next thing we knew the driver pulled over to get beer. Once at the resort I forgot about the plane ride. We were greeted with champagne and cold wash cloths. I stayed in the Excellence Club. As soon as I gave my name to the host I was promptly greeted by my conceige, pointed to my bags and in my room within 10 minutes. In the Excellence Club you will find a fully stock bar (all top shelf), big screen TV, 3 computers w/free internet also food all day. I must say the food at this resort is the best that I have had in Punta Cana. This was my 4th visit to Punta Cana. This resort is by far the best of the 3 that I have stayed in. I consider myself a very picky eater and I must say I have no complains about the food. I would advise anyone travel outside the U.S. to always pack some snack foods if you are like me you will crave some potato chips or candy. The room was large and had stocked bar with liquor. I do not like the Dominican rum that was left in my room so I asked if it could be replaced with Bacardi rum, I had the bottle within minutes. I will suggest that you bring you own iron the one in the room was not a steam iron and if you were not very very careful your cloths will be burnt. The beach and the ocean were great the water was warm but very rough and you are on the Pacific ocean. If you want to pick up a gift for someone go to Nancys she will bargain and give a great deal. Also if you want a massage ask Nancy it's only $45 for 70 minutes. Nancy is located on the beach if facing the ocean go to the left just outside the resort line. If you want to have fun I suggest you get involed in the daily activities offered by the resort and the entertainment crew. (Cesar,Santo,Mariel and Inez ) I must say the entertainment crew are wonderful people they work really hard and long hours but are always smiling and very cheerful and upbeat. I must say if it was not for the Entertainment crew (Cesar,Santo,Mariel and Inez) my trip would not have been as wonderful as it was. The nightly shows were great. The disco is a must while you are there go and learn a new dance from the Entertainment crew (Cesar,Santo,Mariel and Inez) If you want to plan an excursion go see Johnny @ Pierto Tours in the lobby. I did the zipline what a blast. I will say the staff at this resort go above and beyond their duties to make your stay enjoyable and accomodating. For example one day they had rice pudding (very good) out and I did not see it the next day and asked for it they brought some out to me right away. The head chef is walking around to make sure everyone is satisfied.
reviews.title: Amazing vacation! Can't wait to go back.

likes.disliked: — ride to and from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited during the period 23-29 November. This was our fifth Caribbean all inclusive, and it certainly offered more variety inside the resort than previously experienced on our other all inclusive vacations. We booked in July through VacationsToGo online, and they took care of everything quite nicely. Punta Cana ground transportation was handled by VIP Tours as part of the package, and the connections between the airport and the resort were flawless, with a stop at one other resort to drop others off. We found the slower ride part of the overall experience that gave us time to take it all in. Our open minds and adventuresome spirits helped us enjoy the ride from the airport to the resort for what it is, but the fact that our air and ground connections worked perfectly and our checked baggage arrived with us probably did a lot to set our mood. Just in case there was a baggage disconnect, we had enough in our carry on baggage to have dinner, sun bathe, and do anything else we might want to do for the first 24-36 hours. We were met with the legendary champagne and cool, moist towel; we had opted for the Excellence Club and booked an Excellence Club Junior Suite Garden View from the beginning; very nice, and no regrets for the extra price, for the amenities covered. We were on the 2nd floor of the 8000 building. The 4 poster bed was one of the most comfortable "traveling" beds we have ever had, nice and firm, which is what my wife and I prefer.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Vacation

likes.disliked: — The remoteness of the resort from anything else

Also we "created" 2 maintenance issues of our own, and again they were taken care of immediately. Make sure you ask specifically about the plumbing "rules" to avoid plugging the toilet. 'Nuff said. Remember that most of the maintenance issues are not the fault of the hotel, but of the guests.

reviews.title: Our Wedding was PERFECT!
Absolutely Amazing!!
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Secrets Excellence Resort in Punta Cana for my honeymoon. My new husband and I had a great time. While the ride from the airport is long and the scenery can be depressing, that all melts away as soon as you pull up to the resort. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff cannot do enough for you. There were plenty of things to do that are included in the price of your all inclusive vacation (the bike tour and horseback riding, for example). The food was great as well - it had lots of flavor. Of the 7 restaurants, only 2 require you to be dressed for dinner and it's not formal just pants and a collared shirt for men. The nightly shows, performed by hotel staff, are very entertaining. You do not have to leave the resort for a thing. They even have nights where you can buy souvenirs and you get to negotiate for the best price. Also, make sure you take advantage of the spa - it was heavenly! I had such a great time I am already looking at other AM Resorts for my next vacation.

reviews.text: The resort was amazing. Beautifully decorated, very lush and tropical. It was exactly what my husband and I expected from a 5 star all inclusive adult only resort. Its a swim up bar under a canopy of trees that keep the water a few degrees cooler than the rest of the winding pool. There were 4 bar tenders on a Friday at 12:00 just servicing that area. The service was perfect Pedro and Juan at the beach area were great. They would bring us ice cold rum coconuts to our hammocks on the beach, and be back with more before we asked. There was always someone around to get what we needed. The food at the restaurants was not very good unless your talk to the chef at the Grill. Ricky and the chef Valentine will hook you up.

reviews.text: Notice: This is a rather lengthy review, and it still did not capture all the good things we wanted to say about the resort. We will return. At the end, i have linked to a website I created with much more detail about our trip if you desire further info.
reviews.title: Vacation to Paradise

likes.liked: — Big rooms, beautiful location, and wonderful people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I celebrated our 10th anniversary at Excellence resort June 1st - June 9th. The trip was the most wonderful we have ever taken. After lengthy discussions, we believe that the one component that made it so wonderful was the people who work at the resort. Every employee we encountered was smiling, helpful, and often humorous. Our first night at the resort, we met Inez. She is full of energy, and works hard to ensure that everyone has fun. Although he will be out for a vacation for a few more days, I suggest you find Jose at the Cafe Kafe bar. He really helped us get acclimated to the resort when we first arrived, and took good care of us until he left for vacation. After Jose left, we made friends with Benjamin who also works at Café Kafe and he too was wonderful. When visiting the restaurants make sure to find Kelvin and Victor as they will make sure your dining experience is not just pleasurable, but the very best it can be.
reviews.title: Happy honeymooners from Green Bay LOVED THE EXCELLENCE!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The list goes on and on....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Throughout the day, it seemed that there was always a fun crowd around the swim-up bar and the Café-Kafe bar. The Cafe Kafe is a great place to visit before and after dinner, and while waiting for the nightly shows. Depending on the location of your room, you may also be convenient to either SOL bar, or Cielo.
reviews.title: Excellente

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The main pool is the center attraction through the day. The main pool stretches about two-thirds the length of the resort. The Cascade pool is off to itself, and does not have any ocean view. We quickly became disenchanted with the rock wall located in front of the Excellence club that divides the pool into two sections. It forces swimmers from the far end of the resort to get out and walk around when travelling to and from the swim-up bar. Reading online it also seemed disappointing to find that the pool closed at 6pm; however, once at the resort we found this was in no way a disappointment. Guests are not run from the pool at closing time, and on several nights we were still swimming at 8pm. The pool bars do close at 6pm so you have to walk if you need a refreshment. Nightly entertainment starts around the time the pools close so you are never at a loss for something to do and the closing of the pool seemed to be work just fine. The resort provides an adequate number of chairs, beds, and floats around the pool for those who are actively engaged in those activities, but numerous individuals would lay claim to them early in the day, leaving their belongings to prevent others from using these resources. It was disappointing to see these items sitting idle for hours on end only to be used later in the day and often for only short periods. Please use the floats and beds as you wish, but make them available for others when you are not using them.
reviews.title: Loved the Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 11202, a second floor ocean view room. Getting to and from the second floor was never a problem and the view made it worthwhile. Personally, I preferred our room over the swim-up rooms which really were just pool side rooms with individual paths to the pool. We choose not to upgrade to Excellence club, and even before coming it seemed difficult to find online exactly what Excellence club really was. Excellence club offers several things to travelers, including a private air-conditioned bar, easier check-in and a private beach area to name a few. The Excellence website lists these with a little more detail. The private beach area was simply an area of the beach about 100ft wide roped off from the rest of the beach. The private area was near the center of the resort directly out from the Excellence club (see the map). Our room was better (larger, cleaner, more amenities) than we expected. It was kept very clean throughout our stay, and our housekeeper Guilda made sure to leave the room memorable every time she attended to it. One note, we were told that the busy season for the resort is November through March which would put our visit during the off season. The resort never felt crowded, nor were we ever competing for services or waiting in lines. It also felt as though it could easily handle a larger number of guests easily; without making guests feel crowded.
reviews.title: Excellente

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We had a very trying time getting to Punta Cana due to our American Airlines flight in Miami that had us sit for 4+ hours in the plane before they finally brought in a new plane. We did not arrive at the resort until sometime late in the evening. This was much later than we expected but were greeted with smiles from the staff and a cold towel and champagne. I noticed that we were with another couple who bought the Excellence upgrade but we were checked in the same way so I am still confused as to why someone would get this upgrade. Our luggage was promptly delivered to our room (5 mins) after check-in and we decided to go out to Oregeno for our dinner as we were advised by the front desk this would be the quickest way to a meal since he could tell we were very tired and hungry. We were not disappointed and after several main courses and more than a bottle of wine, we happily walked the short distance to our room for a peaceful nights sleep.
reviews.title: Perfect time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I thought our room location was perfect. We were in building 6 which was just a few steps from the Barcelona, Touscana, and the Grill restaurants. This was also right by the main pool and swim up bar. Normally, I would not like to be so close to everything due to noise but this resort is quiet at night and it was the perfect place for us. It was so convenient to run back to the room for whatever we needed. Also, our room AC worked very well for us and we had no complaints. We were located on the 2nd floor. Our room was nice and the only complaint we had about it was the wireless access was weak. Our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and a restocked mini bar. Also, each evening we received turn down service with chocolates on the pillow. As far as bugs in the room, I never saw a single one. I lived many yrs in S. Florida and Texas and were use to an occasional critter but never saw one here. The mosquitoes were not a problem for us either. We brought our own spray but rarely used it and the were even offered spray at night at the sports bar.
reviews.title: Great all linclusive resort

likes.liked: — The room was large, clean and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — We couldn't get an ocean view room since we required two beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both of us thought the food was extremely good. While some dishes were different than what we were use to, they tasted very good and there was plenty of variety to choose from. We liked the breakfast and lunch buffets along with our favorite dinner being at the Grill sitting on an elevated area that is directly over the pool. We never waited more than 10 mins for a table and always enjoyed meeting the people around us. We took advantage of the room service on a few occasions and were thrilled with the prompt service(15-20mins wait) and always greeted with a smile. Nothing like having a waiter deliver you hot appetizers and a bottle of wine to your room to start off the evening.
reviews.title: NEVER EVER AGAIN, don't go!!

likes.liked: — the room we should have had!!!
likes.disliked: — the room we where first given

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was worried about the beach as I had heard it was rough to swim in. They did have ½ the beach black flagged while the other ½ was red flagged every day. It’s pretty obvious that they cut the beach down so there is less area for the lifeguards to cover. The waves were nothing different that what I have seen in Florida and I have done triathlons in much more challenging water that this was. With that said, they did keep an eye on everyone and make sure you did not go out too far. My husband was determined to do some serious body surfing as he loves these types of waves and has a lot of experience with them. He made the lifeguards nervous at first but they finally gave up on him and he agreed to go just off the resort to have his fun. I am more in to calm clear ocean water and was not disappointed as I could take a 2 min easy jog down the beach to find what I wanted. This was perfect to float around in or swim along the beach for exercise. No jelly fish or sea weed to worry about in the water and the staff does an amazing job of cleaning up the beach each day. My husband and I would take a late afternoon run each day down the beach for about 35-40mins. This was very enjoyable and we got to see a bit more of the area on either side of the resort.
reviews.title: We Loved It, Given Our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Excellence. We spent 12/6 - 12/12/07 there. I was really worried after reading the reviews about the food, bug bites and pool towel shortage. We had the perfect weather, no bug bite problem and towels were plentiful. The pools are well taken care of. I thought the food was excellent, and the staff was very friendly. Disco was great, top shelf liquor the entire stay. The beach was clean, although you cannot do any sports in the water since it is very rough, you can however, get yourself wet and jump the waves. Housekeeping was great the first few days and then went quickly down hill. No washcloths to be found, even on the laundry carts (they are kept by the elevators on the first floor). This resort is 1 hour and 15 minutes from the airport, and I took Pierto Tour bus which was great. It is a very remote resort. Shopping is great two feet off the resort on the beach, great bargains (to the left of the beach).
reviews.title: Loved The Excellence

likes.disliked: — Could have been more consistent with the housekeeping
