reviews.title: Heaven on earth

likes.liked: — lots of space in the rooms, big tub, clean and bright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess the first thing I should start off by saying is that the service that we received is second to none. From the time we stepped off our bus we were impressed, and we definetly felt the "WOW" factor. We were greeted with glasses of champagne and cold towels which signalled the type of service we were going to be receiving during our stay. All the employees were so gracious and friendly that it was one of the main reasons that our trip was so enjoyable. There are too many names to mention, and all the entertainment staff were great but special thanks have to go to Julio, Luis and Isabel who definately went out of their way to ensure that we had a great time. I could go on and on with examples of the excellent service but I think I will just sum up by saying the staff and service were "EXCELLANTE".
reviews.title: Very good resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We also would like to mention how beautiful this resort is. From the beautifull front lobby, to the wonderfull beach, this place has it all. There is also a really cool bird santuary that has peacocks, flamingos, ducks to name but a few. There are also a couple a parrots that are fun to watch. They love it if you bring them coconut and even do a little dance for you when you whistle a tune.
reviews.title: Just wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well - what can I say - disappointing at best. How anyone can deem this place 5 star is beyond me. We arrived for a weeks stay at the Excellence and where faced with the same nightmare tour of the area via the 'deluxe' tour bus. Air conditioning was obviously not considered a necessity. Arrival to the hotel (eventually) and we were faced with a warm glass of 'champagne'. Proceed to check in and straight away we got the whole why we should upgrade thrown at us. OK - it sounded good so we did (after a good bit of haggling!). Initially room seemed ok but that impression soon went out of the window. The bath was dirty and even after cleaning you can imagine the quick exit when the brown scum floating in the water was noticed. It was clear 'cleaning' is term best used loosely as apart from a quick tidy of the bed there certainly was not much in the way of cleaning of the room. Toileties where not replenished even after 3 requests. The upgrade was supposed to offer fresh fruit and flowers daily - of course that never happened. Agree that the beach is really quite nice - clean and easy to walk on and the pool area is pretty good with the swim up bar and staff on hand but to be honest those are the only two real high points of this hotel.
reviews.title: Not so Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot believe everyone seems to overlook the horrific 'entertainment'. Appalling is the best word to describe this. From the karoke and I kid you not - BINGO to the embarassing attempts at a band to some strange interpretation of Michael Jackson dancing by what look like at best a high school show (infact thats an insult to high school shows). There is no escaping this mediocore 'butlins holiday camp' as it is thrust at you in the only real area to go for a pre-dinner drink. The background music consistened daily of the same CD stuck on repeat - and it was not a good CD! There was also an attempt to entertain us in the lobby with some bizarre organ style music - it was so painful we eventually gave up and left. Food was edible but that was about it if you could actually get into a restaurant - I had to resort to using a steak knife on chicken! And then the rules about dress code. Considering they would allow entry to people dressed in dirty trainers yet if you were a man with trendy flip flops - forget it - you were not getting in. To give the illisusion of being a high end resort by forcing people to conform to an outdated view of acceptable dress I found hysterical.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I appreciate a lot of other guest really have enjoyed their stay but if you are looking for true 5 star with great service and food I really would not recommend this hotel at all. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere.
reviews.title: Punta Cana I go again?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was over an hour drive to the resort from the airport and in my opinion, not very pretty scenery which scared me a bit as to what to expect. There were local men urinating on the side of the road in plain view as we headed to the resort. The resort property itself was very pretty. The staff were friendly but did not speak/understand much English. We had a difficult time communicating with most. It took 2 days to obtain washcloths which we were told we'd have in 5 minutes. Our coffee pot was missing. The towels were like sandpaper. The toilet leaked all over the floor and we had an ant problem. There was an open bottle of water in the refridgerator and an open bottle of lotion on the vanity. The food was mediocre at best. The drinks were OK especially if you asked for a specific drink instead of one of the "pre-mixed" ones where you could watch them make it. The beach is OK as far as the seating, but it's actually on the Atlantic side of the island NOT the Carribbean as we thought and the water is much rougher, we were never able to get in. No snorkeling unless (so we were told) you walked around the bend to the calmer waters of the Carribbean...we never made it, because it was too windy and the vendors off the resort would harass you constantly. The nightly shows were very cheesy...impersonators of Cher, Madonna, Michael Jackson and Elvis pretty much every night in some form or another. We had a "lounge singer" with canned music one night. We never stayed long. I don't understand the "5-Star" rating, other than their presentation is done very well...it is indeed a very pretty resort, but I would not go back and would not recommend it to anyone..in fact, I wouldn't go back to this island at all.
reviews.title: Laid-back chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had been going to Jamaica for the last 3 vacations and wanted to try something a little different so we decided to give Punta Cana a shot. It turned ou to be a great idea.
reviews.title: Unforgetable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned on 12th June - it was fabulous. Even better than the photos!
reviews.title: Truly amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition to all the things other people say in their reviews about
reviews.title: EXCELLENCE says it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the pool, drinks, food, luxury room etc, I especially liked the beautiful design of the resort and lovely touches like the wonderful selection of colourful plants and flowers, parrots, flamingos, fish etc.
reviews.title: The Most Romantic Place on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also enjoyed the poolside activities eg Spanish lessons, Aqua Aerobics - thanks to the activity team who did a great job.
reviews.title: As everyone says, EXCELENTE

likes.liked: — No way to pick one thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint would be the Thomas Cook rep who was hopeless and the MyTravel flights to/from London Gatwick which were the most uncomfortable flights I've ever had the misfortune to take.
reviews.title: excellente

likes.liked: — the friendliness of all staff, the beautiful scenery,pool, junior at the martini bar, the wedding
likes.disliked: — the onsite vendors, the champagne breakfast, room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an opportunity to spend three nights at the Excellence after accepting an offer to be transferred from an overbooked Bahia Principe. The offer included an additional $200 a night compensation. Knowing that the Excellence was Trip Advisor's number one rated hotel in Punta Cana we would have accepted the transfer just out of curiosity... but the $600 was appreciated anyway!
reviews.title: Perfect for Couples!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN: Smooth, friendly and professional. Just as it should always be. Under the circumstances we had no special requests, and sure enough were assigned a room in building 12, the furthest section! It's only a 5-7 minute walk, but if you prefer to be closer to the main lobby, bars and restaurants you might request something closer.
reviews.title: Second Vacation to Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: Large, comfortable, perfectly clean and well appointed. We usually prefer ocean view rather then garden view but the grounds we looked on were lushly landscaped with a pond... and a wandering turkey family. There was a very extensive selection of toiletries in the attractive washroom. The jacuzzi and sinks were open to the room, but the shower and toilet were in a separate w/c.
reviews.title: Anybody that thinks this is a 5 star place must give Motel 6's 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Bathrobes, free wall safe, coffee maker and nicely stocked mini-bar. And although we never used it there was 24 hr rooms service with a very extensive menu.
reviews.title: Great resort, fabulous beach!

likes.disliked: — The trip to and from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GROUNDS: As beautifully landscaped as any I've seen. At the front of the hotel is a mini-zoo... parrots, flamingos, peacocks, ducks and geese. Definitely worth a stroll.
reviews.title: Loved Excellence, punta cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at Secrets for 2 weeks in March, having originally been booked to stay at Secrets Excellence in Mexico in November (cancelled because of the Hurricane). Had read some reviews before we went, mostly good but some negatives.All I can say is that I have been all over the world and stayed at some great places, and our experience of Secrets DR is up there with the best of them. Lovely setting, friendly staff, very relaxed and perfect to re-charge the batteries!
reviews.title: Excellente!
NOT SO GREAT AT SECRETS EXCELLENCE
reviews.text: As for the food, we pretty much stuck to the Bordeaux, Oceana and the Grill and thought they were all very good. Only bad experience was at the Italian on the first night as we turned up too late for any of the others.Needless to say din't make that mistake again. Also sometimes going to the French restaurant the girl allocating tables would try and discourage you saying there was a long wait etc, but wasn't a problem as would just have a few drinks and wait with a bleeper.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: There was always space on the beach, and the breeze meant you were never uncomfortable. The sea was always rough but good fun tackling the waves. Drinks were regularly brought down, and there is absolutely no pressure for tipping, but was happy to about 50% of the time as pretty much all the staff were so friendly.
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Room in Block 8 was always clean, new towels etc and mini-bar well stocked. Plenty of movies etc for a quiet night in with room service. How about Channel 21!!!
reviews.title: beautiful and serene
Secrets Excellence...Excellente!!!
reviews.text: Overall can't knock the place at all, and certainly no stomach trouble that you sometimes hear about in DR. Would definately go to Secrets again, maybe Mexico but would not rule out a return to Punta Cana.

reviews.title: Loved Every Minute of it!!
reviews.text: We are four couples from VA who visited Secrets on June 20-27, 2004. After reading months of negative reviews I was a little apprehensive since I had taken the responsiblity for the planning and selection of this resort. We were pleasantly surprised and loved every minute of our stay there. The resort is beautiful, the service was "Excellente", and the food was fine. (Not the best I have ever had, but plenty of great selections.) The rooms were beautiful and romantic. The beach had great waves and fun was had by all. I am especially loved by mosquitos, and I can report only one bite the entire week. (I am usually devoured) The pool huts were perfect for our group of 8 stressed out people. By the end of the week we were relaxed, happy, and content. All of us had a great time at the disco and enjyoed the nightly entertainment. The activity staff was wonderful. We especially enjoyed Melkis, Alpha, Marino, and Julio. Everywhere we went were greeted in a warm and friendly manner. The Dominican staff made our stay a pleasure. We did tip generously but were glad to do so. It is sad to see how people live outside this beautiful resort. Make sure to sign up early for the horseback riding. It was a great ride with beautiful horses. We went on the Delta Powerboat rides which were lots of fun. Two of the couples went on sailing and loved their trip as well. Yes, the ride from the airport was bumpy, but so what. If you want the same stay home. It is well worth a few bumps to have such a wonderful vacation. We have traveled to other All- Inclusives resorts, to Puerto Rico, on several Cruises, to Europe, and a variety of American Resorts. Secrets did just fine in any comparisons. Don't worry and be happy!!!! Enjoy!!!

reviews.title: Died and went to heaven
reviews.text: Wow...what a wonderful resort. My husband and I were at Secrets Excellence between June 11th-18th. We were amazed at the maticulous landscaping, elegant lobby, spacious rooms..with a beautiful jacuzzi, plentiful restaurants, and most of all the warm welcome you received with a scented towel and a mimosa. The name Secrets "Excellence," with empahsis on EXCELLENCE, truly defines this resort in every way.

reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE!
reviews.text: We, like many other people, read tripadvisors comments for many weeks. Those people who had negative remarks about Secrets, do not deserve to go on vacation. The employees at Secrets were so full of life and always had a smile on their faces. Special thanks to Luciano, Dionel, Angelino, Eugena, and Aris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004
reviews.text: We are looking forward to returning to Secrets next year.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, awesome staff, but....
On the fence...
reviews.text: Secrets was so incredible!!!!! I didn't want to leave - EVER. I actually was thinking about moving there after we went there for our wedding and honeymoon in March of 2004. (I know - this review is a bit late!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from excellence punta cana and had a great time. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with great service from the front desk, Pauline was fantastic. She took care of us from the moment we arrived, right to our last day there. We stayed 2 weeks and wished we could stay another 2 weeks. We have travelled all over the carribean and no other hotel gives service like this one. These guys know what they are doing and that's why this hotel is called excellence! The rooms are clean, the restaurants are great, our favorite was Chez Isabelle and the Spice, our least favorite was the Lobster House. You must eat at the Grill for lunch, everything on the menu was great. Toscana was great for dinner as well, if you like risotto, then you'll like this italian restaurant. Even room service was great and always arrived hot and with a smile. The entertainment staff was fantastic. These people work their butts off to ensure that you are having a great time. You must meet Rosemary and Innes from the entertainment, they're great. As far as excursions, we booked them through Happy Harry at the activity centre where you rent the boggy boards. He'll be sure to hook you up with any tour you want at the best prices and with a smile. As far as the beach goes, you are on the Atlantic side which has more waves then the carribean side but let me tell you how much fun that is. If you are not a good swimmer, then stay closer to the beach. Make sure you get a boggy board from Happy Harry and you'll have a blast in the water. Beach service is great, you don't have to get off your chair for a drink, they come to you. The best advice I can give you is to bring lots of dollar bills, these people deserve every penny of it. We tipped more here then any other place we have been. They will remember you when you do so and the service becomes that more spectacular. We met people from all around the world who have travelled here before and continue to come back to excellence, we will be back and miss them all so much. You will not be disappointed with this hotel. One more thing that might be useful, we stayed in the excellence club, our room was 8007, the building was a little newer, rooms were nicer, but the club is worth the extra money. We ate at the club a few times for lunch and dinner and for snacks and the food was great. It is an exclusive lounge with comfy chairs and a t.v. Very quiet and a nice change. To sum up our vacation, 10 out of 10!!!!
reviews.title: Excellence Is Fantastic!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and I got married at the Majestic Colonial in January 2008. We stayed at the Majestic for one week with all our guests, and then for a second week by ourselves. We then stayed for a third week and moved over to the Excellence resort. I saw this resort from the beach two years ago when we stayed next door at Sirenis, and it looked absoutely stunning. I couldn't wait to spend our honeymoon at this wonderful resort.
reviews.title: Great place, but breakfast and lunch could be improved

likes.liked: — the comfy bed and blankets, the two tier pool

reviews.title: Dont belive the Hype - Certainly not Excellent!
reviews.text: We arrived by cab (since we were coming from another resort we didn't have the bus option) and we were welcomed with champagne. The receptionist was wonderful, but our room wasn't ready. The bell boy said that he would put our stuff aside and we should go check out the grounds and grab something to eat and come back in 1.5 hours. When we walked around we were blown away by how wonderful the place was. When you drive up it doesn' t look like much, but the lobby is really nice, with a pond and turtles, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the grill for lunch and it was YUMMY!! They don't really have the same concept of appetizers as we do in Canada, I got chicken ceasar for an appetizer and chicken fingers to eat for my meal (that is actually an appetizer too). The servings were really huge. It was delicious, and then we went back to the lobby and were taken to our room. The room was leaking from the ceiling, so we went downstairs to complain and someone was up to fix it in about 10 minutes. Great service I thought, sometimes you could wait hours.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He fixed that no problem and there were no issues the rest of the week. We then tried to find the sports bar because the football game was on and my husband wanted to watch the game. There were about 50 patriot and green bay fans all crammed in the sports bar, so the resort brought over a nacho machine with cheese and delivered pizzas. Again, great service. We watched the game and had beers served to us all night. Great first night.
reviews.title: A mixed Blessing

likes.disliked: — The service in the dining rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned to NYC from our Trip : November 28 to December 3rd.(2006). We had a TERRIFIC time. I was a bit nervous after saw all the negative reviews however when we arrived we could not be more pleased. The transport company was prompt and got us to the resort safely - the trip was about 1 hour from the airport but well worth it. When we arrived the staff at the resort was attentive and courteous. We were checked in within in minutes of arriving and our bags were brought to our room immediately. As for all the complaints I could not see what they were talking about. As one positive review said - remember this is a third world nation if you want US luxury then stay in the US.
reviews.title: LOVED this RESORT

likes.disliked: — vendors in the lobby some nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the property itself to be breath taking - as for the horrible pictures people posted they forgot to say those were of the beach past the sign that said "leaving the secrets excellence resort" - you can't expect the hotel to maintain the beach property owned by the government. The pool was wonderful - there were more than enough lounge chairs and sun beds so there was never any problem finding a place to sit and relax. As for the staff - they all undersood English well enough and were happy to help you with whatever you needed. Service was terrific - every time you turned around someone was there to ask if you needed a drink refill - and the drinks were definitely not watered down. The food was great to good. There was plenty of selection to choose from - steak restaurant, seafood restaurant, chinese/japanese, French/continental, mexican/dominican, italian buffet - we ate 5 of the 6 all were terrific. The spa was a nice facility (not included but worth a trip to). The night entertainment was definitely entertaining we caught a show each night . Our experience was overall wonderful would recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: A great trip for us

likes.liked: — The service we received and the overall beauty

reviews.title: Best of the best vacation so far
reviews.text: As far as the other recommendations of scented candles and febreeze - might be worth the purchase as again you need to remember you are in the tropics and things tend to be damp and when the rooms are closed so that the A/C can keep the room cool (which by the way operated separately from the lights) it does have a slight damp smell - like the beach as you are only a few fee from the water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice to people traveling - go and enjoy the beach paradise that this resort offers.
reviews.title: The Good and the Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secrets Punta Cana is a very delightful resort. It has natural beauty and the staff is very good at taking care of you. I did take into consideration all the reviews prior to my trip and looked for most of the problems. I did not find many of them and it did seem that maybe people are a tad bit critical. I also understand that each person feels that they are the only person of importance and should be treated better that anyone else. That being said I observed the following while my wife and I visited the resort during the Nov 18- 24, 2006.
reviews.title: Cancel your trip ASAP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back delighted from Excellence Punta Cana. Our stay was perfect. Food (duck, langoust, lamb, mechoui, filet mignon, ...) was as good quality as North American's best. Service (staff) was extremely warm, nice and filled with care. Several little extras made it a real 5 star resort for all customers, not only those who paid extra for the "Excellence treatment". We all had jacuzzi's in our rooms, towels waiting for us on the pool and beach chairs, bar and food service on the beach as well as fresh fruit skews, no reservation required for any restaurants, american beers in bottles (not just the Presidente !). Various kinds of Ports. Beach is very nice, not crowded like other resorts but waves were too strong to allow water sports such as kayak or wind surfing. Beds with shades beside the pool. Floating mattress waiting for you in the pool. Abundance everywhere. First time I have the blues so bad coming back. Only downside was the time it took to get someone to fix my safety deposit box but everything else made up 100 times. Go fot it !
reviews.title: Excellence means perfection

likes.liked: — Beautiful resort and beach, excellent service and food, quality guests
likes.disliked: — Time to get safety deposit box fix and get my room prepared

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Very good... and should be 'excellent' very soon

Small lakes & ponds with friendly animals, rabbits, flamingos, peacocks and the 'cheeky' two parrots. They love peanuts, but also like glasses, buttons & hair bobbles. so beware the wreckers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Awesome Trip!!

likes.liked: — the beach, the pool, and food
likes.disliked: — you really dont want to leave the resort by yourself

reviews.title: Very Nice Trip
reviews.text: When we arrived at the airport we had our photo taken and this is then available for you to purchase for $8 when you depart, and the airport is a lovely place with a lovely thatched roof and good facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a glass of Champagne and a wet towel to cool us down, check in was fantastic and everyone was immediately friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Relaxing, Relaxing, Relaxing!!!

likes.liked: — Not crowded and was wonderful for a relaxing vacation.
likes.disliked: — Drinks were not cold enough . Mini bar not cold enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a garden view room in block 3 (the blue block) and this again was beautiful, the maid service is daily with a turndown in the evening. Room was extremely spacious, very clean, great shower and whirlpool bath for two and aircon was a godsend! They give you robes and more fresh towels than even I could use!
reviews.title: Potential For Excellence but Falls Short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a week long stay for our honeymoon. Needless to say that we were looking forward to this vacation after a year of wedding planning! The resort is average, so if you go there with high expectations, LOWER THEM! The trip from the airport is like a ride at Six Flags, without the safety harnesses! It takes about an hour and a half to get to the resort, that's IF you don't have to make any stops at the other resorts. We used VIP transfer services. I do recommend them because I talked to other visitors who used private taxis or other transfer services who were not reliable at all and were stranded at the airport. The island itself is not somewhere you would ever visit if you're not staying at one of the resorts. What a dump! The resort itself is absolutely beautiful. The glass of champagne was much needed after that trip from hell from the airport. We had the honeymoon package and never recieved our banner for the door or rose petals on the bed. Never had a bath drawn for us like they advertise. Our romantic dinner was a nice touch, though. Our favorite restaurants were Spice and The Grill. Everything else was mediocre, at best. Do not go to th Lobster House for breakfast-horribly bland food and TERRIBLE service. My husband on multiple occassions in different restaurants had to go get our water for us. The waiter at the Lobster House for dinner was exceptional. My husband had to leave the table for a moment before our food was brought out and the waiter saw this, so he kept his food warm for him. The nightly shows were cheesy. The Michael Jackson show was great, however. We stayed at the pool bar all week long and met some great people who we will keep in touch with. This is where the partyers go, so if you like a quieter scene, stay at the Cascade pool. Stay away from the fruity drinks as much as possible. My husband and I both ended up with E. Coli and we attribute it to the fruits and possibly the ice. They say they use purified water for everything, but I think they most likely let some things slide. My husband is Latin and loives his flan. One day at the Toscana lunch buffett he asked to take some flan to go and they wouldn't let him, only pizza. He spoke with concierge and they were of no help. They told him to call room service and have it delivered. When he did, they don't offer it! The service is VERY up and down. It's either exceptional, or very poor. And forget eating luch by the pool, there is NO service there for food except for the occasional waiter carrying around soggy nachos. And, you have to be 100% dry to eat lunch in one of the two restaurants offering lunch. Breakfast at Toscana is not very good, either. The Martini Bar was fun. Make sure to ask for Marino if you like Dirty's. He makes a mean Dirty Martini. Try a Coco Loco, but only one! And, don't order off any of the drink menus. You'll get extremely week, way too fruity drinks. Stick with what you normally drink. Trust me, you'll get a much better drink. Yellow beach towels are like gold there. If you find some, it's like hitting the lottery! Only one day during our 7 day stay were we able to find towels. And, we got the last two at the Club House! The seas were very rough, so head down the beach to the right a ways and the waters are much calmer. Would we go back-no way! No more near hospital stays for us! We were so sick, my husband had to have antibiotics once we returned to the States. We had to buy Pepto and PediaLight at the Drugstore for $24!! During two separate occasions, my hubby had issues with the female hotel staff being in the restrooms. Once was in the lobby bathroom. There was a woman folding towels in the men's restroom. He asked her to please leave and she refused. I know there was not a lack of comunication because he speaks fluent Spansh. He left and went to our room to use the restroom. The housekeeper saw him walk into our room, even said hola to her. He walked back out of the restroom and she was in there making our bed! No knock or anything! And, having him speak Spanish was great, because the staff speaks very little English. The entertainment staff really tries to get everybody involved and they have so much energy. We're not into all the little activities, but if you are, there's plenty to do. So, to narrow it down: the major pro is the beauty of the resort. Major con: Well, too many to name.
reviews.title: Average, at best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to Excellence Punta Cana June 14th-June 22nd. To give everyone some brief background I have been to many caribbean islands and all-inclusive resorts including Sandals(St. Lucia, Whitehouse in Jamaica, Ocho Rios), Aventura Spa Palace, and Cayman islands. I will breakdown the negatives and positives below, but my overall impression and time at Excellence was just average/ok, with the food ok to poor, with the only positive being the beauty of the resort and the beach. I will try keep it simple, as other reviews pretty much give all the details
reviews.title: Average, not excellence, with poor food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon at Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Landscaping-beautiful with gorgeous views and palm trees everywhere. Great garden trail with flamingos, peacocks, chickens, birds, native plants, geese, and talking parrots. But the thing is all the resorts I have been to have beautiful landscaping so it was no different then any other resort, and some other resorts have had even more impressive lobbies and landscaping.
reviews.title: Could not complain...A paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2. Beach: Probably one of the best beaches I have been to. Very large, and long beach which you could take a 2 mile walk either way, and clear blue water. Yes, the water can be rough at times, with a strong undertoe, but it's not too much worse than that seen on the east coast of the USA in the Atlantic Ocean. If you walk 500 yards or so down to the right you will find very calmer water. It is a really scenic walk. My wife and I had a fun time jumping and surfing the waves. Only downfall was there is no beautiful sunsets as the sun sets on the other side of the island. Really can't do too many motorized sports on the water due to the rough water, but some people took out kayaks. The lifeguards are out watching everyone, with restricted areas to swim due to rough water. The time we were there was red flagged(meaning take your own risks while swimming), but it really wasn't all that bad, just be cautious and don't swim out far, and try to swim with a buddy if not such a great swimmer. The beach has a great breeze which takes off the heat and feels good, watch for sunburn though.
reviews.title: Excellente - One of the best adults place to stay in Punta Cana, DR

likes.liked: — Rooms were spacious and clean and well stocked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our Punta Cana Excellence Resort stay was wonderful! The people, food, sun, surf, and pool were great. The entertainment was excellent too. Juan Carlos, Altagracia, and Lizette went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed to make our vacation extra special. They are warm, helpful and very dedicated professionals.

With the full moon shining on the ocean and the stars twinkling above we danced to the most romantic sax we had ever heard. The man is a genius playing his horns. Each night we made a point to see Domingo and listen to the best music in the Caribbean.

reviews.text: Room service was just average. The Three Milk Cake is a hidden gem on that menu. Room service menus listed beverages they would not bring. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Excellence Punta Cana from December 22 to December 29 of this year. It was an amazing time had by all that attended. We arrived at the resort around 4 am because of a delay at the airport in Vancouver, but even at 4 am, the service of the bellhops and the front desk was up to par. Our bags were unloaded and immediately tagged and set to one side of the lobby while we were handed cold scented towels to cool off with. Check in was fairly expedient and we were in our rooms within twenty minutes. I had never been to an all inclusive resort before, and wasted no time enjoying the pleasures of the mini bar in the room, as well as the ample storage space for our things. Room service even at 4 am was great, the girl on the phone said it would be about 40 minutes for the food, which seemed a little long, but I think they only say that to cover there butts, because it took about 25 minutes at most. The activities during the day were well thought out, though, there was some delays and cancellations due to weather conditions (beach volleyball cancelled to due strong winds.) The entertainment staff was amazing and extremely friendly, a special thanks to all my friends, Ines (my fiance,) Altagracia (who lovingly reffered to me as Flaco Loco, which translates into Crazy Skinny Guy,) Eliza and Johanna (my disco dance partners,) Sexy Cesar (who taught me all the sexy dance moves I now know,) Julio Cesar (the MC for the games and parties.) The restaurants I can't offer too much help with, I didn't eat at all of them, but of the few I did eat at, I recommend Toscana for the huge buffet everyday, breakfast here is well prepared and quite delicious (although I don't recommend the scrambled eggs.) The omlettes are delicious and you HAVE to try one. For lunch, you have to check out the grill on the beach, different food everyday, always good, and makes the beach smell amazing. For dinner, I liked Spice ( asian cuisine,) Agave (mexican, but don't eat the calimari from here, very rubbery,) The pizza that is delivered to the pool and the beach is awesome, make sure you try that. The bars were awesome, you get accustomed to speaking the language when ordering drinks, instead of drinking your usual bacardi and coke, try the Brugal Extra Anejo, they call it the Dominican babymaker, and it's obvious why once you try it. The stuff tastes amazing and it does magic for someone trying to loosen up on the dance floor. The disco is great too, although sometimes a little empty, but still worth checking out. The worst part of my trip was the vendors, they don't let up, and I am a very well mannered person, which makes it hard to shut them down over and over again, make sure you don't tell them you like anything until you know you're going to buy it, otherwise you'll have to beat them off with a stick to get away. Try to make it to the theatre for the shows at 10pm every night, they are worth it. The ice breaker shows are fun too, it gets people into the swing of things. All in all, I would highly recommend this resort for anyone going on a honeymoon or a romantic time with the better half, there is not a very big single crowd, so parents beware taking your single sons and daughters to this resort if they're looking to party with other singles. Hope this helps you. Adios amigos and amigas.
reviews.title: Excellence was exactly that!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for six days on our honeymoon; it was the most incredible resort. The rooms were comfortable and lovely, and the service was impeccable. We were so impressed we are looking into the other Excellence resorts for our next vacation. We loved that it was all-inclusive; get hungry at 3 am? No problem, just call room service. The restaurants were impressive, and the bars were really nice; everything about the resort was visually appealing, clean, and luxurious. There were all sorts of things to do, also. We went horseback riding, spent a day in the spa (amazing!!), saw a circus and a magic show, and walked through the botanical garden, all within the resort. Most other places (Marinarium, Bavaro Tours) will pick you up right in front of the lobby if you want to do activities outside the resort. I definitely wouldn't rent a car, though, unless you are comfortable driving amongst maniacs. Not kidding.
reviews.title: Incredible!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: Seriously, though, if you are looking for a place to get away from everything, Excellence at Punta Cana is the perfect choice. Our honeymoon could not have been better.
reviews.title: They do not honor your reservations!

likes.liked: — view of the palm trees outside our room.
likes.disliked: — they did not honor our request for an oceanview room, even though they were available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For starters, Liberty Travel dropped the ball, failed to tell us that if we flew in to Santa Domingo Airport we would be facing a 4 -5 hour HORRIBLE ride over unpaved roads, since it was not the closest airport. The airport that is closest to Excellence is the Punta Cana Airport! We had to spend big $ to switch airports and airlines for our departure. Next, because we arrived so late, thanks to the long ride from the wrong airport, we were told that the room we paid for, which was partial oceanview, could not be honored, as they only had a courtyard/palm tree view available. Depressed and discouraged, we sucked it up until the next day, when they moved us to another courtyard/palm-tree room! As a compensation for this 5 day disaster, we were offered and accepted a dinner at the beach, even though all meals were paid for and inclusive. They actually told Liberty Travel that they felt that this was adequate compensation! In addition, the air conditioning in both rooms was not adequate, and sleeping was difficult. The first room had plumbing problems. When the toilet did not flush properly, and began to overflow, we called the plumber at 3 am. He kept us up for about an hour, working inside and outside the room. When we never heard from him again, we called the front desk, and told them not to send him back in, and that we would also deal with that problem on our own. Personally, I would NEVER go back to the Dominican Republic if I wanted an "excellent" vacation. It's still way too 3rd world, and has a lot of catching up to do. Don't try to use the river pool. Only a couple of brave souls entered in to it, since it was freezing. Spend a few more dollars, and go to Aruba.
reviews.title: Still great, afer 3 visits!

Good Hotel spoiled by restaurants & beach
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks in Secrets. We were actually due to stay at the Sunscape Beach but found on arrival on 1st December that it wasn't yet open and we were transferred to Secrets. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are large and comfortable, nowhere seems to be too crowded and it has a good ambience. But red no-swimming flags were hoisted every day of our stay. I took a kayak out a couple of times but swimming was really out of the question.

reviews.title: Relaxation
reviews.text: The food and service at breakfast and at lunch were very good. But we were disappointed in the themed restaurants in the evening. Almost without exception the food arrived at the table cold or lukewarm at best. Last Saturday we ate in the Mediterranean restaurant (mainly fish dishes) and my wife had a skewer of various fish and chicken. After eating a little she cut open a piece of chicken to find it was raw inside. Needless to say she ate no more and we told the waiter that the food was undercooked and could cause illness. For the following 3 days my wife was very ill and finally I called the doctor ($120 for a room visit) who advised re-hydration at a local (1 hour bumpy ride away) clinic. Ambulance there $150 and taxi back $50. 3 hours at the clinic where they ran blood and urine tests and hooked up a drip. The bill for the clinic is going straight to the insurance company but I'd be surprised if it was less than $500. We reported the matter to the catering manager the next morning - the day we were leaving. He promised to make enquiries (?) and get back to us before we left. He didn't.

reviews.title: great place for couples
reviews.text: The hotel has a lot going for it and we found the staff very helpful but you do not expect hygiene problems with food in a 5 star hotel.

reviews.title: Great Resort!
reviews.text: Myself, husband, and two married couple family members stayed at SE from Dec.3-Dec.8,04. We were all in need of rest, sun, and lazy days on the beach. SE does a wonderful job with trying to please its customers. We ( 3 married couples- early 30's-late 30's-late 40's) all traveled on 5 night certificates purchased off the internet for a total of $775 total for all six people- average $258 per couple. With that being said, I will try to judge this resort as if I paid full rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great trip! Fabulous resort. Excellent food, service, and Martini Bar! Beautiful beach, blue ocean. Terrific help, especially Inez our friendly and fun activities coordinator, Andre, our great water aerobics instructor, and Pedro, our favorite bartender!! I would recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a fun vacation at a fabulous price. $1500 a person -including air - all inclusive!!!!! Top shelf liquor. Beautiful accommodations and grounds! Very clean pools, good entertainment. It caters to honeymooners but we were a group of 10 and had a great time. For dinners we had to separate into 4 & 6 or 5&5. Fantastic service. Special cooking lesson on the beach everyday and then lunch would be served!!! We are looking forward to going back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall our experience at Excellence was wonderful! There were a few dissappointments. I won't belabor the negatives but will highlight them. Upon checking in, the front desk employee tried to sell us an upgrade. We declined and decided to stay with our original reservation. The first night there we learned our buildings elevator was not working and the ice machine was non-existant. The next day we mentioned that to the same person at the front desk who checked us in the prior day. She offered to move us to another building or deliver ice. A free upgrade for the inconvenience was out of the question! We decided to stay with our original room, which was a beautiful room, rather than disrupt our stay by moving and repacking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Excellence from Oct 15-22. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary but had never been on an overseas trip together so we really didn't know what to expect. We had talked to family & friends who had been to the DR and did much research into the resort on Trip Advisor. Thank the Lord, we couldn't have planned a nicer trip. We loved every minute and would go back to the Excellence in a heartbeat if we could.
reviews.title: Loved every minute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the reviews we read had prepared us for the trip from the airport to the resort. The roads were very bumpy but our driver from Coco tours did a nice job of avoiding as many potholes as he could. Remember to take your Bonine if you are susceptible to car sickness. Driving through the countryside was interesting. My wife and I both were thinking to ourselves that we might have made a mistake in our destination choice until we entered the gates at the Excellence. We had stopped on the way to the Excellence at a couple of other resorts to drop other couples off and those resorts didn't even compare to the Excellence. The grounds at the Excellence were beautiful and well kept. You were greeted by friendly faces w/ a cold cloth and drink. Then we were guided to the folks at the Excellence Club. We did have the Excellence Club package and thought that it was worth it. You could get food or drink there all day if you preferred. Ricardo, Johan, Ana, Roberto, Magdilina and Carlos were really our family for the week. Their help with some problems we had w/ Expedia excursions was much appreciated. They couldn't do enough to make your stay "Excellente" . It was such a nice touch to have a prepared bubble bath awaiting us when we returned to our room after dinner on our last night there. All the staff members were courteous and helpful and always greeted you with a smile. Our room was great. Spacious enough for two and had a nice little patio and hammock in the yard. With the high bushes you still had your privacy. The room was clean, and cool, the bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Honeymoon from Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the Excellence you can do as much or as little as you want. There are plenty of daily activities. My wife and I were there to celebrate a second honeymoon and to be together, enjoy each other and relax. This was the perfect place for it. As I said the grounds were beautiful with many different kinds of flowers dotting the walking paths. Birds and butterflies were everywhere. The beach was great and big enough so that you could find your own quiet place to chill. The water was warm and a little rough but as was stated in the other reviews, you could go down the beach to the right around the bend a little way and wade out into a calmer area. My wife and I did this on a few occassions and had the area all to ourselves. The pool was spacious and well kept. It seemed like most of the people stayed by the pool during our week. Yes, you did have to get up early to get the best spots and the floating rafts. We never had a problem with towels as we would go to the Excellence Club and get them if there were none on the rack. The weather couldn't have been more consistently beautiful. (88 degrees with a refreshing breeze off the ocean) Nights were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Not a bad word to say about the Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was fine. I am a bland person when it comes to food and not hard to please. We really enjoyed the buffet breakfast at the Toscana and the Lasagna at the Oregano. Most of our meals were in the Toscana and the Grill. My wife enjoyed the different seafoods as well. The food on the beach during lunch each day was great. "Excellent" pizza! We did do one excursion (1/2 day Safari) and enjoyed watching how the coffee and cocoa were made. The highlight was our 1/2 hour boogie boarding on a beautiful beach nearby. Overall, my wife and I have no complaints. "The Excellence" and whole experience was eveything and more that we had prayed for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: my stay at excellnce was the best all around caribbean vacation ever. i have been in the caribean at various spots in excess of a dozen times . the saxofonist DOMINGO was the best artist i have ever had the pleasure to listen to. he was a very friendly and warm man, that made you want to see more of him each night. seconly and certainly up there with domingo was our VIP vacation rep JONATHON he truely wants to help you have a great time and was very wam as well. now for the resort itself, the food was out of this world good the wait staff attentive and friendly. the actual structures and surroundings showed a bit of ware, but they probably are booked pretty full most of the time because this was a value vacation, and it probably is hard to keep up with everything in what is a very large complex. did i mention the pools oh my god they are huge and seemingly endless we just loved them. the week we were there the ocean was a bit rough but we were still able to enjoy the well groomed beach. i am recommending this vacation spot to all my friends and feel confident they will love it as much as we did. p.s. do not miss DOMING'S nightly sets they were perfect relaxation after a perfect meal.
reviews.title: loved domingo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our 20th anniversary stay at the Excellence resort October 18 - 25, 2008. We've been to a few places and generally like to try a different location/resort every time but this is the first time we have sworn to go back. I want to touch on a few points that other people don't seem to mention too much about. We booked through travelocity which I would not do again. I originally booked at Dreams resort and then decided to switch within a day or two after reading some reviews and realizing that there would be a fair amount of children there. They were not flexible (even though I had trip insurance) and charged me a HUGE fee to change. Our transportation was through Prieto tours to and from the hotel and I would definitely recommend them. Yes!...the roads are bumpy and its a long ride and the traffic is straight out of the Romancing the Stone. However, the buses were full size buses and well air conditioned. I didn't feel it was nearly as bad as I had read in reviews....if you do want to comment on that, I would suggest pressuring the hotels because as I understand it, they are responsible for the roads that come directly to the resort area and you will notice the roads closest to the airport (federally funded I believe) are no worse than any other carribean country.
reviews.title: Super!!

You could still boogie board and as I'm not the strongest swimmer this area of the beach was more suited to me.

Although the place is beautiful, it is an accident waiting to happen and that is what exactly occured. I won't bore you with all the details, but on therday of check in and on our way to the room, my wife turned her ankle on a very low step down in the resort lobby. reviews.title: A Ruined Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After seeing the resort doctor, he wanted our insurance info. to cover the medical costs. We refused and asked to speak with the resort manager. We explained the incident to the manager and he stated, "your wife's feet caused the accident, not the resort." What an endearing attitude(?) and great customer service. Clearly, he accepted no responsibility for the fall. After much fruitless discussion with this uncaring, unsympathetic and unprofessional manager of a 5 star resort(?), he would only cover medical expenses incurred in the DR for my wife's treatment, if we signed a waiver. Left with little choice we signed the waiver and got the medical attention she needed.
reviews.title: this place is great!

Secrets needs some time
reviews.text: I truley believe that Secrets will be one of the best resorts anywhere after they get a couple more years of the same people working there and a "real" plumber. My wife and I spent a week at secrets in october on our honeymoon. First of all this place is gorgeous, there is not a thing I can say that would be able to put it in perspective how beautiful this place really is. We had a great time we met alot of really cool couples and drank alot of el presedente. The night showes I thought were really kinda cool and the night club was very cool. The only problems we encountered were that our toilet did not work for majority of the time every night we had someone up there "fixing" it and nothing ever happened and 3 of our nights were ruined because you cant leave them up there alone. That led to many room service dinners and the room service meals were awful! The restaraunts were awsome the room service sucks....write that down. The help did not appreciate any tips, almost seemed that they were expecting them. Ants, there will be alot of ants in your room f.y.i. Do not upgrade to the excellence club it is about $1000 more and is not worth it , not to mention that if your there on your honeymoon you can upgrade for free, which my travel adgent happened to keep that part a secret...no pun intended. Over all we had a great time I will always remember this place but in retrospec for the money I feel I could have had a little more bang for the buck.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to really try to not have a good time here. I don't understand any of the bad reviews. We were treated so well. The second we walked in the door we were greeted with a Mimosa and told "Welcome Home". Our luggage was taken right to our room which was absolutely beautiful. We had a corner suite. One deck overlooked the pool and the other looked out over the ocean. We tried every restaurant except the Dominican food, and we never had a bad meal. Room service was very prompt, we had our breakfast within 20 minutes usually. We played in the ocean ( I felt like a kid again). And lounged by the pool. The staff was wonderful. Everyone always greeted you with a smile. I suggest that everyone wake up early at least one morning and take a walk down the beach to watch the sunrise. It is breaktaking ;) Hi to our new friends from New York.......Mayda, Rosario, Lucy and Anthony. If we ever get the chance, we will definitely return to Secrets.

We were quickly taken to the Excellence Club (we did upgrade to that and I would do it all over again) where we were checked-in in about 2 minutes. The Excellence Club has finger foods all day and free internet service. Our room was a Jr. Club Suite and was on the second floor and we had a beautiful view of a water pond/garden where we watched the peacocks, turkeys, et al roam about daily.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Excellence Punta Cana from February 15-20 and our stay was amazing! The resort is absolutely beautiful with large groves of Palm trees and artistic landscaping. Our room was perfect- with a large canopy king bed, comfy pillows and mattress. I loved the marble floors and decorations in the resort. We had a second floor garden view and this was nice (very quiet). There was no noise from the rooms beside us.
reviews.title: Excellence Punta Cana was Amazing!

likes.liked: — Beautiful beach, the rooms, the service and the food!

reviews.title: Loved It ....BUT
reviews.text: The servers and bartenders were very friendly. Benjamin at the Cafe Kafe bar was awesome. Our room steward kept the mini fridge full of Presidente beer and water as we asked. The food was great at every restaurant. We enjoyed the Lobster House and Barcelona and had dinner at each twice. The Chinese restaurant "Spice" was also good. If you like seafood- there's a variety (mahi mahi, grouper and shrimp on most menus- even at lunch).

reviews.title: Excellence continues to be Excellent....
reviews.text: The frozen drinks were excellent (premium liquor). We had no problems with long waits at the bars- even though the resort was at full capacity. The spa is wonderful- we had massages and good pedicures. I recommend the horseback riding that the resort includes (20-30 minutes). It was fun galloping down the beach! The pool is beautiful and we could always find a chair somewhere. The beach is great for walking on. The sea was a little rough, but 2 days you could swim in it. The shows at night were above average (we saw belly dancing, a magician, a great singer and a cool circus act). There were also many activities and you could join in if you wanted- aerobics on the beach, volleyball, etc. Also Yoga and stretching at the spa.I hope this review is helpful. I'd highly recommend Excellence Punta Cana. It's a great place for couples!

reviews.title: 9 out of 10
reviews.text: This place was PERFECT...almost. First, the minor bads: published prices for the spa are subject to change (more $), you can get sick (bring Tums and AD medicine), and watch for extra charges on your room bill (they were taken care of at checkout). Now...the rest: this place is beautiful, the staff is helpful & friendly, the food is great (except for the Chinese), the activities (horseback riding, Yoga) are fun, and the one tour we took (helicopter) was outstanding! If your idea of a perfect day is getting up for breakfast, doing a little workout (gym, beach, pool), then having drinks at the beach or pool, going to lunch, hitting the swim-up bar in the afternoon, eating a nice dinner, then partying until you go to sleep, then this is the place for you! Shopping at the local mercado is also fun - they negotiate. We've been on a criuse, and to a Sandals, & this place was BY FAR better than any of our other vacations!!
