reviews.text: Check in was smooth and easy. The mimosas and cool cloths were great. Our room was beautiful. Everything was marble or terra cotta. We had a third floor room with a vaulted ceiling...fantastic! The whirlpool in the room was huge and we used it often. Our room had a garden view but you could easily see the ocean. The maid service was so-so. We didn't really think about tipping them everyday and instead waited till the end. Maybe that would have helped. Chain your door if you don't want them walking in after two knocks on the door. Overall the rooms were spotless and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellence was Excellent!!!
From Scotland to Paradise
reviews.text: The beach was great! Far cleaner than most. I thought I'd be worried about staying on the Atlantic side but that was actually the fun part! The water was clear and warm. The waves were perfect for either splashing around or boogie boarding. Snorkeling was fun for a beginner but I can see where you'd hope for more. They also had boating etc that we didn't take advantage of. The huts on the beach were great for an afternoon nap! The hammocks were great for early evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a couple in our mid 20s and we decided on Excellence because of all the reviews on this website. We have traveled all over Central America-Guatemala, Honduras (roatan), Jamaica, Costa Rica, Mexico. We were here May 31st -June 9th.
reviews.title: The BEST beach vacation ever!

likes.disliked: — bug bites (so minor compared to the positives!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To tell you the truth, everything here EXCEEDED our expectations from the moment we arrived with champagne, a beautiful room on the inside with rose petals on the bathtub & sink, an ocean view room that seemed like it had the best view on the place.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Nice, & Great Service - Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach- UNBELIEVABLE. Not a rock in sight, so fun to play in with some mild waves. For those who said it's too strong, I live in Nebraska and any wave is a wave to us...these were perfect for boogeyboarding or playing in. Beautiful teal green water you could see your toes in!
reviews.title: Excellent but take bug spray

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pools- Awesome! One is the length of a football field & the other has such a calming waterfall effect I wanted to stay all day, but didn't because the ocean was so inviting!
reviews.title: best resort ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food- Great! The chateaubriand at Chez Isabelle was as good as Nebraska beef, and that's saying a lot for a farm girl. Also, the french onion soup here & portabella mushroom were amazing.
reviews.title: great...not excellent

likes.liked: — Gorgeous beach, food and friendly service in general
likes.disliked: — Service on the beach (and lack thereof)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from our vacation at Secrets (July 6-12). The couple we went with and ourselves were constantly reading the reviews of this resort prior to our departure and to be blunt, they scared the (---) out of me. My wife and I have been on numerous vacations to the caribbean and went all-inclusive to Sandals-Antigua for our honeymoon so we have a variety of vacation experiences to compare with. After reading a couple hundred reviews and personally spending a week at Secrets, I can only come to the following conclusion. Either I ended up at the wrong resort or the people who wrote the negative reviews must be some of the most miserable, hard to please individuals on this planet and I can only hope they are never staying at the same resort as me. I will back up this statement with some examples and reasons.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: 1) The complaints about the ride from the airport being to long and the road being too bumpy. Apparently these people don't own a globe. I was expecting both due to the fact hat I looked at a map to see where I was actually going to be and the DR is a third world country and that's the way the roads are going to be.
reviews.title: Relax & enjoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: 2) People complained about their departure becuase they had to spend two hours in an airport that was an open air grass hut that was warm and humid. I'll cut them some slack because they were probably just bitter at the fact they were going home. But, apparently they didn't venture over to the other side of the airport that wasn't open, was air conditioned with a fully stocked bar and duty free shopping.
reviews.title: We went for a wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: 3) Some complained about the food not being very good and the portions being to small. Hellooooooo...... you're in Punta Cana! You want good Italian food go to Italy. You want good sushi go to Japan. I happen to be from Connecticut where we have some very good Italian and some of the best pizza and seafood. The food at Secrets was definitely not "Home Cooking" but I was smart enough not to expect it to be. The only requirement I expected their food to have was that it be edible. All the restaurants surpasssed that. As for the portions being to small; all-inclusive (translation is unlimited quantities and free). Order another dinner if you're still hungry!
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: 4) The complaint I found to be the most annoying and idiotic was that the drinks didn't have enough alchohol in them. Can you say "151 Floater" or "Absolut on the Rocks"? If spanish is your strong suit try "un poquito mas" and if all else fails try the mamajuana (unless your scared). The bartenders will be more than happy to boost the octane in your drinks if you just ask them to do so. Once again two words...all-inclusive!
reviews.title: Liked it but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were really looking forward to a nice, relaxing honeymoon and we were quite dissappointed. We reserved what was supposedly the best of the best of rooms- the excellence honeymoon suite, to ensure our relaxing vacation. Our room was overbooked the first night. That set the tone for the rest of the week. We were in a sub-par room for the first night (there was no point in unpacking and settling in) and spent most of the second day trying to figure out when we were going to move, where to, and making sure everything went with us. This wouldn't have been that awful, except that the resort wasn't to interested in rectifying the situation. They only wanted to offer us an $80 CREDIT to the logo shop (which we weren't purchasing anything from), any extra wines (which we didn't want to buy), or the spa (which we weren't using). The $80 was supposedly the difference between the two rooms. They also tried to say that they gave us extras on our package, but what they were offering was already in our package. A good part of the following week was spent stewing over this and arguing with the policy. After almost two months of back and forth with the travel agent, the decided to refund us $100 back on my credit card. After spending almost $4000 for the resort, I think a $100 refund is PATHETIC.
reviews.title: Dissappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of the room issue, the food was not very good. I keep reading these other reviews and wonder where they were eating that the food was so great. We were not impressed at all. The room service was good IF you tipped them the first time around. The electric was off and on randomly (which I have heard is often a problem in the islands), and twice our cold water went out. (Not really fun to be scalded if you're in the shower.)
reviews.title: The best resort in Punta Cana!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I just returned from Excellence and we loved it. Originally we were booked to stay at the Eden but, less than 24 hours before departure, learned it was overbooked. Our travel agent had us moved to the Excellence at the same price.....a real bonus for us since we would never have been able to afford the Excellence otherwise.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Excellence was incredible. The food in all the restaurants was great. Our favourites were the Asian and the Mexican. Unfortunately the service at the restaurants at dinner time was not always the best. Our waiters at the Italian and the Mexican restaurants were so bad it almost spoiled the meals. On the other hand, we had pizza late at night at Oregano's and the (one and only) waiter was fabulous. The lunch staff at the Grill never stopped but still managed to give good service with a smile.
reviews.title: Been to quite a few, this one ranks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are huge and spotless. The worst thing was the beds - hard, like sleeping on a boxspring! The pools are beautiful and the beach is great. The water is rough but lots of people were still in it.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Excellence for 7 nights during Thanksgiving week.
reviews.title: Beautiful and friendly

likes.disliked: — No towns nearby to walk to or shop at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been traveling to the D.R. for 9 years, 7 of those to Excellence. All 7 have been great experiences but this year was even greater. It was the many little things that contributed to the difference. For example: The coffee was consistently great, not bitter as in past; various repairs to things like the pedestrian bridge by the Excellence club; The construction of a towel repository near the main pool and the construction of the beach canopy with tables and chairs to enjoy a revolving BBQ menu every day; The telephone calls to the room to see if all was OK with our stay; The constant requests by the Service Manager, Roberto Puello, if there was anything else he could do to make our stay more enjoyable. (as I said to him, if there was anything more than what he already had done, it would have meant that I died and went to heaven); The news papers in the restaurant during breakfast; the covered stage in Santo Domingo square; the remodeled rooms with a roomy shower, excellent water pressure and plenty of hot water; excellent working air conditioner; and the best tasting martini's ever; the food preparation was attractive and tasty; the lobster house finally had lobster tails that were larger than in the past and all the fish that I had was delicious.
reviews.title: BEST VACATION TO DATE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the service - in all seven of our stays the hallmark of this hotel has always been the service and friendliness of the staff - from top to bottom. I must make mention of some of those staff that I have know for a number of years and have never disappointed me:
reviews.title: Great Anniversary Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It all starts at the top with Raphael Puello. He was constantly soliciting from the guests what changes they would like to see and unlike any other hotel that I have been at, actually incorporated some of those requests the very next day. Now that is what I call responsive.
reviews.title: Honeymoon gone bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1. Roberto Puello, Service Manager (If he were a bit smaller, my wife would have tried to take him home in our luggage). This guy couldn't do enough for us. He never made us feel that we were imposing and he would stop whatever he was doing to accommodate our requests.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Adan - the best waiter there is.
reviews.title: They saved our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BRING BUGSPRAY TO THE BEACH AND SPRAY ON YOU BEFORE YOU LAY OUT. We were bit alive and didn't know it. They call the "can't see um bugs" . Ruined our entire stay. I asked at the desk why they didn't tell you about the sand bugs. They just shrugged their shoulders and said they spray every day. I don't know what they use but if you have to buy bugspray it was 12.00 a can.
reviews.title: Sand Bugs Eat You Alive Bring OFF Spray

likes.disliked: — Sand flies bite you can't see um, can't swim in ocean water too rough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One word Fabulous!!! It was great!! The most relaxing vacation I have ever been on!! The food was great, the entertainment was great, the staff was great and the room was awsome!! The beds are a little hard, but I slept really well!! The ocean is a little rough it was balck flaged one day and the rest it was red flaged. We got in the ocean everyday except the day it was black flaged. It was so much fun to have some waves but most of the time we would go out far enough before the waves would break, it was about up to our shoulders. Overall the best vacation I have been on yet!! We did go to saona island with seavis tours which was great because there was only 8 of us and when we were at the island there were only a few other people we never saw a crowd. I definately recommend seavis tours though because they only take 8-10 people on their tour!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure, the ride form the airport is long and bumpy, but just ask your driver to stop on the way for some cold beers and he will be happy to oblige. I would recommend the upgrade to the excellence package. The stay was excellent. Food was good. Drinks were great. The Mamajuana was awesome. I will be going back soon. I was most impressed with the staff. Anything you want, you get. The nightly entertainment is wonderful. We caught the Michael Jackson Show, a solo performer and the Circus show. The only drawback, and this is minor, the ocean was a little rough, but I just got in to cool off anyway. A must go for couples. You'll love it.
reviews.title: just go!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned late last night from 7 days/6 nights in the Excellence Punta Cana Resort and are ready to plan our next trip back. We were there from May 19th until May 25th for our Honeymooon. When we saw people checking out during the week, we felt so bad for them, and when it was our time to leave, we were trying to figure out if they would notice if we just lived there. We didn't ask for any upgrades and our reservation was for a Jr. Garden Suite Room (least expensive). Unless you are very high maintenance or have money to burn- we didn't think anything else was necessary- it was wonderful with just this.
reviews.title: Excellennnnnte! Good Advice in this Review! You won't want to leave!

likes.liked: — Incredible Staff, Gorgeous Beach, Easy to Relax here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will keep this review as rich with advice as possible, because so many people just get on here an use it as an outlet to whine and I think helpful tips are more beneficial to someone considering a trip.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

likes.disliked: — food could have been better, but it was still really good

reviews.title: Second Time As Good As First
reviews.text: The greatest thing that could make or break a vacation - the employees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was very responsive, the waiters (Danny & Alfredo) were great as usual and the rec. staff (Franklin, Joel, Rolondo and the rest of the staff were EXCELLENT. Franklin also was a great teacher of the Spanish language.
reviews.title: Exellence was excellente!!!!

likes.liked: — Our room, the pool, beach and gardens and also the friendly staff.
likes.disliked: — Nothing to do outside accommodation, roads very bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one disappointment was the maid service. As the week progressed, the service deteriorated. The last two days our room was never made up and I had to hunt for towels. This was uncharacteristic as last year our maid service was great.
reviews.title: Dont beleive the good reviews, we were fooled too...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Excellence in Punta Cana from 10th July to 24th July 2008. We were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We arrived after a long flight and 1 hour journey by bus very tired and were welcomed by the reception staff with a drink of wine each. When we got to our room we were 'over the moon' with it, it was fantastic with a four poster bed and jacuzzi we had never stayed at a 5 star hotel before so this was all new to us. The hotel itself was fantastic and the gardens were very well kept, we stayed in building 9 our room was on the seond floor and the view of the gardens and fountains was fantastic! It was so peaceful we never heard any noise at all in the fortnight we stayed there. We tended to go to the beach most of the time as there was a lovely breeze there you can walk along the beach for miles in both directions but beware of the beach vendors who will 'pounce' on you and then hassle you until you buy something from them. Also when it is cloudy beware as you will still get burnt as we did so make sure you use sun cream all the time and cover up. The mosquitos also come out late afternoon so cover up then as you will get bitten. The staff do come round every evening in a truck with what looks like a cannon that fires out mosquito killer stuff out of it and this seems to kill them off for the rest of the evening. They couldn't have treat us better on our Anniversary Day we had a champagne breakfast in bed and a lovely meal in the Spice restaurant on the night-time it was really special. I would recommend taking loads of dollar bills for tips and also remember to keep 20 dollars each as you need this to get out of the country. The only downside to this holiday was the roads - full of pot-holes - and the fact that there was nothing else to do or any where to go outside the hotel, also some of the restaurants were not up to standard ie Toscana, The Grill and Chez Isabelle the others were ok - Spice, Agave and Oregano. The food for breakfast and lunch was the best as it was buffet-style and the quality and choice was really good. We won't go back to the Dominican Republic as we like to go out and about and explore but I would recommend the Hotel to anyone who wants a quiet, relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: What a big disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me preface this review by apologizing for the length, but there are many things that needed to be mentioned...
reviews.title: Average not Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 7 night for our honeymoon and we had a great time. The food was great, the service staff was friendly and the room we got on the 3rd floor was really big. Rooms on the top floor have a cathedral ceiling and they really look bigger. Plus the hot tubs/jacuzzi in each room is definitely a plus. We only used it 2 or 3 times while we were there, but it was great to have that option when we wanted to just relax. The beach is amazing and the water is wonderful. Just FYI, the hotel is located on the Atlantic Ocean side of Punta Cana so you won't have the blue water, but it is still clean and warm non the less.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One complain I have is that the Ocean Grill restaurant food is not that great. I was really hoping to have some amazing fresh fish there, being by the water and a grill, but I was less than impressed. All other restaurants though were really good.
reviews.title: 10th anniversary in paradise

likes.liked: — No responsibilities and being treated great.
likes.disliked: — Heat in July, distance from airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had a great experience and we definitely plan to go back there. I think if you really want to, you can always find something to complain about, but we're not that kind of couple so it's not even worth mentioning the little things we didn't like here and there.
reviews.title: Mostly Good

likes.disliked: — Bike Tour, Limited English speaking staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend Secrets, specially for honeymooners. It's couples only, so there weren't any single ppl or children, so that will make you vacation much more relaxing and stress free.
reviews.title: Truly is Excellente!!!

likes.disliked: — The ride from airport to resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Excellence from July 8th to July 14th and it was fantastic.. It was our 10th anniversary and it was the first time we stayed at an all inclusive resort. All aspects of the resort were fabulous! The food, the drinks, the grounds, the staff....everything was beyond our expectations! Our first day we met a couple from Floral Park, NY who said they have traveled to the Carribean for 20 years and this was the best place they have ever been.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, Watch out for the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is excellent!! The restaurants, waiters, show, beach, services...
reviews.title: Excellence = Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beautiful resort, every staff member is great, lots to do, food is amazing. Absolutely no complaints. Room service and in room mini bars are a really nice touch. We will be back!!!
reviews.title: Unbelievable- just an awesome resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you probably can see by all of the glaringly awesome reviews this place does in fact live up to it's name of Excellence. My wife and I traveled there the week of March 18th to celebrate my graduation from my MBA and enjoy a long awaited trip. I will break down this review into 3 sections: The Good, The Bad, and Things to Know.
reviews.title: Awesome with a couple small issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Not what it once was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beaches and Pools: From the spectacular beach to the awesomely long pool, this is a great place to visit if you enjoy sitting by the pool reading a book and enjoying some great drinks.
reviews.title: No Hot Water!!!!! Week of March 17th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from Excellence, Punta Cana 2/14-2/19. We booked a junior suite ocean view and were upgraded upon arrival to a swimout ocean view which was great. The room was larger than regular rooms and had a giant king four poster bed, 2 person jacuzzi (which we used nightly), 2 slidiing glass doors opening onto a flagstone patio two steps down and we were at the pool. We called it the lazy river for adults. Really quiet and beautiful. Our first night back and there was champagne, chocolates and roses, it was Valentine's Day! Romantic.
reviews.title: Excellence is so relaxing
Vacation Paradise
reviews.text: We had the breakfast buffet which was great with everything that you could ever want. For lunch there was a buffet, The Grill and many days a bech bbq or something else. In the evenings, we went to all but the Mexican restaurant and it was all really good. We had lobster, filet, chateaubriand, scallops, seabass, lamb. All of it was great. The poolside grill night was great with steak and shrimp on the grill. The dress code is a bit more casual than I expected. I overpacked as usual!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment was good. Something different every night. We actually loved the "naughty" piano player who is there on friday and monday nights.
reviews.title: This is Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was fabulous with regular chairs and bali beds but some folks deemed it necessary to come out at the crack of dawn and put a magazine and towel on the chair so that no one else could get it. One day, I actually saw a man do that and then go to the beach and proceed to put towels on four different palapa's. He was on the beach all day and then went up to his primo pool chairs. It takes all kinds of people.
reviews.title: The best resort ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was lovely and pristine with plenty of chairs and towels and palapas for eveeryone. There was a waitress bringing drinks of the day and asking what you would like. Whenever you asked a staff person how they were doing, it was always, "Excellente." There was a waiter with fresh fruit sticks in the afternoon as well as pizza's and hot dogs or whatever you desired. The water was lovely but a bit rough.
reviews.title: WOW!! Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps it was the time of year that by boyfriend and I decided to go (8/26-9/1) but we were very uncomfortable in the evenings due to the lack of air conditioning throughout the hotel. Out of Seven restaurants there were only (3) that were enclosed (Toscana, Spice & Agave). The Grill which is a steak house is over the pool. How can anyone be expected to eat STEAK in such hot and humid conditions.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - But too Buggy and Humid

likes.liked: — Beautiful Resort and very friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Lack of Air Conditioning and too many insects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had heard about the mosquito's and came prepared. I had can's of OFF, Suntan Lotion with bug repellent for an army. I was diligent each and every day. Wore no Perfum, but still received about 100 bites. Nothing seemed to work. Even the hotels admirable efforts failed. The sand flies by the beach are EVIL!!!
reviews.title: Great time at Excellence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment each night is held in the luxurious lobby - but it's all open, no A/C. There is a fantastic Sax player each evening, but you couldn't enjoy him because your sweating and scratching non-stop.
reviews.title: Super Excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the Hotel is beautiful and the staff were very accomodating. The rest of the Island is very, very poor.
reviews.title: Great trip to Excellence Resort

likes.liked: — fully stocked bar (top shelf or whatever you want), pool, bars, variety of restaurants
likes.disliked: — distance from airport to resort, view from the room (not beach...it was pool view)

reviews.title: Excellence Resort
reviews.text: Although, we had a good time - we will not go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to have Secrets chosen for us! We had looked at the resort but were not willing to pay the 1500.00+ for the experience. So we chose the 6 Apple deal and got lucky. Let me tell you this resort is beautiful. There is no big strip of hotels lining the beach, people everywhere or anything. It is a secluded beach, resort and is everything two hard working people could ask for.
reviews.title: Lucky for Us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We were not on our honeymoon or anything! We stayed over the July 4th week also. I constantly worried about the weather, and again we lucked out. It rained one afternoon, of course on the fourth of July and that was it.
reviews.title: A gret getaway
Excellent!
reviews.text: We had a late check in around 10PM. Of course we didnt get a towel or drink, which would have been nice but it was okay. They offered us an upgrade from a garden room which we turned down ($420.00). Our bags were brought up promptly, we ordered room service which does take a while, but it was good, hot and no additional charge (we tipped most of the time). The next day when we figured out the location of our room to the resort, we checked back in to see if we could negociate a better price on an upgrade, no deal. We took a look at the room, ocean view, big balcony, pool view, and decided it was worth the money. We were so glad we did that! Needless to say, our room was kept very clean, and we only saw our maid one time. We left 5 dollars each day for our maid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: All the other reviews are accurate as far as the food which is strange, but we realized we were not the the USA. The service was good. We liked the Sea Side, Bordeaux, Patio, and the breakfast buffet. We ordered room service for breakfast several times and ate on our balcony, beautiful.
reviews.title: Good time at Secrets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The bartenders Rayna, and shoot I cant think of his name, at the far end of the pool are great! We brought insulated mugs and had it filled with Champagne and Ice every morning at ten and then headed for the beach. They are great about coming around and filling you up too!
reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon
Wonderful time
reviews.text: Secrets can only be described as a taste of paradise. My wife and I stayed there from 5/20 untill 5/27. I am not long winded and only would like to say a few things. The hotel was amasing. The rooms were very nice, all of them had large jacuzzi tubs. The employees were extremely friendly and went out of their way to help the guests of the resort. The food was wonderful. I felt that the best meal was the night that they had a party on the beach. On the beach was a beautiful array of all kinds of food imaginable. Tips were appreciated, but not expected. My wife and I had taken 150 dollars in ones and spent most of it. But there were many people not tipping at all. The weather was amasing. The weather channel had predicted thunderstroms for the whole week and to be honest there was never a cloud in the sky. The work out room was very nice with plenty of equipment to keep in shape for the week. My wife and I felt very safe taking several walks down the beach off of the resort. We spoke with many couples during the week and did not meet one who did not love everything about their trip. The one negative thing I have to say about the trip is that Secrets is very far from the airport. Probably 90 minute drive. It was worth the drive....

reviews.title: Really glad we didn't back out!
reviews.text: If I ever get the opportunity I will definately return.

reviews.title: Will Not Return to Secrets...........
reviews.text: PS Dont forget bug spray!!!

reviews.title: Best All Inclusive Resort We've been to.
reviews.text: We decided to return for our second trip to the DR for our 3rd anniversary. We are 26 and 34. Our last visit we stayed at the Iberostar Bavaro, which we really enjoyed. This year we thought we's upgrade to Secrets. Having read several months of reviews and postings on the forums, I was a little worried about the supposed drop in service at Secrets. I am 100% happy that we didn't let the bad reviews wreck our wonderful trip. If I had to change anything, I wouldn't have taken the late flight out of Chicago, but that has nothing to do with Secrets.

reviews.title: Honeymoon Paradise
reviews.text: We decided against the Excellence club because of the price. Instead, we booked a garden view. Before we left, I e-mailed Maria with a third floor, building 5 or 6, anniversary request. She definitely came through. We arrived at midnight May 13th (PC time), no mimosas or towels, which I wasn't expecting due to the time of our arrival. Our room was exactly what I requested, room #6205 complete with champagne and a fruit basket. We had no problems with our room all week. We had twice daily maid service, turn down service 3x, and a fully stocked mini-bar everyday. We left $5 our first day with a note for more water, beer, and soda. We had only one little bug in our room. No problems with water, actually the water in our room was often really hot. I think being on the third floor helped with the musty smell as well. Last time we were in the DR, our clothes smelled for months after we got back. I don't even notice the smell even this first week back. Our room smelled very fresh everyday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Excellence from November 23 - 28, 2007 for our honeymoon. What an awesome experience! Had read quite a few reviews prior to our trip and was braced for the worst in regards to the ride to the resort from the airport, the food, and the mosquitoes. Not an issue with anything - the ride was an adventure, the food was very good and not one mosquito bite (I normally get chomped at home in Hilton Head so why I was spared is still a mystery, especially when I didn't put one drop of repellent on!!). Not to mention the beauty of the resort, the cleanliness (for which I am a stickler!), and the staff.
reviews.title: Perro caliente, we had a great time!

likes.disliked: — Oh wait - wasn't crazy about the coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to take a well deserved rest for JUST THE TWO OF US - for the first time in almost 14 years. Our agent suggested the Dominican Republic, and then the Excellence Punta Cana resort. We've stayed at our share of all-inclusives (including Sandals) and were not impressed. The Excellence changed that and we can't wait to try another one of their properties! This time, we did not stay in the Excellence Club rooms, but I did not feel that we were missing out. However, next time we may try them just to see if we were!
reviews.title: Worth Every Penny

likes.disliked: — Was bored stupid by the 4th day, but more relaxed by the 5th day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From start to finish - a completely worry-free and relaxing vacation. We were picked up at the airport by a van cab with only one other couple. We arrived within about 1 1/4 hours and were immediately greeted by a smartly uniformed bellhop, who relieved us of our bags while a lovely lady presented us each with a cool towel and glass of champagne (yummy Spanish bubbly - always complimentary).
reviews.title: Rafalena Rocks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was about 11pm, so we were tired. We opened the door to our suite & gasped to see it was about the size of our living and dining room together, with a jacuzzi bath & canopy bed - just like in the pictures. Clean, smelled great ALL the time. Only point in question - we received anywhere between 2 and 4 large towels each day - however, the mini fridge was well stocked and there was twice daily maid service (turn down service at night).
reviews.title: Out of this World…..5* Excellence for 14 nights!

likes.liked: — 4 poster bed and jacuzzi as standard
likes.disliked: — shutting the door on the final day :(

reviews.title: Dream Wedding..thanks to Ana, Fran and Excellence Resorts
reviews.text: Too tired to venture out, yet famished, we ordered room service (complimentary always - 24 hours - really!) and 30 minutes later we were eating absolutely delicious food. A couple of times, we received slightly different things than we ordered, but whatever we got, it was wonderful and served with a smile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day, we were astonished by the natural beauty of the beach and the gorgeous, well-kept grounds, complete with live flamingos & parrots. The beach is quite private (though technically federal property) because there are really no other hotels nearby. The water is rough - the first 4 days we used the boogie boards, but the last 3 the beach was closed for swimming as the waves were reaching heights of 10 feet or more. No problem. About 30 feet away on one end of the beach, and a couple of hundred feet on the other, the water calmed significantly and if you wanted ocean swimming and some snorkelling, you had it.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation!

likes.liked: — Awesome pool, great food, friendly staff

reviews.title: Heaven on Earth
reviews.text: My wife and I went there for our 3 year anniversary and lets just say we loved it so much we themed one of rooms in the house as our Punta Cana room. We have been many places, but this was the best. Wonderful facility, staff, food & entertainment. We will definately be going back! If you are looking for a place to relax and to have no worries, Secrets Excellence, Punta Cana is the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: My husband and I were at Secrets Excellence the week of Jan. 14-21, 2005, and we can't wait to go again next year!!! This was our second time to Punta Cana and both times we have stayed at Secrets.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go again next year!!!!
Gorgeous Resort - true 5* by Caribbean standards
reviews.text: Positives - Everything about the hotel and staff!!! If you do not know how to speak Spanish (like my husband and I), you really don't need to worry because the employees try very hard to accommodate you and if they can't, then they try to find someone that can help you.

reviews.title: Very nice resort
reviews.text: Make sure you stop and see Pedro at the sports bar, Benjamin at the Santo Domingo bar, Julio, Luciano, and all the other playmakers as they will make sure your vacation is all that YOU want it to be.

reviews.title: Secrets is paradise
reviews.text: If you are looking to snorkle, then this IS NOT the beach for you. The red flags were flying every day, but you could still go in the water at least waist deep. This didn't seem to bother my husband and I as we don't really care to go that deep into the ocean.

reviews.title: Ruined honeymoon at Secrets - the "secret" is out
reviews.text: This was our 5th trip to Punta Cana. In previous visits, we stayed at the Gran Bahia Principe, Grand Palladium, Paradisus Punta Cana, and the Majestic Colonial. Secrets by far, fell at the bottom of the barrel.

reviews.title: Awesome Time
reviews.text: I hope those of you reading this, debating on whether or not to stay at Secrets, will take this review to heart. I know I should have. I read the reviews and thought "oh these people are picky, some people can never be pleased". I am NOT a picky person, but for my honeymoon, I would have liked to stay somewhere above average. My wife and I met couples who had stayed at Secrets before and they all said the resort was falling apart due to new management. We certainly were not the only dissatisfied customers at the resort.

reviews.title: Secrets not so excellence
reviews.text: Check in - Paid for a room upgrade, but couldn't get one. I was given the run around that they were all booked and nothing was available. Fine. I can deal with that, but I didn't need the nasty attitude along with it. They sure didn't have a problem taking my money though. Good luck trying to locate a manager when you have problems, it seems they are always "busy" or "not here today". How convenient.

reviews.title: Not a Five Star...
reviews.text: The food at this resort was the same as at any other resort we've stayed at. No better, no worse. This was probably the best part of the vacation.

reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations
reviews.text: Pools were average at best. Nothing to rave about. Bartenders made you feel like you were bothering them when you asked them for a drink at the swim up bar. Oh and the wine - forget having a nice glass of wine or champagne to toast your bride on your honeymoon. The wine here is cheap and smells like rubbing alcohol.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from Excellence last night. this is a wonderful place to take a vacation. We were there for 5 nights and stayed in the Excellence Club. The rooms were nice the food was good. The staff were always "Excellente" and the drinks were cold. The pool was an amazing place to meet people. We camped out at the water in the same spot and became friends with many nice folks. Some of them we met here on Trip Advisor first.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

reviews.text: Let me begin with our overall review...The resort was very nice, had lots of activities, good food and met our expectations and we would return again. I will say that I was a bit disappointed about the weather; although the resort has nothing to do with it...It was completely overcast for 4 days, poured down rain for 2 days and then we finally saw some sun on our last full day. Thank goodness! I was beginning to think that all it did was rain in the DR! However, after some conversations with the staff and repeat visitors, it seems that we just got a bad week. But, despite the mediocre weather, we had a great time! Let me try to break our trip down into topics to make things easier...

reviews.text: Transfer from airport to resort---We knew what to expect from others comments and had a Coco Tours bring us to the resort. We only had one other stop so the trip took about an hour. I didn't think that the ride was all that bad. The driver wasn't going too fast and I tend to get motion sick and felt nothing. The roads are definitely rough, but the driver was cautious and did his best to avoid pot holes.
reviews.title: EXCELLENCE IS A MAGICAL PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival at resort--we were greeted by very pleasant staff along with a glass of champagne. We arrived around 3pm and our room was ready. We were in building 3, room 3211, ocean view junior suite. The room was nice, featured a marble bath, jetted tub, and a cozy balcony with a great ocean view and also overlooked the wedding gazebo. Due to our prime spot, we were able to witness 3 weddings during the week (at a distance). As we also got married in the Caribbean, this brought back great memories.
reviews.title: Excellence Punta Cana is Excellente! :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food--We ate at all of the restaurants except for Lobster House (as they only serve lobster, and I'm not a seafood eater) and Oregano (which we could never find and didn't appear on the map). Our favorite dinner spot was Chez Isabelle. Quite a lovely meal, delicious desserts. My hubby loved the white chocolate cake. We actually ate there twice because it was so good! Second choice would be Barcelona. This is the Mediterranean restaurant and was very good. I had the mushroom risotto and my husband had a shrimp dish. This restaurant is connected to Toscano and could be missed as its not on the map, but please try it out. We really liked it! Third pick would go to Agave (mexican) due to the fun atmosphere and great food. The Grill and Toscano are the only options for lunch each day and got a little old after a few days as the menus don't change. But the food was good and it hit the spot for a nice afternoon lunch. Breakfast is only served via Room Service, Toscano and Lobster House. We went to Toscano each morning except one where we chose RS. This was fantastic and I highly recommend it. We had a wonderful meal in our PJ's on the balcony. Again, as there are only a couple of choices for breakfast, it became a little repetitive. But the food was always delicious! The only bad thing I'll say about the restaurants is that I felt they were a little too bright in the evenings. We were hoping for nice cozy romantic dinners, however the lighting is quite bright and doesn't add much ambiance. Also, the wait for dinner was quite reasonable. We only had to wait 2 nights. Once for about 10 minutes and once for about 30 minutes. But, they give you a pager so you can enjoy a drink at the lobby bar while you wait.
reviews.title: Loved the mini bar...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've just return from a week stay at the Excellence Punta Cana. I would rate the resort itself as in above average, as the rooms and food were between 3 1/2 to 4 stars. The thing that makes this resort a 5 star in my opinion is the service. I cannot say enough about the service. The genuine care and kindness that the hostess at the main & excellence club showed was impeccable (Kary, Fiordaliza Leticia, Jackeline and Franklin). If you stay at this resort you will have a great stay, as I stated the service in great. I could go on and on about the people above and other within the entertainment group (Ines, Rey and Mariel), and other throughout the resorts; but the ones above made this vacation one of best. I will continue to visit the resort is the property continues to employee such people as noted above. I would also like to say a special thanks to Santos from the excellence club lounge. So, if you are looking for a great place to stay where not only the place itself is above average, but the people that they employee puts the resort in a class by itself…pick the excellence. I’ve already started looking into dates for my next visit. Also as a note...the food (is not to say that the food was bad), it just that the room service a few other menu items could stand some improvements...and the rooms I would guess normal wear and tear...and the bedding can be improved/upgraded.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The excellence service by the staff
likes.disliked: — Room service food can be improved as well as a few other menu items.

reviews.text: The staff here is well trained and have more energy than many Caribbean countries. If you treat them with respect, they return the favour with a smile and lots of attention.
reviews.title: Absolute paradise...went above and beyond our expectations!!
our trip to the "fake" secrets
reviews.text: We have taken many all-inclusive trips in the past and have never been so disappointed with our trip to Secrets. This time, we opted to take the 6 Golden Apple Square Deal for three nights. We were placed at Secrets and were very excited when we found out at the airport because last year we stayed at Secrets Capri in the Mayan and absolutely loved it and rated it one of the best resorts where we ever stayed. We have stayed at other 6 Golden Apple resorts previously and this resort does not meet 6 Golden Apple standards in our eyes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities and grounds were adequate, but the service standards and food presentation and quality at this resort were not acceptable. Every employee at the restaurants and bars seemed to have too much work. We chose to eat at the Japanese restaurant the first night of our stay. The hostess put our name on the wait list and told us to come back in 30 minutes. When we came back one half hour later, no table was yet available and we were told that the restaurant was too busy and we would be better off going to another restaurant. The hostess also said the seafood restaurant did not have a wait, so we decided to try the seafood restaurant. We were greatly disappointed in our meal at this restaurant as it did not make a very good first impression of special dinners we had so looked forward to enjoying. The food at the seafood restaurant was precooked and stored in heating trays. The selection was very disappointing because seafood was not even on the menu. Our only choices were various fish fillets. Seafood such as lobster and shrimp was on the menu at Secrets Capri in the Mayan Riviera. The quality of the food was also not to our expectations. Some of the food was cold and the fish had a bad taste. We were also disappointed that the salads and desserts were on a bar that was self-serve. Every dinner at Secrets Capri was completely a sit-down meal. The service at this restaurant was slow and very impersonal. There were only 3-4 couples eating while we were there so service should have been more attentive, it seemed like the staff was more concerned with cleaning up than providing exceptional service.
reviews.title: Secrets Excellence was Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second night we ate at the Bourdeau gourmet restaurant in the resort; We were very happy that they gave pagers out so we did not have to keep walking back to the restaurant from the lobby bar to see if a room was available as we had done the night before. We thought the use of pagers would have been standard like they were at all restaurants at Secrets Capri. The food at Bordeaux was acceptable and the atmosphere more enjoyable. So, based on that and the opinions of other guests we had spoken too, we decided to eat at this restaurant the last two nights of our stay rather than try another and be disappointed again. Although the food and service were much better and this restaurant we were still frustrated by the long wait to be seated each night. The first night we waited 1 hour and the next night we waited 1 hour and 20 minutes. Lunches could also be disappointing. I ordered a tuna sandwich for lunch at the seafood restaurant and could not find the tuna. Most days, we just ate whatever was being grilled on the beach. The lunch in the buffet upon our arrival was probably the best meal of our stay.
reviews.title: 'Excellence' correctly named

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar service also did not seem to be up to the standards we expected of Secrets Resorts. Drinks seemed at times very difficult to order. Than when you ordered a drink the bartender never once served me a second drink without a wait and me having to ask for it. When we stayed at Secrets Capri I never had to ask for a second drink and drink orders were served quickly. There were numerous bartenders at each bar there rather than the 1-2 at each bar at Secrets in Punta Cana. We had to wait at times for 10 or 15 minutes before being served, particularly when first arriving at the bar. The drinks at the main pool swim-up bar were served in cheap disposable plastic cups and an employee would push around a large trash can to collect the cups. At Secrets Capri drinks were served in fancy plastic reusable cups that were shaped like regular hurricane or margarita glasses. Needless to say, we felt service around the pool at Secrets Excellence in Punta Cana was poor. Food service was even available around the pool at Secrets Capri. No food options were to be found at the pool areas at Secrets Excellence, except hard, dried out fried foods that sat out all day and which you had to go get yourself and the very far end of the lagoon style pool. We were also disappointed with the atmosphere of the restaurants. One large room served as the buffet, Italian and Japanese restaurant. These areas were only separated by partial walls or partitions. Needless to say, this did not appear very intimate or romantic. Noise from one area tended to drift to the others. The restaurants at Secrets Capri had separate buildings with décor and facilities to match the specific theme of each restaurant. They were much more enjoyable experiences.
reviews.title: Not so excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were also several little things that we found different from Secrets Capri, but when lumped together they just added to our disappointment with this resort. The pool towels were small and several of the pool chairs and cushions were very worn and should have been thrown away. We were not given towel cards at check in, and had to walk several minutes back to the front desk before going to the pool after we tried to obtain towels from the towel hut. The young lady at the towel hut was not very customer friendly when we explained that we were not issued cards and hadn’t expected to because they were not given out at Secrets Capri. This young lady often was not at her station when we would come to get or turn in towels. She tended to hang out at the snack bar instead. Only when she noticed us trying to take care of our needs ourselves would she run over and do her job. The safe locked us out two times during out stay and we were told that the security guard would change the battery, but he never did.
reviews.title: Terrible!!! Rats! Horrible Service!

We complained about the room and the next day were moved to a room in block 8 which was in a much better condition and had obviously been renovated. The phone did not work however.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I arrived at Excellence with four of my co-workers on Oct. 5th. Sure, the ride to the resort was an experience on its' own. However, we were in a different country, with a different economic crisis. Although the ride was different, not once was I afraid for my life or anyone elses life, on the road. Just because its new to "us" the tourist, does not mean that the locals don't know what they're doing. They do this work day in and day out. Give them credit for knowing how to drive in their own land. I would've been more afraid if I, or one of my countrymen were driving on the Dominican Republic roads.
reviews.title: Excellence at Excellence

likes.disliked: — Several power outages; lack of washcloths

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Greeted by a cool towel and a glass of champagne added to the ease of check in, with bellboys bringing all luggage to your room. Speaking of which, the three ladies in our group were initially placed in building 14, which was on the furthest edge of the resort and the furthest away from all the happenings. Our room was extremely musty, but the front desk accomodated us quite nicely and quickly by placing us in a different room which was closer to everything and had a pool view instead of a view of someone's backyard. Both courteous and accomodating, Matias, Ibhar, Pauline and the rest of the crew at the front desk were exceptional in assisting our group, even calling, more than once to see if we were satisfied with our new room and its location.
reviews.title: Excellente!

likes.liked: — the hot tub on the private balcony with the full ocean view
likes.disliked: — the drive from the airport. next time we'll take the helicoptor transfer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment was better than I expected, and what a blast on Michael Jackson night. Not an empty seat in the theater. The entertainment crew, including Joel, Juan Carlos, Ines, Meriel, Johanna, Luciano and many others whose names I don't know, were all outstanding in their duties to involve and entertain the guests. Job well done! They were truly the "fun" of the resort, and I will remember each of them. Lots of great memories were created.
reviews.title: Love the Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From top to bottom, I am thrilled with my stay at Excellence. There was nothing so detrimental during my stay that would keep me from returning. The entire staff from entertainment, reception desk, bartenders/servers such as Carlos, Domingo, and Hector, were just a joy and pleasure.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect in every way! Excellence is excellente!

likes.liked: — The staff, the room, the food, the beach, the pools, the drinks, the entertainment, the music

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first trip to Punta Cana has left me with such fond memories that I hope to return before the year's end. Thank you to the entire Excellence Team for a very fun-filled memorable week.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a wonderful 10 days at Excellence Punta Cana.
reviews.title: One word – Excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Having never been on an all-inclusive holiday before, we weren’t entirely sure what to expect. We were hoping for a beautiful setting where we could relax and enjoy ourselves. And we were not disappointed!
reviews.title: The Excellence is "excellente"!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fantastic – we were upgraded to an Excellence Club room – which was spacious, with a lovely balcony, huge whirlpool bath, powerful air con, and was generally appointed to a very high standard. (A couple of small things didn’t work – the ipod dock and the ‘off’ switch for the air con. We did ask for one of these to be fixed and it wasn’t, but it didn’t cause a problem and we would have chased this if it had been an issue.)
reviews.title: Pure Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants exceeded our expectations – the food was good in all, and fantastic in some; the highlights being Chez Isobel, Agave and Spice. Some slightly odd translations or unusual combinations reminded us that we weren’t in a top London restaurant, but these were just quite charming. And we never had to wait longer than about five minutes for a table, although we weren’t always going at peak times. Breakfast was served until 12pm (though the main buffet breakfast place finished at 11am), which suited us well, and room service was also very good.
reviews.title: Great trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inclusive drinks also exceeded expectations; we never felt the need to order anything for which a charge would be applicable. The inclusive wines were fine and the inclusive cocktails were fantastic, our favourites being Expresso Martinis from the Martini bar and Margaritas to accompany the Mexican food at Agave. And what particularly surprised us was how forthcoming the waiters were with the drinks – on a number of occasions, a drink that we hadn’t even quite finished would be replaced with another one before we’d even had to order it – wasteful, but heaven! There were also good non-alcoholic cocktails available by the pool during the day.
reviews.title: Fantastic
My favorite resort in Punta Cana
reviews.text: We stayed at Excellence Punta Cana from Jan 14 –21. This was the most enjoyable resort we have been to in PC. I always like to know where others have stayed so I know what they are comparing to so here are the places we have been, in Punta Cana: Bahia, Palladium Palace (our old fave), Punta Cana Princess All Suites, Caribe Club Princess, Barcelo Bavaro Beach Resort, Occidental Grand Flamenco and Riu Taino. We have also stayed at Sandals Royal Hicacos Varadero, El Dorado Seaside Suites Mayan Riviera, Sunscape Casa Del Mar La Romana/Bayahibe, Tryp Cayo Coco, Grand Flamenco Occidental in Puerto Plata, Sun Palace Cancun and Aventura Spa Palace Mayan Riviera. We have always said there are too many resorts to return to any one but Excellence certainly challenges that concept.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Occupancy: 75%
reviews.title: Excellence Punta Cana was Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather: Perfect, this was our first time in Jan, we have always gone to PC in Feb and always have had great weather. We had even less rain this trip, about 10 min the whole week. In Feb we seemed to get a quick 10 min shower daily. It was 83 degrees daily according to the “Excellence Times” and almost everyday there was a forecast of scattered showers, so those of you searching weather prior to your trip don’t put to much weight on what is forecasted.
reviews.title: Stress Free Vacation at Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Beach: This is what we come to PC for. In the past we have always been on the Bavaro Beach and I was concerned because of the remarks I was reading about the beach not being nice and to wavy. This beach was somewhat different but we still enjoyed it. The browner sand was not a problem and the waves were bigger. My husband is not a swimmer but felt comfortable playing in the waves. A little more undertow and a little more adventure but a lot of fun. We never got boogie boards as I have been whacked in the head before and figured these were the waves to do that again. There was no other water activities while we were there, the waves were to big, black flag most everyday. Walking the beach was a whole new experience. Bavaro offers resort after resort after, well you get the idea. This was quiet walking with only the odd passing of another couple. I wasn’t sure I would like walking in no man’s land but I never felt unsafe. Walking to the right (looking at the ocean) Sirenis is about 10 minutes away and Sunscape an hour. Walking the other way not much but solitude. The ocean just a few minutes away from the resort in either direction gets much calmer. In the end I preferred these quiet walks.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two pools. One is a smaller waterfall pool the other a huge pool that winds throughout the resort. It almost looks like a river in areas it gets very narrow in places and than opens up to large pool areas. Floats were provided and we always managed to get one when we wanted.
reviews.title: The Absolute BEST!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we went and stayed the end of february/beginning of march. it was our first time to dr and first time doing an all-inclusive resort, so i was very tentative. a friend had been to punta cana before and recommended this resort for a higher end resort and ADULT ONLY. after doing lots of research on my own i finally booked through a friend & travel agent. (which i never use a travel agent but did for this trip, incase something went wrong, i had someone that could and would help)
reviews.title: Amazing!!

likes.liked: — The pool, beach, and spaciousness of the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: trip from airport is about 45 minutes on a windy, dirt, mostly one lane road through not the nicest of areas. not much around until you get to the resorts, and even then if you don't drive into the resort you can't see anything.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the resort was absolutely beautiful, staff was very friendly and always happy. we got an ocean view room which was in a building close to the main building so we were close to everything. our room was nice, nothing fancy but fairly spacious, clean, and nice. i would recommend staying in a building close to the main building, otherwise you will have a very long walk to go every where you want or need to go.
reviews.title: Loved the Excellence Punta Cana

likes.disliked: — poor sewage, but the staff did their best to repair it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the grounds are fantastic. well kept, clean, and beautiful. the resort itself i found to be very relaxing. it was the first time i've been away and after the second day i felt like i had been there for a week. the fact that there were no kids there was also nice. the staff is always doing activities on the beach, by the pool, and at night so if you feel like being a kid yourself there's lots of games, activities, and shows.
reviews.title: Repeaters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: the FOOD....i love food and good food especially for dinner, so i was kind of worried about how the food would be. well i can say the food was great, for the most part. frest fruit available throughout the day and all around. the hawaiian pig roast party on the beach was a favorite. food and atmosphere was great. the alcoholic drinks were great, american alcohol available as well as their island brands. (most of the other resorts only had their island brands) my favorite restaurant was the french restaurant located near the lobby bar. we ate there 3 times and it was amazing. none of the restaurants take reservations so if you don't get there early or late, you'll be waiting a while for the good ones. the japanese restaurant was very good too. what we did if there was a really long wait at one restaurant we wanted to go to, we'd put our name in and then go somewhere else to have apps or pick food to pass the time. that seemed to work out well for us. i would not recommend the lobster restaurant. i found it to be terrible, and the fishy smell was over powering. some people enjoyed it, but being from the northeast, i'm use to better.
reviews.title: Married at Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I really loved our stay at The Excellence Resort in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic. We visited during Spring Break from Mar. 17-21st. The weather was great- about 82-83 and sunny all 5 days. The Excellence resort is beautiful and romantic- the pools are gorgeous! We really liked the two level pool that had 2 waterfalls. The foam rafts were big and comfy and the bar was close by. The help ( Antonio) was very friendly and brought us drinks.They had exotic drink specials everyday - we were partial to the Coco Loco which came in a coconut.The resort was all inclusive so we didn't pay for anything- drinks- as many as you like- they had 7- 8 restaurants- A French, An Asian, An Italian, A grill , A Mexican. A Pizzaria type and a Lobster House. You could dine at any without a reservation. I would recommend the first three. The only place we had a bad meal was at the Lobster house- the lobster seemed undercooked- it was grilled but not firm at all.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Romantic, and Great Service!

likes.liked: — Adults only and everything was 1st class in service
likes.disliked: — nothing but the ocean was too rough to go in the entire time

reviews.title: We want to go back!!
reviews.text: The people who work there are very friendly- eveyone says Hola - smiles and can't wait to assist you. Very helpful was Hector at the front desk, Isadora at the lobster house who brought us cognac -after dinner- w/o us requesting it and Antonio at the pool bar. When we walked up to the entrance to the hotel the first day- they brought us hot hand towels to clean off- before we got to the lobby and two glasses of champagne! Really first class. The room was beautiful- king size bed with four poster and curtains-a jacuzzi- very large room- with marble counter tops- marble walls in the shower and the room had a great view- we had garden view. The maid put flower petals on our sink and filled up the jacuzzi one afternoon with hot water, bubbles and flowers.It was beautiful after we came back from a sandy walk on the beach. The one downside is the surf is so rough you can't swim in the ocean but the beach is beautiful- clean- white sand- water clear.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds at Excellence are beautifully landscaped with lots of palm trees, flowering shrubs , fountains, gardens and sculptures.WE found flamingos, peacocks, geese, parrots and other birds on the grounds by the front. The upper pool is extremely long- curves in and out and has bridges over it. There are plenty of chairs- some you can even place in in the water at the lower pool as there is a tiled ledge that is only a few inches deep.There are romantic covered beds that have curtains so you can lounge by the pool. We also had free horseback riding- and bike riding included. Other activities - we played pingpong- they have tennis, a gym, foos ball, yoga or dance lessons- one night Karoake and one night a band. They also had a saxophone player- a Michael Jackson ( impresonator) show- very good- a singer and a dance show. The casino is small but I wond 25$ on the slots.
reviews.title: 11days 10 nights

likes.disliked: — Travel time from airport and on site vendors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best rest. were the Italian, French and Asian. Decor is also beautiful and the place is very clean-the cleaning people-they say hello and smile all the time work all day and into the night.
reviews.title: Fan-Freakin-Tastic!

likes.liked: — great service, great beach, great food, great drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was the best I've seen and I've traveled alot. In the Italian restl. for breakfast they had- 5 kinds of cheeses, 6 kinds of ham, people making omelettes to order, crosissants bacon,sausages, 6 diff. kinds of breads, muffins, pastries, fried plantains, oatmeal, cereal, fresh fruit, fruit juices- orange, pineapple, papaya, grapefruit, melon, watermelon, etc. They also had hardboiled eggs, fish, salad, quesadillas, fried cheese, stuffed tomatoes, tempura bananas, bread pudding with vanilla sauce, scrambled eggs, yogurt, potatoes, and much ,much more. Oh and bloody mary or mimosa- coffee/ tea etc. Really unbelievable!and delicious......
reviews.title: The Name says it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Awesome Pools, Horrible food - Excellence Punta Cana
Enjoyed the Experience
reviews.text: Great drinks (The banana-mama and Dirty Monkeys were a hit), Amazing pools and beaches, Terrific Atmosphere (Not crowded, zero kids, and an undeniably beautiful resort), and amazing rooms. Definitely a romantic place. The endless supply of good room coffee and Oreos was a plus also, though we wouldn't mention it if the food wasn't as bad as it was..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad:
reviews.title: A bit disappointed

likes.liked: — The main hotel areas and the beach
likes.disliked: — The service, in particular the room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was extremely disappointing, with all 8 restaurants being mediocre at best with Agave (the Mexican themed restaurant) being the worst followed closely by Spice (Pan-Asian). Here are some of the things that comes to mind: undercooked "risotto" rice, under-cooked chicken, ketchup with noodles that was labeled as spaghetti, runny bland eggs, and an especially offending Arugula Gorgonzola cheese salad that was seriously spoiled. There were many others and basically, we were extremely disappointed with the food. Room service takes an average of an hour and a half (to their credit they do mention a long wait) . They have a forgettable evening entertainment program and EXTREMELY pushy resort sponsored souvenir vendors (beware the vendors in the light green shirts - once they get those trinkets on you, it's going to be very hard to get away from them. They are seriously aiming to rip you off, and you can talk them down to a fourth of their original asking price). There was always a shortage of yellow beach/pool towels so hold on to them.
reviews.title: Don't hesitate to book it!

likes.disliked: — the way one of the receptionists dealt with our check-in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ride to and from the airport is truly an experience with giant potholes and litany of near accidents and is not for the faint of heart.
reviews.title: Go to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004
reviews.text: We started out with a VERY bad ride from the airport to secrets due to our travel agent messing up our arrival times with the bus. we had to take a small cab and one out of the two couples baggage did not arrive. needless to say when we arrived to the front of the resort my nerves were calmed. It was spectacular, marble floors, the sound of water in the the foutains, ocean breeze in your face and the bell boy right there taking your bags and you to the front desk. As they checked us in they gave us mimosas to calm our nerves. we were escorted by the bell boy with our luggage to our rooms. the couple whos luggage was lost was assigned someone to find it for them and it was in there room the next day by 5pm waiting for them. The rooms were large and beautyful. we had 3rd floor with vaulted cellings. the view was wonderful(jr. suite oceanview) The staff was very friendly all of them!! Much more outgoing than in other islands we have travled to. Also a big pluss to me was there was no cat calls and over aggressive men. In other areas we have travled myself and the other girls (mid 20's) have always gotten unwanted attention. Here there were comments of you look beautyful this evening but nothing over bearing. We took the ATV tour and its worth every penny!!! so much fun and you get to see some great sights. Take small toys markers of candy to give to the MANY children that you will pass. also the bus ride was not to long for this tour. the resort is so wonderful you don't need to do to many outside things. The food was good to great. The drinks were never skimped on with the alcohol. The copacobana was my favorite. Do tip a lot with just single dollars it is worth it. They pay amazing attention to detail even down to fresh flowers and hand cloths in every bathroom. there is no trash anywhere it is spotless. There is security on every corner of the resort. The beach is a blast, the waves are GREAT. so much fun, don't be scared to get in. Pool is wonderful for relaxing and beach is great for playing. A must do the the photographers photo session. The pictures are amazing and cheap cheap cheap compared to the cost here at home and you don't have that kind of cenery. all in all secrets was worth the money!! they took good care of you and its an amazing place to visit, you wont be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Nothing but Excellence!!
food and stomach issues
reviews.text: Just a note about the food and stomach issues! my boyfriend and I did not get sick during our vacation. My advice is to stay away from anything that is not cooked, like the salad and any fruit with a skin that you would eat (grapes, strawberries etc.). I don't think people realize that the fruit and vegtables are probably washed with regular water and also who knows how they are fertilized. So although the salads look fresh and appetizing, beware!

reviews.title: Some issues...
reviews.text: First off, let me say that I loved Secrets, Punta Cana! The people were so awesome, friendly and attentive. Just ask and you will recieve. All of the rooms that we had (3 couples in our party) were beautiful. My boyfriend and I had a room on the 3rd floor with catherdral ceilings and a view of the pool. The pool is awesome, we spent most of our time there. Never had a problem fiding a raft, just walk around and ask. There was a nice breeze on the ocean/beach. I loved the dirty bananas! Try one, you will too! Knowing a little spanish does help, they try very hard to please you, and it is sometimes hard to understand them. Don't go overboard, just the basics will get you by!

reviews.title: Beautiful and Spacious
reviews.text: We met a lot of nice people on our trip. We were in a show one night, that was a hoot!

reviews.title: "It's a pleasure" as the staff says
reviews.text: The disco, was fun, we only went one night.

reviews.title: Great choice
reviews.text: We stayed at Excellence for one week at the recommendation of family who had also stayed there before. The beach was great, staff was excellent and the hotel was well kept and clean. Great vacation spot, hope we have the opportunity to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had an awesome honeymoon at Excellence! The resort was gorgeous. One thing to note that my travel agent failed to mention, this resort is on the Atlantic side of the island not the Carribean side so the water was rougher and not as blue.
reviews.title: Good Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was just ok. Nothing bad, just nothing to be overly excited about. Men need to take a few pairs of long pants. Most of the restuarants in the resort require men to wear long pants to dinner.
reviews.title: Best Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We did a couple excursions that we booked through our travel agency. Zip Lining was awesome!! Dune Buggies, not so much, but got to see a different part of the country.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It does take about an hour to get to the resort from the airport so plan for travel time!
reviews.title: Excellence Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Excellence Punta Cana: Like a mature lover, showing signs of age, but full of beautiful experience and surprises. This is an excellent (no pun intended) resort. There are several areas in need of refurbishment. However, the activities are plentiful, the staff is extraordinarily gracious, the food (in some restaurants) was superb, and the pool was so fabulous that even this workaholic found himself relaxing in no time.

reviews.title: Excellence high standards as usual
