reviews.title: dominican republic excellence hotel punta cana
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our wedding anniversary at the Excellence Punta Cana from Saturday, November 29 through Friday, December 5. We were looking for an all-inclusive island getaway. Beau Nanni at The Road Less Travelled suggested that because it was an anniversary vacation that we consider the adults-only Excellence Punta Cana. We finalized our decision only after reading the traveler reviews here at TripAdvisor and being pleased with the quoted price relative to most all-inclusive of a similar nature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one week with my wife. She was a bit reluctant about Dominican republic after hearing bad reports. However after our stay at Excellance she is completely won over.Everthing about the place was first class the rooms are very spacious and the beds enormous and very comfortable. Food in all restaurants was superb and the drinks were great all day and all night.Would recomend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Excellente

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on Wed 10/17 for 7 days. We had been here before when it was still Secrets Excellence. That was 3 yrs ago. Now that the owners have taken over the management of the property, there has been some improvements (not that we had any complaints the 1st time).
reviews.title: Loved Excellence--Again!!!

likes.disliked: — Silly but no handles on the Sliding Doors in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In: Got there at 3pm and the room was ready--booked garden view and that is what we received. They asked if we wanted to upgrade to Excellence Club for $700 for the week and we declined. The room was clean and in the back of the resort (8208). No view but peaceful and to be honest, we were in the room a total of about 8hrs a day--just to shower for dinner and sleep. We were hoping to be upgrade to oceanview because of being returning guests but we weren't. No problem--room was just fine.
reviews.title: Loved it all

likes.liked: — The beautiful grounds and workers great people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Weather: Perfect every day. Waves were awesome as it did get kind of windy a couple of days but we love to watch those big waves come rolling in.
reviews.title: An Excellent Choice for a girls trip!

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, the beach, the drinks, the service
likes.disliked: — somewhat of a language barrier, the mattress, no bar food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: Totally beautiful with golden sand that is raked and cleaned of all debris daily. You can walk at least 3/4 mi either way of the resort and it is so peaceful.
reviews.title: Best Place on Earth
You'll love it
reviews.text: I read these reviews quite often before headed to Secrets with my husband (2/5 - 2/12). For the most part, comments are dead-on, aside from the perpetual complainers. Secrets is a beautiful resort that is geared toward vacationers looking to relax. Here are some specifics:

reviews.title: Do Not Go-Not allowed in the Water Ever-Terrible Food & Terrible Service
reviews.text: Resort quality: The resort is immaculate. You constantly see staff cleaning/painting/sweeping. The pool is huge and gorgeous. You'll always find a chair and often find a float - (why do people hog these things?). Visit the animals by the lagoon in front. You can feed bread to the ducks. Very cute.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: Food: I'm a picky eater with vegetarian tendencies. I always found a dish that was pleasing. My husband loved everything. Quisqueya is the nicest restaurant. We heard mixed reviews about the Dominican and Asian. Mexican was very good with a charming mariachi band playing. I had a touch of "illness" and I'm not sure if it was due to food, or due to not brushing my teeth with bottled water. Use the bottled.
reviews.title: Wonderful
best vacation ever!
reviews.text: Rooms: Our room was lovely, although we were on the end away from everything. With all the eating/drinking, we didn't mind the walk. The bed was very hard. I like a firm bed, but this thing gave me a permanent backache.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004
reviews.text: Staff: The staff was very attentive and pleasant. We tipped around $150 over a week-long stay. I think people appreciated it, but the reaction was understated. Some travel 8 hours from their home to work there. They lodge on the premises with 4 people to a room. They make little money and all have families to support. Why not give them extra that goes in their pocket?
reviews.title: Secrets Excellence - it's a pleasure!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are ready to take our next vacation and have been reading an unbeleivable number of poor reviews for the hotel that we have chosen so I decided to comment on our unbeleivable stay at "Excellence Punta Cana" back in May 2007. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. This resort is definately geared towards couples. You have your choice during the day of lounging in the quiet area with water falls and soft music or you can join the entertainment staff and swim up bar and party on. The entertainment staff and cooks provided an unbeleivable feast on the beach daily for lunch, highly recommended. The staff looking after maintenance know how to please the human eye. Everything was kept immaculate. The restaurants were lovely and it was refreshing not to have to make a reservation. Waiting for a table at your favourite restaurant was a pleasure, as you were able to sit in the outdoor area listening to the very talented saxaphone player. Extremely romantic. This is the place to get away with your significant other and renew your love. Only thing I would stay away from is the local alcohol that they keep on the bottom shelf at the bar (can't remember the name) it is deadly. May miss dinner and the show that night if you decide to endulge. (I think it was called mamajuana) Fantastic place to stay, not much around though, besides the hotel.
reviews.title: Better late than never review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, our decision to stay at "EXCELLENCE" was primarily based on reading TripAdvisor reviews. We, too, want to possibly help other people make their decision.
reviews.title: An EXCELLENT Honeymoon!

reviews.text: Our trip to this fabulous resort was for our honeymoon during the first week of January of 2008. We had no regrets. In fact, when we got back, we reread some of the reviews again and it brought back the memories even more. Thanks to everyone for their honesty.
reviews.title: absolute excellence

likes.disliked: — location would have been a nice hotel on the caribbean side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In order to help keep our thoughts organized, we have based our review in categorical order.
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flights:
reviews.title: Beyond Excellence indeed!

likes.disliked: — Wet floors outside the rooms are a bit dangerous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new wife and I spent a wonderful week at the excellence. The beach is lovely, and was never too busy.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions were good, its a lovely building while still managing to look relaxed. We were presented with a drink on arrival and help with our bags by staff, who throughout the trip were very helpful and friendly .
reviews.title: Warning...Dangerous Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Room was lovely. Very clean, good size, very nice bathtub. Minibar was stocked daily and tv had plenty entertainment. Air conditioning was good (too good for my wifes liking!), so if you like it freezing like me you will be happy. Our room (garden view) also had a hammock outside the door in the sunshine.
reviews.title: As nice as a four seasons..except for the dinners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First night we were a bit dissappointed with our meal, in a buffet restraunt. However we were satisifed with the food. With 8 restraunts there was plenty to try, and if you were not too keen on one your could always try another the next night.
reviews.title: How are you? Excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night their was alway entertainment provided. However if you werent in the mood for it, its a big enough resort you can still have a quiet drink with the show getting in your way.
reviews.title: Great Place with a few major/minor setback
All in your perspective....
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at Excellence and overall we had a relaxing vacation and no regrets on the choice of hotel.

reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more
reviews.text: First off, yes the trip from the airport to the hotel is a long, bumpy ride. It doesn't matter who drives you, the roads will still be bumpy and the hotel will not be any closer to the airport. It's really not a big deal....you'll see some interesting sights along the way!

reviews.title: Bring plenty of Starbuck's coffee with you
reviews.text: Overall we liked the hotel. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and we had no complaints about our room. Everything worked fine in our room, our mini bar was stocked every day and they had a little snack basket with cookies and crackers that was kept stocked too. There was lots of bottle water provided in the room too which was nice. The room was cleaned very well and they also have a turn down service which was nice too, they came in cleaned up a bit, turned the bed down and brought us the newsletter for the next day.

reviews.title: A 3 Star Resort Posing as High End
reviews.text: The food was great - absolutely no complaints about the food. There is 24 hour room service and the menu has a nice variety. We took advantage of the service a few times and the food was always tastey and hot.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: The restaurants were nice, the breakfast and lunch buffet was really good. Lots of variety. The dinner restaurants were also very tastey and it was nice to not worry about reservations. The only restaurant that we didn't care for (for dinner) was the Grill, simply because it was kind of dark in there and we like to see what we're eating. Small detail though. A couple lunches were spent on the beach where they have a beach grill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had an amazing experience at Excellence Punta Cana. After three weeks, we are still talking to family and friends about our stay. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and truly engaged in making sure we were happy. This sentiment extended to activities and services not affiliated with the hotel, such as Miguel Pumarejo of Painted Pictures and VIP, which handled our horseback riding excursion. The meals were first rate and thoroughly enjoyed each day.
reviews.title: Still Dreaming of Excellence Punta Cana
Call it the "Pretty Good Resort"
reviews.text: Victor Doroteo, Director of Restaurants, and Rafael, Assistant General Manager, ensured my husband and I, and our friends, felt comfortable and were enjoying all the hotel had to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were immaculate and inviting, and the grounds were beautifully kept, the perfect setting for a peaceful, yet fun, travel experience.
reviews.title: A very relaxing and beautiful vacation
Entertainment Crew made this experience extra exciting
reviews.text: My wife and I recently had our honeymoon at the Excellence Resort in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic. Let me say at the outset that the staff at the resort from the bell hops to the bar tenders to the cleaning staff to the entertainment and activities people could not be better! They were all cheerful, accomodating and more than competant. Entirely superb. Also, the public areas were impeccable in terms of maintenence and appearance. Management as well was cheeful and accomodating. They certainly did their best but, despite or maybe in spite of their efforts, we felt Excellence was disorganized Here's why... We booked our stay through our travel agent, Good Will Travel. (our agent Marjorie is fantastic) We booked the 'Honeymoon Suite' and paid quite a bit extra for the indoor/outdoor jacuzzi the honeymoon suite affords. When we arrived at the resort, we were told that the suite was unavailable for 3 days. But, they would put us up at an upgraded, "club excellence" room and were offered $60 a day credit at the hotel mini mart and the extra ammenities offered by 'club excellence' such as a complimentary canvas beach bag and fresh fruit daily. My wife was very upset at this turn of events. None the less, what could we do? We took the 'club excellence' room. The 3 days in the 'club excellence' room were ok, but not Excellent. We didn't get fresh fruit nor, did we get a beach bag. In the grand scheme of things, it really didn't bother me but, we were promised it and it never came. After the 3rd night, as promised we were moved to the Honeymoon Suite. This caused some bit of distress as we had to repack our bags for the move. In the confusion, my wife left a dress behind. She didn't notice it till after we moved. We felt the hotel offered minimal assistance to retrieve it instead telling us (with a smile as always) to call the old room directly. The new guests in our old room didn't answer nor did they return our call. (why should they?) As far as the Honeymoon Sutie, we saw the outdoor jacuzzi was badly in need of maintenence. It wasn't cleaned thoroughly and had a large unsightly crack on the top. Since it was above the waterline, it was still usable. Really wanting to use the jacuzzi, I gave it a quick cleaning and attempted to fill it up. Ok, so now the drain doesn't work. A quick call to the front desk brought a maintenence man who found a worn gasket and replaced it with a new one. (Again, great response and service from the staff). But, come to find out after filling the tub that it had a slow leak from an unknown source. By this time, we were too burned out from constantly going to the front desk and concierge to get things fixed. Not wanting to go through another room change, we decided not to take any further action on the jacuzzi. Although it leaked and had a crack, it was still usable. In addition there were some other inconveniences at the resort. They're proud to say they have 8 restaurants. Yet, on any day, 2 of them are closed. Also, unless you choose to have dinner before 6 or after 9- you can expect a wait of over an hour. A couple other things were disappointing, the resort allowed aggresive outside vendors in to the resort 2 nights a week. We did not pay so much to be hassled by commissioned sales people to buy their "chotchkas". They also promoted specific major league baseball games in their sports bar. The only games shown were what ESPN has as their game of the week. A quick tip for travelers to resorts in the Dominican Republic: It helps to have a rudimentary knowledge of Spanish. Knowing Spanish helped alot when I had to explain things to the maintenence staff. Most staff are fluent in English but, they really liked it when spoken to in Spanish. All that being said, we did have a great honeymoon but, felt we didn't receive the total value we expected. Was it Excellent? No. But, it was still pretty good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Excellence Punta Cana from July 5-July 12 with my boyfriend. I was very scared to go considering the plethera of bad reviews I was reading... there were bugs, the maid service was bad, the car ride was nauseating, the food made them sick... etc. The trip to the resort was not as bad as the hype. You could tell the roads were in bad shape, but the ride wasn't bumpy enough that it'd make you physically ill or anything The drivers do the best they can to avoid the pot holes. We chose to stick with the free transfer as opposed to getting a taxi or private car, and as it turns out, the bus ride was still only an hour and went directly to the resort. Therefore, I recommend that you don't shell out extra money on unnecessary transportation. The resort is beautiful. The rooms are spacious and beautiful as well. We had no bug problems in the room, although the mosquitos outside are pretty bad. We brought bug spray and still got quite a few bites. The maid service was great, our room was cleaned daily so we had no issues with that. The restaurants are okay- neither good nor bad. Go early though, because from 8 o'clock onwards, you're looking at a good hour wait no matter which restaurant you choose. The nightly entertainment was cute I though. It was nice because it ran from 10 pm- 10:30 pm and by that time you're pooped from the sun and just want to head to bed anyway. The drinks were delicious. I recommend the coco loco in a coconut. If you want a bed on the beach... GO EARLY... just put a book or something on one of them before breakfast to reserve it. The shops on site are nice but expensive. We ran out of sunscreen and had to pay 18 bucks U.S. for one there... it hurt. STAY AWAY FROM THE VENDORS ON SITE THAT ARE WEARING GREEN SHIRTS... THEY HARASS YOU TO BUY THEIR STUFF. IT IS VERY ANNOYING. All in all, it was a very enjoyable trip. I wouldn't go back because there's so many other places and resorts to see but I definitely don't regret going and sincerely enjoyed my time there. I will never forget my 7 day stay at Excellence Punta Cana. Two more things real quick... #1- you will make so many friends while you're there... the other coupls are so friendly #2- the Dominicans really appreciate being tipped in ways other than monetary. We gave things away like clothing, books, and school supplies. If you can fit stuff in your luggage, bring random stuff that you're not using anymore. That is all.
reviews.title: Excellence is Excellente'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful relaxing honeymoon at the Excellence in Punta Cana. We loved almost everything about our stay. From the start when we entered the gorgeous lobby for check in we were greeted with friendly service. A bell boy helped us to our room with our luggage and a waitress handed us glasses of champagne.
reviews.title: Truly Excellent Honeymoon

likes.disliked: — How long of a ride it was from the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Our room was spacious, clean, and well air conditioned. As part of our honeymoon package we had a honeymooners sash on the door and a beautiful towel arrangement on the bed as well as a bottle of champagne waiting for us. Our room was a garden view junior suite. Our travel agent recommended that we save a bit by going for a garden view room. She was right. The view from our room was beautiful and romantic. More importantly it was private and quiet. Ocean view and pool side rooms faced busier parts of the resort. Since this was our honeymoon we enjoyed the peace and quiet. One small thing that we loved about the room was the easy to use security box where we could keep our valuables. We kept our passports, cell phones, etc. in there during the trip. I think that the staff was very friendly and trustworthy, but it was easy to go out and relax knowing that everything was secure.
reviews.title: I want to go back now!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were only a couple of things about the room that were minor annoyances. One was the mini fridge that is part of the well stocked and tended mini bar. It is not a fridge, but a cooler as we were told by the front desk. Not too much of a problem you just had to use the ice bucket to chill things before drinking. Which leads to another annoyance. The ice maker in our building wasn't working. This was no huge problem, we just walked next door when we needed ice. It was only like 50 ft extra of walking. Plus, room service would bring ice if you needed them to. The last annoyance about our room was the whirlpool tub. The jets in the tub were very weak, so it is more like having a giant regular bathtub. I am not a fan of baths so this was not for me. It you are the type who likes relaxing in the tub, then you will love it because it is roomy and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellente, Indeed!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this resort because we both love to relax in the pool and play in the ocean. This is the part of the trip that ended up perfect for us. While were weren't wild about the party atmosphere in the main pool where guests enjoyed activities such as aerobics, volleyball, and water polo; there was a second smaller pool that we absolutely loved. This smaller pool is the one that features two levels where water from the upper level cascades down a wall into the lower level. This pool was deeper so the water was cooler. Also, it had some nice shady spots. Plus, it had this fantastic spot with a rock fountain in the upper level. This pool did not have a swim up bar, but had a regular walk up bar that served drinks the whole time that the pool was open. One note about the towels. We never had a problem where we coudn't find a towel. We did have one day when we were late getting to the pool, though, when we had to walk clear across the resort to find clean towels. So, grab a towel early in the morning and hold on to it!
reviews.title: Excelllence - Keep it in Perspective

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was gorgeous! I loved relaxing and reading a book while the excellence staff provided me with food and drinks. There are beds, chairs, and hammocks on the beach. If you get a late start you might have trouble finding a shady spot to sit, so don't forget your sunblock. The Dominican sun was intense! Every day behind the beach bar they prepared delicious food right on the beach. You needed the food if you spent anytime at all playing in the rough ocean. There were red flags up every day we were there. That means you could only go in up to your waist. There were lifeguards on duty who would come in the water after you and make you get out if you went too deep. This was a safe idea. If you sat on the beach you could easily see the rip tides, so be careful when you go swimming! My husband enjoyed the boogie boards they provided for use in the ocean. They also had catamarans and wind surfing available for free if you know how to use them. If you don't they will give you a lesson for $35.
reviews.title: Great for a honeymoon, but stay away from the sushi at Spice!
Couldn't have been any better!
reviews.text: We stayed at Secrets from 7/12 to 7/19 and agree that we could not have picked a better resort. You don’t have to wear stupid wristbands and we especially liked that it was mostly Americans couples on their honeymoon. That added to the romance and peacefulness as well as not having kids around. I, too, have read months of reviews and must say that anyone that complains is either not tipping at all and/or is just downright unable to be pleased. We tipped the maids a few dollars each day and were surprised to see that they hung our wet towels outside to dry, lined up our shoes, folded our clothes on the bed, and even arranged our toiletries by size on the bathroom counter. On our third night there, the maid put rose petals around our Jacuzzi. We had turn down service every night with chocolates left on our pillows. And contrary to other reviews, never had any maids “barge in our room”. They knock first.

reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon (July 4th - 11th)
reviews.text: The only problems that we experienced were that 1) our TV didn’t work. Called front desk & it was fixed within ½ hour. 2) safe didn’t open one time. That too was fixed within ½ hour. 3) We didn’t have robes. Front desk said that is only for the Excellence Club people but gave them to us anyway that night.

reviews.title: Close to Heaven!
reviews.text: Yes, the ride to the resort was bumpy and long but we have worse roads than that in Pittsburgh! No big deal and the resort isn’t responsible for them! We were told by our Apple Rep. that the Dominicans are getting a new President next month who promised to repair the roads.

reviews.title: Worth more than what you'll pay!!!
reviews.text: FOOD: We thought the food was great and I am an extremely picky eater. There is so much to choose from that everyone will find something they love. The breakfast buffet is huge. Our favorite place was the Texas place. We didn’t think the food there was any different than you would get in the U.S. (other than the dairy products). We never had to wait to be seated and our food was always served within 15 minutes. The servers gave us drink refills after only taking a few sips and were always smiling. And for the people that complain about getting sick…..Everyone has different tolerance levels to foods and how they are prepared. It’s not the resorts fault if your stomach is sensitive to change…..it would have happened at ANY resort there! We didn’t get sick at all.

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful resorts in the Caribbean
reviews.text: BEACH/POOLS: Not crowded at all. The water in the ocean is very rough making it hard to do any water sports. Didn’t see any topless women. The beach & pools are cleaned every night. Never a problem getting a raft because the staff throws them in if they see them out of the pool. Didn’t see any bugs at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff definitely made this resort better than all the rest! Everyone was very friendly and attentative. We especially enjoyed the exuberance of Rey and his fellow hospitality team members. As well as Loren, greeting us with her beautiful smile and genuinous everyday at Toscana. The resort was gorgeous and the food was spectacular. The only downside was we couldn't stay longer.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort, Excellent People, and a Super Excellent Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled down to the DR for two weeks to celebrate our honeymoon, 40th birthday, graduation and a promotion. So as you can see we had a lot to celebrate.
reviews.title: Kudos to Excellence PC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived Nov 22nd and our taxi driver (arranged by a local on trip advisor) was waiting with a sign (our names on it). He whisked us away to paradise. The road is a little funky, but I have been on worse. Yes it’s about an hour to get there, but it is cool to look around and see the area before you get to your hotel. Get your driver to stop for Cervezas on the way.
reviews.title: LOVED This Place!

likes.liked: — The grounds were beautiful and so were the workers!
likes.disliked: — There was nothing I did not like!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Upon arrival you are greeted with a welcome home, and we were upgraded right away to a beautiful room overlooking the cascade pool.
reviews.title: wonderful relaxing stay for Dee and Ray from Georgia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won’t go on and on about the service, you are going to have to take my word. It was fabulous. I can honestly say I have no complaints. Thanks to all staff (amazing crew), I will mention Benjamin, Ines and Jenny for there outstanding contribution to making our trip that good.
reviews.title: one of our best resorts

likes.liked: — service at restaurants, beach and no reservations for restaurants
likes.disliked: — building 9 is showing some wear. ...leaking ceilings in building 9

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: With all the five star reviews, I was expecting great things. Things were good, not great.
reviews.title: Had hoped for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Food - average and repetitive for breakfast and lunch buffets. Nice to have 7 options of restaurants for dinner though. Wait time only bad for French restaurant where the food was usually better than the rest. Oceana, the fish restaurant, was a huge disappointment, especially on an island! Same menu and food in each restaurant each day. Desserts were exactly the same every day and were not good. Also, limited chocolate desserts sadly.
reviews.title: We had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Rooms - we were supposedly upgraded to a "master suite" which just had a small, separate tv area. This particular one was cramped, dark and kind of creepy. We asked to be switched to a regular junior suite. After much hassle and delay they finally switched us. Liked the room much better, although there was a problem with bugs around our sink area. Despite complaining about this three times, it was never resolved. There is only a stall shower which is pretty small. The jacuzzi tubs are separate. The lighting in the room, especially by the bed, is very limited and dim. As a side note, the chocolates left at turndown are closer to brown wax than chocolate.
reviews.title: Want to go back!
living the dream!!!!
reviews.text: Pool - it's actually great - very long and windy, only 3-4 feet deep, and they provide very comfy things to float on which are supposed to be shared by all and remain in the pool (some people try to hog them, but at lunchtime you can find some free.) I wish they had put a little current into the pool to make it a lazy river type pool where the current moves you. It is true that you have to go out at 7-8am and reserve your seats, especially if you want a place in the shade. The beach was beautiful and great for walking. If you walked around the bend, the ocean was much calmer, warmer and delightful.

reviews.title: Secrets Excellence - A great time!
reviews.text: Service - mostly friendly, although there were certainly exceptions. Almost always very slow though (from bars to restaurants to problem resolution.) They do not work in U.S. time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Secrets from June 11-18 and had a wonderful time. The hotel and beach are beautiful and the staff consistently go out of their way to please you.
reviews.title: The best place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: Arrival - They take your picture when you get off the plane and you can buy it when you fly home. Buy your tourist card, $10 each. After reading all the reviews, I still forgot to bring a pen! We were kind of confused after we picked up our luggage, but someone pointed us in the right direction of our transportation to the hotel.
reviews.title: Fell in love all over again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: Ride to the hotel - Bumpy, yes. But I could have ridden a donkey to Secrets and it wouldn't have changed how exciting it is to be in another country.
reviews.title: Had a great time, you get out of it what you put into it
The perfect honeymoon
reviews.text: Check in - We were accidentally taken to the Excellence Club. When they realized their mistake, they informed us, but told us we could still use the Excellence Club. (which was really nice)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: Room - Building 6, ground floor garden view. In my opinion, the best room in the hotel :-) We were close to everything, didn't have to walk up and down any steps, had a huge private patio and our room was cleaned early in the day. The beds are really hard. Jorge (who works in the Excellence Club) agreed with us. I give the hotel credit for trying to fix the problem by adding extra blankets to sleep on (but next time I'll pack an egg crate or something similar).
reviews.title: Secrets Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'm dumbfounded that this hotel gets good reviews and is so highly rated. It's decidedly a 3 star property, not 5 stars as indicated. The rooms are very dated and run down, old crappy beds and pillows, an old TV and overall poorly maintained. The whole property is pretty run down and old-looking. The food is subpar, not one meal I had would be called great. The service is uneven and the staff is poorly trained and uninformed. Many do not comprehend English. The beach is great, it's the only redeeming factor. However the resort is a 1-hour taxi trip from the airport.
reviews.title: Definitely not a 5 star resort
Unbelievable! Can't wait to visit again!!!
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that this is the nicest resort that we have ever been to. While the road from the airport could be better, it is not as bad as many people on here make it out to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were treated like absolute royalty from beginning to end, with all of the staff meeting any request that we had and always being both overly helpful and friendly. We were greeted by Carlos, who promptly wisked us past check-in to the Excellence Club, which I would highly recommend to all. From then on, every time we saw Carlos, we were greeted with a loud "WILLY!", as if we were long lost friends who had not seen each other in days if not months. Perhaps we will now be long lost friends since we plan on returning to the Excellence both as soon and as often as possible. The entire staff always went out of their way to make you feel at home; it was truly unbelievable.
reviews.title: A slice of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are the types of people who go to a resort and like to find a favorite bartender and waiter, and then visit them often. As far as bartenders go, Kenny was hands down the best! We would go out of our way to go to his bar, usually at Agave, and would recommend that anyone going to Excellence stop by and see him (he makes the best mojitos). As for waiter service, Jonathon in Tuscana was absolutely top notch. I have been in the service industry for ten years and this is the absolute best waiter service that I have ever received, ever. I can honestly not say enough good things about Jonathon and Kenny.
reviews.title: Facilities need work!!!

likes.liked: — Beds by the pool and ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative comment I can muster has to do with the romantic dinner on the beach, oddly enough. While the food was unbelievably good, the waiter stayed on his cell phone the entire time while we sat with empty water and champagne glasses. Aside from that, I can find a bad thing to say about this resort and would be more than happy to answer any questions. Feel free to contact us and we will do whatever we can to convince you that this resort is the place for you romantic getaway or vacation.
reviews.title: Amazing....loved it again....ready for round 3!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just got back from spending a week at the Excellence. We booked through Thomas Cook.
reviews.title: Ok... But not 'Excellente'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: As you have probably read from the other reviews, the road to the hotel is bad. It's quite bumpy and the driving skills over there are appalling, but because we were in an air conditioned coach, it didn't really bother me that much.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay Sep 6-13th!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The arrival at the hotel was ok - i was expecting a bit more after the reviews some people had written on here - my boyfriend had a cold class of sparkling wine, but when I asked for a non-alcoholic drink because i'm 8 weeks pregnant I got the dirtiest look ever and didn't receive a drink!!
reviews.title: Excellence Great pool and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room they put us in was very nice, but there was no handle on the toilet and literally no water in the cistern - this I did not expect from the resort! There was also extreme condensation on the windows and the room smelt of mould. We rang Hector on the front desk and he assured us that we would be moved to a different room within half an hour. We waited for about an hour beofre ringing again and finally got moved to another room in the same building. Even then, we had to call out the maintenance guy to fix our bath and tv... We had room service for our first dinner and I hardly even touched it - the burger was almost raw.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the next few days the service we received from the hotel definitely improved although we encountered more problems because of Thomas Cook. The emergency number they had given to the hotel was incorrect and so we left a voicemail on a random number expecting them to get back to us within the hour as they had promised, ofcourse they never did. If you book through Thomas Cook or any other UK travel agent, I wouldn't recommend going on any of the excursions they offer - we went on three and thought they were all over-priced and not worth spending a day out of the well kept beach and resort.. We went on the Reef Explorer which was the best, Isla Catalina which was a complete waste of our time and the Bavaro Splash which we're waiting for a refund on from Thomas Cook. Unless you are a James Bond wannabe, I don't recommend this trip at all!!
reviews.title: Wedding at Excellence Punta Cana

likes.liked: — Our room was very warm and inviting.

reviews.title: Best of the Best.
reviews.text: I just returned from Secrets, and can't wait to go back. My wife and I were on our Honeymoon and had the time of our life. For starters I'm taking the time to write this review, because after reading some of the negative reviews leading up to our stay, I must say I was a little apprehensive. Secondly it's passing time at work, and the majority of the complainers, I would be willing to bet have nothing better to do with their free time. I've visited 11 all inclusive resorts in the past 3 years with my job and this is by far the best. I've seen quite a few references to tipping the staff, and it's def. appreciated but def. not expected. If I was reviewing Aruba or Jamaica, I'd be singing a diferent tune. Been there done that. No tip No service, or I should say, service at there convience. (Just my experience, been to both twice.) Like the last review I read said, $75 dollars would be fine. The food was great. I was there to enjoy the peacefulness, surroundings, my new wife, not to critique the food. Yes, the food on the buffet wasn't always warm, but what buffet is? Grab a plate of the lbs of fresh fruit, and enjoy yourself. If your main concern is the buffet, I recommend hitting up a Western Sizzler on your way to 6 flags for your honeymoon. Yes the waves were big, but we enjoyed that, if you don't, you can take your pick of a number of fantastic pools. I can also tell you, that you won't have an issue with the language barrier, and if you have the patience of a kindergardner and you do, I feel sorry for your bunkmate. In closing hope I wasn't to obnoxious, and if you are like I was a month ago, worried that that you wouldn't be satisfied, relax we had the best time of our lives.

reviews.title: Married in Punta Cana Paradise
reviews.text: My husband and I were married at Secrets Resort in Punta Cana on May 31. We stayed from May 27th thru June 3rd. I want to say how absolutely beautiful the beach and resort are and how wonderful the staff is. Our wedding pictures, taken by Arturo, are unbelievabley great as is the professional DVD filmed by Francois.

reviews.title: Great weather and time at Secrets
reviews.text: I had some surprises that upset me at first, such as I waited to get to the resort to get my nails manicured b/c I saw on-line that Secrets offered a full service salon and then found out that their manicures are very basic and I could not get acrylic nails there. Well, for a bride-to-be this seemed like a tragedy and I began to cry. When I think of it now, I have to laugh at myself b/c my nails looked so beautiful on the DVD of the ceremony. You have to remember you are not in the United States and things may be a bit different than what you could be expecting. The second surprise sent an apprehensive bride into near hysteria; I was told almost last minute that our wedding ceremony might not be held in the gazebo b/c there was a beach party scheduled for that evening beginning at the same time our ceremony was scheduled. We could have it there if we really wanted but the beach party would be going on around us, or we could opt for being married on the beach. I had my heart set on the gazebo, so I had it there regardless of the beach party although I was beside myself. Well again, I have to admit that I overreacted. When we approached the gazebo in the horse drawn carriage, I saw the gazebo ahead to my left and then to my right I saw the elegant beach party set up for hundreds of guests. Every table was covered in white; every chair was covered with a white chair cover with a big colorful bow on the back. There were elaborate fruit carvings for centerpieces and it was all so breathtaking! It looked like our very own wedding reception awaiting us. My preconceived notion that the beach party would ruin my ceremony could not have been further from the truth, in fact it enhanced the whole experience. Our wedding coordinator, Yulianna, did not fail to make everything perfect. It all turned out much better than I could ever have imagined.

reviews.title: Seven key takeaways you need at Secrets Excellence
reviews.text: It was seven days of fabulous, perfect weather, non-stop food and alcohol. Don't expect Americanized dishes. You are not in the US. Expect to try different things, open yourself up to new experiences. Enjoy being in a country that is unique and special. We found all the food to be deliciously different and satisfying. You may find a few things to be less than perfect but that is life, right? The staff at Secrets work so hard to make your stay pleasant. I saw the same staff members first thing in the morning coordinating activities at the pool and on the beach and then entertaining us by singing and dancing all night. They even came to the disco after they performed for us to make sure everyone was having a great time. These people work so hard and such long hours, how can you not appreciate them?

reviews.title: Spoiled us on our Honeymoon!
reviews.text: We took an excursion to another resort to board a party/snorkling cruise which was a blast. Along the way we saw how the people of the island live in such extreme poverty. I guess that is the choice they have, to live that way or to live on the resort serving tourists all day and all night. And they do it graciously. So, when you go there to enjoy the beauty of their island, their music, and their hospitality, please appreciate all that they do for you and for a fabulous vacation that you will never forget, you can't go wrong at Secrets in Punta Cana. To all the great couples we met there, we hope to see you again and enjoyed meeting you,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the high points of our 7-night stay at this wonderful hotel was the nightly music of Domingo on saxophone and his companion on the keyboard. Not only was his music a real mood-setter, but he also took the time to meet and greet the couples in the lounge area during his breaks. He remembered our names after the first evening and would dedicate a song to us on subsequent nights as we relaxed having pre-dinner cocktails. Wherever he played, in the lounge or out on the plaza serenading us to a dinner under the stars, his sax set the mood of relaxation and romance. Listening to his music was the perfect way to wind down each evening. We came home with a CD and many memories of Domingo and his sax. He enhanced the already wonderful service and ambience at the Excellence Hotel.
reviews.title: Domingo's Wonderful Sax Music

likes.liked: — The hotel was physically beautiful with lots of flora and fauna all around.
likes.disliked: — It was difficult to get to from the airport. The roads were terrible - full of pot holes and the taxi driver almost killed us with his driving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you, Domingo!
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.disliked: — Did not have our reservation when we arrived

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a great getaway. The hotel was beautiful, the service was great and the rooms were nice. The restaurants were surprisingly good. Spice was our favorite. The best recommendation that I can give is DO NOT TAKE THE HOTEL TRANSFERS. If you do you will be stuck on a bus for three hours stopping at every resort along the way. We hired a private car for $110 r/t. The car was waiting for us with cold water and beer. The best part was the trip only took 1 hour from the airport. I will warn you that the roads are awful. My girlfriend got a bit car sick...but the trip is well worth it. Also, there will be many honeymooners there, so be prepared to hear all about the wedding disasters.....
reviews.title: What a great resort!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.text: This resort is great... from the time you get there, you are greeted with champagne and cool towels. The food is plentiful, some restaurants are better than others...
reviews.title: Stress Free Vacation
Amazing Service and Resort
reviews.text: Just returned Jun 28th,

reviews.title: WOW...Loved it!
reviews.text: High end all the way... If you’re looking for an amazing honeymoon this is your place. Beautiful beach, tones of activities, great food without the hassle of reservations and 24hr room service. If you want breakfast in bed everyday not a problem, amazing pizza brought to any location around the resort and every premium liquor you can think of. The resort is very lush with many gardens and wildlife and you might also get wiseld at by Spanish speaking parrots. I'd definitely go back and rate this place 5 1/2**.

reviews.title: Beautiful and Fun!
reviews.text: I just returned from a wonderful week at the Excellence Punta Cana resort and I could not have been happier. The service and food were second to none and all of the employees went out of their way to make you happy. This is my first stay at an all inclusive resort, but I guarantee it will not be my last. Being able to choose from the many fantastic restaurants each night was great. We even enjoyed the nightly shows...they weren't Vegas style by any means, but they were very entertaining. I would highly recommend this resort and Punta Cana to anyone looking for a great vacation.

reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!!!
reviews.text: Excellence was VERY nice. My husband and I had a wonderful honeymoon....we met tons of honeymooners. The resort was beautiful...we loved our room...everything was clean and well maintained. The beaches had soft, fine sand and crystal-clear water. There was always something fun to do if you wanted too:) The only major drawback was that we both got stomach aches toward the end of our trip and for a while when we got home. We did not drink unbottled water so we're guessing it may have been something with the food/sanitation. It was slightly unpleasant but did not keep us from doing things. Also, if you are a real "foodie" this may not be the place for you...some of the food (like fruit, seafood, Mexican) was very good but other foods (Asian, meat) were not very good. Overall, a wonderful place where you feel very spoiled:)

reviews.title: Loved the Entertainment Team
reviews.text: We have just got back from a 2 week stay and it was PERFECT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Excellence Punta Cana - It truly was paradise - special employees to mention are - Omar Taurus (our drink server) Ana from The Lobster House - Juan Carlos a member of the fantastic Entertainment crew and many many other employees they all go above and beyond and make U feel soo Special Gratius to all!!!
reviews.title: Excellence!!!

reviews.text: Mike & Michele Allen - Peterborough On Canada
reviews.title: Dominican Paradise!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travelled to the Excellence Punta Cana Resort Feb. 25-March 10 of this year for the second year in a row and plan on making it our annual destination for years to come. We have been travelling to Punta Cana for 10 years now and after trying out quite a few resorts there is NO need to look any further....Excellence surpasses them all!
reviews.title: Trying to be objective

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When reading some of the previously posted reviews we sometimes wonder if these travellers were even at the same resort we have grown to love.
reviews.title: Best vacation EVER.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At this resort you can be as busy as you want or simply relax poolside or under a beach palapa....no-one forces any activities on you but there are plenty offered if you so desire. There is always someone coming by offering you a beverage a pizza or a smile.
reviews.title: Excelente!
The best time ever!!!!!
reviews.text: well can I just say we had an excellent time! We went for our honeymoon and I read the reviews and was sort of nervous. I really have no idea what these people are complaining about. This place was awsome. The ride there was not nearly as bad and what people made it out to be. The food is great, the service is amazing and it was beautiful. So all those thinking about going, go and ignore all the bad reviews, because it is a great trip! We would go back again in a heartbeat. We met such great people and it was a wonderful expeience. Also I was not bitten once which is amazing because back in the states I get eaten alive!!!!!! So go and enjoy yourself!

reviews.title: Loved everything but the beach
reviews.text: We traveled from 11/6-11/13 with 2 other couples. The ride on the bus wasn't as bad as others have reported. The resort was everything we expected, the accomodations were nice and the service was "Excellente." The only negatives I can report are: the beach - nothing like the caribbean or the Bahamas or the way it is portrayed in the brochures. It was very rough no swimming, just a little boogie boarding. Most of the staff speak little or no English so definitely brush up on your spanish skills. You are definitely in the middle of nowhere and there is nothing to do off the resort. The food was good. I did not care for the Mediterannean and did not eat in the Dominican, the nights we wanted to eat there the only item on the menu was Goat (yuk). The Breakfast and Lunch buffets were great. I really did not care for their frozen drinks I have had much better. By the end of the week I was sticking to the old standard vodka drinks. Be sure to specify brand or 151 rum or you get well drink products. All in all it was a nice vacation. Great value for the money. Would I go back to Punta Cana? NO Maybe I will try Secrets Excellence in the Mayan Riviera.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004
reviews.text: OVERALL:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but a bad experience
Great Holiday
reviews.text: There were many things that went badly on this vacation, granted some of which were outside of the hotel’s control and therefore would be unfair to hold them accountable for. It should also be noted that the resort received extensive damage from a major hurricane about 2 months prior to our trip and (to their credit) it is amazing how quickly and nicely they recovered from it. I’ll do my best to be as objective as I can in this review, however we probably would not return to this resort.

reviews.title: best vacation ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Advice: We brought about $100 in ones and that seemed more than enough, gave a dollar here and there for tips. Bring bug spray. If you want a covered seated area in the pool "reserve" one with your towel or article of clothing by mid-morning. Don't be rude though and just grab one for the novelty of "having" one (same with floating mats) and then be gone all day. Only one morning we 'reserved' a covered bed. We were gone a few minutes and someone had the nerve to move our stuff and claim the bed as their own. There were empty beds a couple down so we took one of those instead but not before removing the person's stuff who stole our original bed and then someone else came along and took it- isn't karma somethin'? lol! The beach area, especially to the left when facing the ocean, has LOTS of covered areas to sit.
reviews.title: Not So...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fabulous time. Too bad the weather didn't cooperate. Still beautiful, relaxing, and a great staff. We especially enjoyed Alexandra who took us on a "wild" bike ride tour of part of the island.
reviews.title: Not Worth Your Money-Select Another Resort

likes.liked: — The Cleanliness and the Luxury of the Hotel

reviews.text: The only drawback was the time of the year--mid July is not the opportune time to visit Punta Cana if you have difficulty with heat and humidity.Most days were excessively uncomfortable--let's just say darn hot!! When a guest feels as though he is suffering a coronary due to an inability to breathe because the air is so heavy--that poses a problem.
reviews.title: Wonderful Mother ,daughter trip

likes.liked: — The staff especially activities staff were incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to DOMINGO....The man is an incredible entertainer who makes a stranger feel like a life long friend. I still hear Domingo's magic performed on his alto and tenor sax. DOMINGO was the highlight of our trip.

likes.liked: — food, drinks, service, event staff, the hotel it's self
likes.disliked: — Excellence club, pool closed everyday at 6 p.m.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My mother and I went on our yearly vacation together and we really enjoyed the Excellence.We enjoyed meeting people from all over the States and Europe.The activities crew was the best .I 've never seen people work so hard ,constantlykeeping something going from exercising,beach volleyball,to cooking on the beach.Luis is incredible,he never stops.Ines,Andreas,Franklin ,Francisco are all wonderful and don't get the credit they deserve.Everyone else gets tips for their service but I don't think they do.If you go tip them.We enjoyed our food especially the beach party.The shows at night were good and afterwards you can go dancing in the disco.The traveling Retailers I think it's called Dominican Fur were all very niceand were very good about bargaining with you.The rooms were clean ,maid service was good. The pools were very nice.The staff as a whole were well you know EXCELLENT! I reccomend the Excellence and will return probably next year.The helicopter ride to the airport was wonderful.I really enjoyed the beach that's where all the action is.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was great and you will love it for sure. The only thing that I felt ripped off on was the excellence club. Don't buy any of the upgrades because you don't really get anything. A DVD player, a club lounge that is the worst one on the hotel, a couple robes, and internet for $600. My fault, you also get fruit delivered to you room that you can get all day everyday all around the resort. Everyone is treated the same and treated very good. Use the money you would waste on the excellence club and go to the spa for a few days or do something else with it. I was sold on the excellence club when I showed up, thinking I was getting the upgraded honeymoon deal that cost the same amount of money(still not worth it). I did not even figure it out until the end of the week before I really realized that I was sold a different package. When I went and talked to the manager Rafiel (Don't know how to spell his name), I felt like he was telling me that he understands the excellence club is a rip off but sorry about your luck. I think the resort is truly great. I think the staff is the best, except the manager by the check in desk. The wait staff and cleaning staff are great. I would have paid 600 more for the week to stay at this resort for sure. Just don't tell me that it's going to be that much better and you get all this stuff if you don't. Everyone get's treated the same. I would not pay $30 for the week to have access to the excellence club. Everyone in the pool was saying the same thing about the excellence club so I was not the only one for sure. I just wanted a refund for it because it was that much of a joke.
reviews.title: Beautiful Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 8th visit. The resort continues to improve facilities and service. One of the few adutl-only resorts in Punta Cana.

Even the dreaded bus ride from the airport was efficient and relatively comfortable. The pot holes are being repaired (all be it one at a time) and a new highway is under construction from the airport to feed most of the hotels in the Punta Cana area. It should be a quick and bump-less drive in a year or five.

reviews.text: Here are some secrets for those who have not been to Secrets before:
reviews.title: Staff response... Our Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1) If there is a rolled up towel on a poolside chair it means that the chair is NOT being used. The staff put out towels on all the chairs first thing in the morning. We thought that people were getting up at 5AM to stake a place by the pool, but that is not the case and there's lots of room. Only the chairs with the opened towels are the ones in use. Even at full capacity, there was plenty of room for everyone.
reviews.title: Beyond Excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2) Use the spa. There is a FREE steamroom, sauna, as well as a big hot pool with two cold pools for alternating hot and cold. Great for the skin and very, very refreshing. Try it first thing in the morning and just before dinner. Other spa offerings, such as massage will cost you extra.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
