Roberto Puello who was the Club Manager did an extra special job of making us feel welcomed! We took some great pictures that looked like postcards. The food was excellent the Pizza was close to being our favorite. The shows were great especially the Michael Jackson and the 70's & 80's night. The French resturant was probably our favorite. We will definately be back for an anniversary trip. We made some friends but had plenty of privcacy as well. The rooms were great and everytime we left and came back it was cleaned, towels restocked and the bar was as well!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!!!!

likes.liked: — The scenery and the food! The SPA was fabulous!
likes.disliked: — The bus trip there from the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Excellence from Dec. 20 to Jan. 3,2009. We were there to celebrate our 30 anniversary and get away from life for a while.
reviews.title: Good Not Great

likes.liked: — The beach and the service personelle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving- Yes, the road is long and bumpy but part of the experience. We used IBK for private transport. Top notch! We didn't get the welcome when we arrived at the resort but our flight was about 2 hours late. Check-in was smooth and efficient. No chance for an up-grade though as they were full. The bell-hop took care of our bags very quickly and escorted us to our room. This walk through the resort was not a good pre-view as all the lights were shut off and we couldn't see where we were going. A real safety issue. This happens every night!
reviews.title: A truly fantastic place Xmas & New Year
"The Excellence" Awesome Resort
reviews.text: Rooms- We had a 3rd floor garden-view room. The rooms are not great. They are out-dated and are really in need of up-grading but were clean. The beds are hard but I rather liked them. Issues with the toilets leaking and not flushing. They did come and fix it but it shouldn't happen as often as it did. The balcony looked out onto very pretty grounds but is very tiny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach- Beautiful. We are beach people and really appreciated the room to spread out. You never felt crowded. However, the water is extremely rough. I had read this before and thought I was prepared but I was not. Coming from the prairies, we had no concept of how strong an undertow could be. There was a drowning when we were there and the lifeguard pulled two other people out. People, please listen to the lifeguard..they are there for your safety.
reviews.title: too sick to enjoy

likes.disliked: — not having good drinking water and the mildew smell in our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I LOVED my honeymoon at Excellence Punta Cana. There were several things about the resort that were outstanding but there were also a few things you should be aware of or you will be disappointed. We went for 6 nights for our honeymoon. We had a Jr suite, Excellence club, garden-view.
reviews.title: excellente' but not perfecto

likes.disliked: — there were a lot of smokers and they didn't limit where ther could smoke. Very smoky in restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel to the resort: This is bad. The DR is a very poor country and the roads are terrible. We used the airport transportation provided through GoGo travel. The trip took 1 ½ hours and was a bumpy ride. There were several other vacationers on the bus and we had to drop them all off before we got to our resort. The good thing though, was that after stopping at all of those other resorts and then landing at ours I was impressed. Excellence was by far the nicest one we stopped at. I was getting nervous judging by the other resorts.
reviews.title: Best All Inclusive!!!

likes.liked: — The decor, the staff, the overall vibe
likes.disliked: — The Beach Barbeques and spotty poolside service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accommodations- The room was great. We had a Jr. garden-view suite with the excellence club. I would definitely get the Club again. The perks were not everything they said. We got our first basket of rotten fruit and they left it there for the entire 7 days. We never got fresh fruit. We didn't ever get a newspaper either. The Internet access was great though and the guys in the club get you whatever you want. The air conditioner worked great. Bring bug spray because we killed several small bugs a day. Mosquitoes hang out in front of the door and rush in whenever you go in or out. There were also little bugs crawling around in the bathroom. Bring neosporin and bandaids and anything else you would put in a first aid kit. The drs. office was terrible. My husband injured himself boogie boarding and they told us to come back if it got infected. Thanks. They wouldn't even give him neosporin, they told him to go buy it in the pharmacy for $15.
reviews.title: Paradise island but not much to do.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The pool was great and there were always places to sit. The pool mats were hard to come by until the end of the day though. People would hide them in their rooms. The beach chairs were always available as well and if you are in the excellence club, there are hammocks on the beach and they are always open. The beach was very clean and the waves were great. No swimming though, it is rough out there!
reviews.title: Fun 4-Star Island Escape

likes.disliked: — air conditioning sometimes not cold enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mini bar- The room had a ½ stocked mini bar when we arrived and we called to have it filled. After that initial filling, they NEVER filled it again. We even composed a note in Spanish asking them to fill the mini bar and leave us some extra Gatorade and no beer (I know we are weird). We left the note along with a $5 tip. They took the tip and the note and we never saw them, or another bottle of Gatorade again!
reviews.title: Scammed at the Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Excellence for 9 nights and it was fabulous. Firstly, the hour long journey from the airport is not that bad, at least you get to see some of the real countryside and how the locals live.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful with great gardens and water features all around. It is very well looked after, there is always someone working away in the background.
reviews.title: Truly Amazing Honeymoon!

likes.disliked: — Had to ask about what our packag included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was perfect, while not as luxurious as we thought we had no complaints with it, except for the lack of soap. Lucky we had brought our own! There was always plenty of towels and a full mini bar.
reviews.title: Best vacation yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very pleasant and went out of their way to help. Nothing is a problem and everything is done to make your stay as relaxing as possible. We loved the pool and the swim up bar. The beach is spotless, perfect for walking and great fun to swim although the waves were huge.
reviews.title: Specifics on everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast and lunch were great -a wide choice and something to suit everyone. Our favourite restaurants were Spice and Chez Isabelle and while the food is not 5 star by our standards it was perfectly pleasant and we never went hungry.
reviews.title: Not as advertised

likes.disliked: — Emplyees lack of concern or care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Secrets Excellence Punta Cana from 3/7-3/12. We are a married couple in our mid thirties. We booked through AAA--our trip was handled by Travel Impressions and locally by VIP in Punta Cana. I highly recommend this type of booking. Overall, the resort is clean, well-kept, and well-run. We enjoyed ourselves immensely. To us, the quality of service, the terrific location, and the general atmosphere are assets to this resort.
reviews.title: service excellence--a few flubs fixed
we loved the place
reviews.text: Airport:

reviews.title: Not worth all the money
reviews.text: The airport was clean and not crowded. We did pay the silly $10 travel card fee. The young man who did indeed GRAB our bags at the airport recognized VIP, took us to the VIP representative and stayed with us (warding off cab drivers) until the VIP rep found our van. The VIP representative was professional and informative. He told us we could stop if we wanted to along the way (we elected not to), warned us not to play Caribbean Keno, and informed us that all our food and ice would be prepared with purified water (not to drink the tap water but not to worry about bathing or brushing our teeth). On both the way to the resort and back to the airport, we were driven in a clean, air conditioned van with only one other couple (they stayed at Sunscape also managed by Amresorts). The ride was far from bumpy and was under an hour.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004
reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: I Love Secret Excellence Punta Cana Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: We were not met with the rumored mimosas, cookies, or towels but we checked in quickly and efficiently and were advised to grab a late lunch while our upgraded room was made ready (we chose the upgrade as view is very important to us). When we went to find our room, the bellhop found us, showed us to the room, explained the electricity, the jacuzzi, the mini fridge. He did not linger for a tip (as most bellhops do)--my husband followed him out the door to tip him.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there from 20 to 27 March 2012.
reviews.title: Amazing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach is extremely beautiful and extremely spacious.
reviews.title: fun vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Waiter/bartender service (to your chair) all over the resort, whether you were sitting at the beach or at the pool.
reviews.title: Fun and relaxation at the Excellence...
3 star....... Maybe !
reviews.text: Beautiful (long) pools.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Caution........... Be aware that you may come home with a food born pathogen. We did. We recently stayed at Excellence, Punta Cana. My husband and I were on our honeymoon. I can't explain just how bad it is there. Looks are not everything! That is all Excellence has going for them. From the minute we arrived they began the games for more of our money and allot of services that were never received.
reviews.title: Shame on Excellence!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DO NOT UPGRADE . It's a scam just to get more money. We learned the hard way and our honeymoon felt more like a job. We constantly were lied to and treated poorly from the staff at the front desk. I hope they change owners and clean house of thier horrible employees that give the good people of the Dominican a bad name .SHAME ON THEM.
reviews.title: Our first All inclusive resort- and was the best choice we ever made

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you have terrible taste buds and like glamorized buffett food thats rotten, this is the palace for you!! Just be sure you bring antibiotics from whatever infection you could possibly receive. We have traveled all over, this by far was a huge disappointment. I would never return to such a dreadful place. Please reseach other resorts, the Dominican is a beautiful country . Save time, happiness and frustration and stay away from this hell hole, they call a "resort". Tampa, Florida
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay, Best Entertainment Staff Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked this trip with my wife to Excellence from reading other reviewers giving it great reviews and let me tell you that all the great reviews are the real truth of what we experienced .From the Service, the food, the attention to details are all great and so forth. Our fav restaurant was the Toscana for breakfast and lunch and dinner by far. We have to to say we where dissapointed with the food at Chez Isabelle but all the others where good. Just remember that this resort is about 45 to an 1hour from the Punta Cana Airport.
reviews.title: The Best Ever

likes.liked: — The Beach, The Staff, The Friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from an unbelievable week-long stay at Excellence Punta Cana. Everything from our room, the food, the atmosphere and ESPECIALLY the entertainment and entertainment staff was top notch. As two single girls looking for a relaxed vacation, it was perfect. The pool is gorgeous (and huge!), and the beautiful beach with turquoise water is just steps away.
reviews.title: Excellente Excellence Punta Cana

likes.disliked: — matress was a little too hard for me but ok for husband

reviews.title: Loved Secrets
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went through Apple Vacations to Secrets Excellence in Punta Cana. It was absolutely beautiful. Before we left I was reading alot of reviews and was kindof nervous about some of them. I'm not sure why people are giving this resort bad reviews. The people there are very friendly, a little spanish helps though. Simple things like hello, how are you, good night, thank you. We had a wonderful time, the grounds were absolutely beautiful, food and drinks were very good. We also went on two excursions outside of the resort. Highly recommend the Outback Safari, our tour guides were great and you get to learn about the Dominic. Highly recommend this resort!

reviews.title: Loved Secrets Excellence
reviews.text: We went to Secrets for our 5th anniversary. We were there from June 17th to June 24th. It was absolutley the best experience and exceeded any and all our expectations. We have traveled to many other resorts in Cancun, Jamica, and St. Martin. Secrets was the "BEST"!

reviews.title: Enjoyed Secrets!
reviews.text: We arrived on Thursday and were greeted with Mimosas and warm smiles. We let them know we were staying in the excellece club level and we were swept away to a beautiful club room for check in and orientation to the resort. I suggest spending the money for the excellence club because of the extra ameinties and the great staff. I miss Ivan and Alex already. They took care of anything we needed or wanted to do during our stay. Not to mention the drinks there and the view from the balcony from the club.

reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful......as long as you are not a snob
reviews.text: Rooms:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: They are top- notch! They are beautiful. All have a four poster bed, mini bar, and jacazzi. We tipped the maid and mini bar guy everyday. The cleaniness of our room we superb. We also had certain request for our mini bar. For example, more coca cola lights and Presidente beer. We had no need for the apple juices and regular cokes. This of course was taken care of.
reviews.title: We will be back!!!
Absolutely beautiful!
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our honeymoon (July 12-19) at Secrets Excellence, and cannot say one negative thing about the resort. We had such an amazing time that we cannot stop reminiscing!

reviews.title: Perfection period!
reviews.text: First of all, the staff is so accommodating and friendly. Despite the fact that the staff is paid very little for the amount of work they perfom, they respond to every request with a smile and "It's a pleasure". The shows were fun to watch, the karaoke was terrific, and the daily activities (volleyball, beach olympics, beach BBQ) were loads of fun! The staff members are all so awesome! (We loved Julio, Wilkins, Oscar, & Denise!) They helped make our honeymoon so much fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2004
reviews.text: Every square inch of the resort is beautiful. We were on the second floor in building 14 (the farthest from the lobby) overlooking the beach. Our room was perfect and very quiet. We enjoyed the 3-minute walk to the restaurants/lobby every day and especially loved the privacy of our room. The room was always so clean, and the housekeepers did little things (lined up our shoes, organized my makeup) every day that made our trip extra-special. Every night we would come back to our room to turned-down sheets, chocolates, and our TV set to a channel playing soft music. There was never any need to straighten up or organize anything, as the staff gladly did it all.
reviews.title: Loved Secrets!
beautiful beach
reviews.text: The drinks are great and FREE... what else can I say? Tropical drinks in coconuts, wine, beer, shots, mixed drinks... they do it all.

reviews.title: Don't Even Read the Negative Reviews
reviews.text: The food is good. We loved Quisqueya's lobster bisque and my husband loved the sirloin at the steakhouse. Our honeymoon dinner at the Mexican restaurant under the stars was so romantic and memorable. All the restaurants have a lovely, romantic atmosphere. There is a lot of candlelight and soft music.... very romantic. Breakfast and lunch were always good as the selection is broad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband & I stay at this resort for 7 nights. The hotel was amazing. From the moment we entered the resort we were pleased. The staff attended to our every needs all we needed to do was ask. The food was good not excellent but that was ok. The entertainment staff was wonderful they tried their best to keep the patrons entertained. Special thank you to all of them,( Alexandra, Altagracia, Yohana, Ines and Jilio). In the theater area the ladies Sara & Yuli, the were wonderful they kept the drinks coming. The resort is for adults only which was a big plus. We loved every minute at this resort. we shall return.
reviews.title: love it

likes.disliked: — The long drive to and from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying that the resort it self was beautiful it was very clean. Lets start with the long ride from airport to resort it was long about 1 hour and a half, the driver almost kill a dozen people riding in there mopeds on the way to the resort. We then got greeted in the hotel lobby with cheap champaing. The room was nice but full of bugs and the main problem I had of the room was the mini bar I call 3 times cause it was not working the drinks were hot, when i finally got someone to check it out I was told the mini bar was suppose to keep the drink in room temperature. ( how the hell someone is gonna have a beer in room temp) I complained a thousand times to the General manager Mr Montanez problem never got fixed. The food was horrible, room service was the worse I rather eat White castle hamburgers. If you pick this resort for the Lobster House like I did don't is the worsed restaurant in the resort. The only restaurant that's good is the Spice, and the grill. By the way if you wanna eat at the Agave keep waiting every night it was full so you really eat at 2 of the 8 restaurant. the service was horrible in the restaurant it takes about 15 min to 30 min to get your order if you are lucky. And the service by the pool or through out the resort is also horrible I think this resort is under staff. I use the word horrible a lot cause thats the only word that can described my experience in the resort. If you are a beach lover (once again like my self) don't waste the money go some were else the water are rough that they do not let you in the water 1 out of 6 days i spend there i got in the water. But wait it gets better the sand had this animals call sand flies they will eat you up even if you have bug spray and they itch like hell and it last for 6 days. VERY IMPORTANT DO NOT TRUST JHONNY HE SELLS THE EXTRA ACTIVITIES in the resort he's from Prieto tours he is a crook. I got charged on my credit card more then I wast told I'm stil disputing the matter. I bought a trip to Saona from him and when I went on it the people in charge from prieto tours are all crooks they will push you to buy things example don't buy the mamajuana. bring your own towels you will never find any. this resort is not worth the money I pay it should not be call the excellence it should be call the Horrible punta cana
reviews.title: I hate it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 day stay at Excellence for our 4 year anniversary. It was truly excellente!!!! I have been studying the reviews on a daily basis before we left for D.R., so I feel I was ready for anything! All of the bad reviews are just from Americans who are used to the Ritz Carlton in Palm Springs, Florida! Remember people, you aren't in the US anymore!!!
reviews.title: Must go to Excellence!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First and formost I want to address the infamous drive from the airport to the resort. While it is in fact a long drive, we enjoyed every minute of it! You get to actually see the country for 45 minutes. You see how people live, animals, and mountains in the distance. I will, however recommend getting a private taxi at the airport for this drive. We bypassed the bus full of people and went straight to a taxi stand. All you say is "Excellence Punta Cana" and agree on a price before you leave. Our price was $60 one way. So $120 roundtrip and completely worth it! We were on our way within 2 minutes of picking up our luggage. We didn't have to wait on the bus to load everyone on and also drop people off at their resorts along the way. The roads are also not as bad as the reviews said. Again people, you are in a 3rd world country!
reviews.title: A very nice vacation experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now to the resort! It was beautiful! We booked the Excellence Club Oceanview room. We enjoyed the club ammenities very much. We were on the quiet end of the resort which was nice. The room was very clean. We never had issues with the air conditioning and never lost power. Our ocean view was not a complete oceanview but that was no big deal. We spent all of our time at the beach anyways. The staff is very friendly and some speak english very well and others not as well. They are always cleaning the resort! We were amazed at how much they cleaned!
reviews.title: "Excellente" at the Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from celebrating our six year anniversary. Our vacation was very relaxing. This was our 4th luxury all inclusive, and although this hasn't been our favorite, we can honestly say that we were satisfied with our stay.
reviews.title: Another lovely vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previously discussed in prior reviews, the trip to the the resort is a bumpy one. It was actually more bumpy than I could ever prepare for, but not so bad considering you sort of know what to expect and you get a tour of the area. This was great considering we did not leave the resort once we got there.
reviews.title: Excellence is just Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at all of the restaurants for dinner with the exception of Toscana (which of course we ate at for breakfast). There was always a great variety of options to choose from at each restaurant and even on the room service menu. Our favorites were as follows: The Steak House (best t-bone we have had in awhile), Spice, and Barcelona. We didnt really care for Chez Isabelle suprisingly. Maybe it was what we ordered. We found that the food overall was a hit or miss. Still there were so many options to choose from, so no reason to complain.
reviews.title: Excelente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please be prepared to eat at the outdoor restaurants. I hate to admit, but the mosquitos are probably the only thing that caused us to be distracted during this vacation. Even though we thought we were well prepared by bring 90% Deep Woods Sports Off, this didn't matter. I can honestly say that the resort makes an effort, however there is only so much they can do. You can expect to get bit.
reviews.title: 'Excellente' and So Much More...
Excellence Resort
reviews.text: The rooms were average compared to other resorts we have stayed at, however they were always clean. We had a pillow top added to the mattress prior to arriving so we were ok. Our maid came twice a day and our refrigerator was well stocked twice a day it seemed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Excellence for a week over New Years Eve. This was our first all inclusive resort vacation in the Caribbean, although we both have vacation experiences elsewhere in the world to compare it to.
reviews.title: Great relaxing resort with a bad beach

likes.liked: — pool - fantastkic pool....and quiet relaxed enviornment
likes.disliked: — beach - such a beautiful beach, for it to not be swimmable was such a tease!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Excellence had very nice rooms, a fantastic pool, good bars and drinks, and what we would rate as 3-star restaurants. We were pleased with the overall service and condition of the resort and would call the facilities 4-star.
reviews.title: Terrific holiday from Ottawa Canada

likes.liked: — excellent rooms, excellent food, excellent service, small bus from airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we were very disappointed with the beach and water. The ocean was quiet rough and murky - basically un-swimmable for us, an ex-lifeguard and a good swimmer both used to the Atlantic. The beach was ok, though not the lovely white sand one can find elsewhere in the Caribbean.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only other major complaints about the resort were that their best restaurant, Chez Isabel, was closed without notice the entire time we were there and we had one very stormy day that was a complete wash since the resort is very isolated and there is no where to go and nothing to do when the weather doesn't cooperate. Our entertainment options during the storm were Snakes on a Plane on a big screen or board games (and, of course, booze).
reviews.title: Excellente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend the resort to couples interested in a very relaxing, easy going vacation. Not so great for families with adult children (the resort is 18+ only) or for singles.
reviews.title: Never wanted to leave . .
What a trip!!!
reviews.text: My fiance and I just returned from 7 nights at Secrets Excellence...where we pretty much did absolutely NOTHING and LOVED IT!! When we arrived on July 7th, the resort was only partially full, which was great. Our room wasn't ready at 1:30 when we arrived, but we brought our swimsuits and went straight for the pool. Hung out there till around 4:30, went straight to our room on the second floor in building 10, and WOW...we were concerned about not being in an ocean view, but the garden is lovely...nice balcony, clean room, no problems! Air Conditioning worked great. Only problems were with the maid service: it seemed that every day when we were ready to come in from the beach and nap around 3 pm, they still hadn't been to our room...even though we requested early maid service. Nothing to whine over, though.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The best things: Being able to do whatever you want, be it nothing or excursions/etc...also loved the Banana Mamas and Isla Carribenas, YUM...lying in the pool on a raft is heaven, keeps the heat away. Loved the grill food---especially the chicken nuggets and hot dogs (better than you'd expect! And we didn't have to leave the pool for lunch). Met some great couples--Hi to RJ and Gwen, celebrating her birthday---and John and DeeAnn, celebrating their honeymoon. Also, about the Casino--we won several times but only on Roulette and only by playing once, winning, and cashing out immediately ("One time for the Good Times!!" LOL). The shows were silly but enjoyable; the bar staff were GREAT---especially Jose at the Beach bar, we hung out with him practically every night. Make sure you tour the property when you arrive, we didn't find the sports bar or the second pool till our 3rd day. We tipped but only when someone did a great job; I felt that sometimes they expected a tip in advance, got a little sick of that. The beach is gorgeous but rough when you get in past your waist--I got nailed by waves. Food was fine, roomservice was better than expected; we had ours pretty quickly. Neither of us got sick; but we stayed away from fish, fruit and salads (and therefore gained 10 pounds a piece while we were there!!!) Met a lot of people that had been careful and got sick anyway, figured we drank enough to kill the bacteria. That could be the answer...LOL. Also, we did the Speedboat excursion with snorkeling---great fun!! Long ride there but take beer or something to shorten the trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2004
reviews.text: The bad/not so great: Everything was wonderful until the resort became full on the 12th--they never made adjustments for the additional people (more bartenders, food at the outside grill, etc). Also, lots of people got rafts at the crack of dawn and put them on their chairs---we were told to just take them. No staff came around and took them, the guy said there were just too many everywhere---a little annoying, people!! Also, the "beds" outside were all taken when we came through at 2 am---what the ??--no idea how you get one of those. Bring STRONG sunscreen--we had on 30 and my nose still blistered, even when I was reapplying every 30 minutes (although we WERE in the pool for 5 hours, could be why) The onsite vendors---BIG markup on their stuff! We just went to another one and got a deal on some silver pendants by telling him the other guy's price and what we wanted to spend: got them down from $95 for two to $40 for two. Probably worth 10 bucks but oh well. Also, for the nice restaurant--men, bring PANTS!! We didn't get to eat there b/c my fiance didn't bring any and refused to buy a pair on the resort. Having never eaten there, however, we didn't feel like we missed anything.
reviews.title: 1 Year Wedding Anniversary

description: This quaint, colonial-style resort is the ideal destination for couples seeking secluded romantic getaways. Nestled among palms on a perfect white-sand beach on a remote stretch of Punta Cana's Caribbean shoreline, Excellence Punta Cana provides the perfect All-Inclusive playground for adults only and is also home to a world-class spa, state-of-the-art fitness center and an exceptional range of activities and services.
